title: Software Engineer Associate
description:
Are you looking for an exciting career as a Software Engineer at one of the top Aerospace and Defense Companies? A fulfilling position that challenges your mind, grows your skills, and contributes to our Nation’s most critical missions is right in front of you! At Lockheed Martin Space, we advance the frontiers of science, help the military protect what matters most, and solve problems that others think are impossible. We have challenging missions that will inspire and innovate!

Our Next Gen Geo Mission Processing team is looking for a motivated Software Engineer to augment our Agile Team in support of our Overhead Persistent Infrared (OPIR) Mission Processing Product. We are seeking a dynamic Software Engineer to help support these critical efforts, which include development of solutions in support of OPIR sensor data stream processing to be used for missile warning.

As a member of a high-performing team you must be passionate about your trade, focused on mission system quality, and supportive of timely delivery of features and capabilities. This position involves design, development and maintenance, and testing of mainly C++ code. Challenges will include adapting and testing framework for new interfaces, developing APIs, and developing mission processing applications.

This position is in beautiful Boulder, Colorado location which has numerous amenities such as a fitness center, daily rotating food trucks, and a collaborative and modern agile workspace.



To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin cultivates an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package.
qualifications:
- Strong experience in software design and development.
- C++/C programming experience.
- Linux OS background/Experience developing in a Linux environment
- Experience developing maintainable code as well as performing unit, integration, and regression testing.
- Must have strong teamwork skills.
- Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills.
skills:
- Active secret clearance.
- Mission Data Processing Experience
- Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university in an engineering or scientific discipline.
- Experience developing, deploying, and supporting AWS based systems.
- Demonstrated understanding of agile development within a scrum team.
- Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, etc

title: ISSO - Classified Cybersecurity
description:
Active Secret clearance is required with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance.

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) will support Information Systems (IS) located at the LM Wooten facility in Colorado Springs, CO. This position will oversee day-to-day information system security operations including hardware and software implementations. Under general direction, the ISSO carries out technical administration of IS in accordance with internal LM and customer security requirements under the Risk Management Framework (RMF).

Job duties include:

- Ensure compliance with contract security specifications, customer governing requirements, DCSA Assessment and Authorization Process Manual (DAAPM), and LM Space security policies.
- Auditing of the IS
- Constant upkeep, monitoring, analysis, and response to network and security events
- Ensures systems are operated, maintained, and disposed of in accordance with internal security policies and practices outlined in the security plan
- Ensures configuration management (CM) for security-relevant IS software, hardware, and firmware is maintained and documented
- Evaluates proposed changes or additions to the information system, and advises the ISSM of their security relevance
- Ensures all information system security-related documentation is current and accessible to properly authorized individuals and maintained
- Assist and conduct security IS education
- Participates in internal/external security audits/inspections; performs risk assessments
- Ensures proper protection and / or corrective measures have been taken when an incident or vulnerability has been discovered
- Communicates, implements and manages a formal Information Security / Information Systems Security Program together with ISSM and contract program security representative (PSR)

Candidate will typically have a Bachelor's Degree and 5+ years of experience.
qualifications:
• Active Secret clearance with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance.
• IS auditing experience.
• Knowledgeable of operating system security requirements.
• Hands on experience with industry standard Information Assurance tools.
• Have and maintain a DoD 8570 IAT Level II certification.
skills:
• Understand Agile operations while possessing sound business acumen.
• Demonstrated technical experience in Windows and Nix based operating systems and command line.
• In-depth experience in system hardening, analysis, and vulnerability management
• Previous experience working with system accreditation requirements and RMF implementation.
• Experience implementing complex technologies within large environments, possessing strong technical skills.
• Have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline and 5 years of relevant work experience or a master’s degree and 3 years of relevant work experience.

title: Electronics Engineer, Space Protection, Mid Career, Top Secret
description:
Are you ready to take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO?

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

For over 100 years Lockheed Martin has been designing, building, fielding and supporting some of the most advanced technology in the skies. Are you ready to design what's coming next? Be part of a highly innovative team providing ingenious solutions to complex technical problems facing the aerospace industry. Our culture inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

Join us at Lockheed Martin as an Electronics Engineer within the Space Protection Programs (SPP) line of business. In this role, you will:
• Be working on innovations in a variety of microcontroller based board designs.
• Develop and implement motor control designs for emerging technologies for space.
• Complete integration and test of EDU and flight designs and both the component and system level.

WE NEED YOU TO HAVE:
• Experience with full product life cycle - Knowledge of the definition, interpretation, and implementation of design requirements, coordination and execution of hardware designs, development and integration of hardware for both custom and procured electronic assemblies in accordance with all Lockheed Martin Space engineering process specifications
• Attend Design Reviews and provide technical feedback.

YOU WILL TYPICALLY HAVE:
• 9 - 15 years of professional experience for this role.

• Must have an active Top Secret Clearance, thus US Citizenship is required.

BENEFITS OF EMPLOYMENT:
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Lockheed Martin. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
qualifications:
• Bachelor of Science or higher from an accredited college in Electrical Engineering or related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education.

• Experience with design and/or analysis of digital and analog circuits.

• Experience with high-reliability electronics through the product lifecycle.

• Must have an active Top Secret clearance to be considered for this position.
skills:
• Experience with motor control applications in electro-mechanical systems.
• Experience or willingness to lead teams through challenging engineering issues.
• Strong communication skills, and experience presenting to peers, leadership, and/or customers.
• Adaptable to new situations and demonstrate self-initiative in solving complex problems.
• Experience in Electronics Worst Case Analysis (eWCA) on Circuit Card Assembly (CCA) designs.
• Experienced at conducting failure analysis on Electronics (CCA, Unit, and System Level).
• Demonstrated ability to identify Root Cause and effectively perform Corrective Actions.
• Technical experience in full life cycle development of hardware including design, integration, and test.
• Previous or current responsible product engineer experience.
• Experience in modeling and analysis tools such as OrCAD PSPICE and/or Saber.
• Excellent presentation, oral and written skills.
• Able to work effectively in a diverse team environment.
• Demonstrated strong problem solving and conflict resolution skills.
• Demonstrated systems-thinking through the integration of software, electronics, and mechanical systems.

title: Hardware Design Engineer
description:
This is the one you've been waiting for! Hardware Design Engineer for Lockheed Martin in Colorado Springs, Colorado?

Responsibilities include analysis of hardware characteristics and comparison against design requirements; preparation and review of rack level and site drawings and plans; review of the content and details of technical products; and acting as a technical interface to Command and Control Battle Management and Communications National Team (C2BMC NT) working level counterparts.

Work as part of a small focused team, who will interface with peer-level team members and NT management to ensure high quality products are generated on time and within the resources available.

*Some CONUS AND OCONUS travel required to support site survey and installations as requested*

Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical (some LM locations have on-site medical)
• Dental
• 401k (with generous matching)
• Paid time off including, (we have a 4x10 schedule which means: 52 three-day weekends!)

Learn more about our competitive and comprehensive benefits package:
https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits
qualifications:
*Must currently hold an Active DoD Secret Security Clearance to be considered for this position*


HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE WITH THE FOLLOWING:
Required skill areas include familiarity with the analysis of hardware requirements and support/perform related analysis (heat, weight, power)

Skills using MS Visio to design rack layouts and preparation and review of diagrams and technical drawings

Candidate must be able to demonstrate an understanding Networking concepts including Routers, Switches, and Firewalls

Good verbal and written communication skills
skills:
- Experience designing Juniper hardware in to racked computer systems

- Previous experience with development programs and deployment execution activities

title: Alternate Information Systems Security Manager
description:
This position requires a Secret clearance with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance.

The Classified Cybersecurity Staff will partner with the security team, GPS and SBIRS Programs, and Government customers to perform as an Alternate Information Systems Security Manager (AISSM) for Information Systems (IS) located at the LM Facility in Colorado Springs, CO.

The desired candidate has experience in Information Systems Security Engineering.

In this role, you will:
• Oversee day-to-day information system security operations including assisting the ISSM on all technical security matters.
• Carry out technical administration of IS in accordance with internal LM and customer security requirements, primarily Risk Management Framework (RMF).
• Participating in auditing and continuous monitoring of the IS.
• Review and oversee RMF Package authorizations.
• Upkeep, monitor, analyze, and respond to security events.
• Document compliance actions within the approved automated compliance tracking system or develop a plan of actions and milestones (POA&M).
• Ensure systems are operated, maintained, and disposed of in accordance with internal security policies and practices.
• Ensure configuration management (CM) for security-relevant IS software, hardware, firmware, and system documentation.
• Ensure all information systems lifecycle management documentation are maintained.
• Evaluate proposed changes or additions to the information system, and advise the ISSM of their security relevance.
• Assist and conduct security IS education and training.
• Participate in internal/external security audits/inspections; performs risk assessments.
• Assist in conducting investigations of computer security violations and incidents.
• Ensure proper protection and corrective measures are taken when an incident or vulnerability has been discovered.
• Implement and enforce Information Security Policies and Procedures together with ISSM and CPSO.
qualifications:
• Final Secret Clearance with the ability to obtain a Top-Secret Clearance.
• DoD 8570 IAM Level III certification.
• Demonstrated technical experience for Windows, Networking, and NIX-based operating systems.
• Knowledge of cybersecurity requirements and best practices.
skills:
• Knowledge and experience in performing Agile and Lean operations.
• Sound collaboration, business acumen and project management skills, understanding of DevSecOps and CI/CD.
• Experience with information system accreditation authorities and their implementation of the Risk Management Framework (RMF).
• Experience with industry-standard Information Assurance tools and processes such as auditing, scanning and configuration management software.
• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a related discipline with 9 years of professional experience, or equivalent experience/combined education; or Masters degree in related discipline with 7 years of professional experience.

title: Software Quality Engineer Senior
description:
Your invitation to an exciting future!

Space technology connects millions of people around the world and we’re accelerating tomorrow’s breakthroughs to help our customers stay ahead in an ever-changing world. At Lockheed Martin Space, we are motivated by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin Space employee. Space values your skills, training, and education. Come and experience your future!

Lockheed Martin Space Systems Company is seeking energized individuals who are passionate about building the space technologies of tomorrow. We have an opportunity for a Software Quality Engineer (SQE) Senior at our Littleton, CO location. You will be supporting our Navigation Systems Quality Assurance efforts within Space Operations. We invite you to join the team in keeping this nation and our allies secure and enjoy a career with tremendous impact beyond any one individual. We offer you rare career opportunities and challenges in a program with a rich history and exciting future.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking. Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.

qualifications:

• Technical experience in a related discipline (e.g. Quality Engineering, System Safety, Engineering, Manufacturing, Integration & Test).
• Ability to obtain Secret Security clearance, COMSEC and Crypto. Position is contingent upon receiving final Secret clearance.
• Current US Citizenship.
• Knowledge of Quality systems/processes and knowledge of external quality standards such as ISO9001 and/or AS9100.
• Software Quality or Engineering experience in Requirements Analysis, Design/Development, Product Integration and Test.
• Ability to interpret software design and code (C/C++) to verify implementation of requirements.
• Ability to work off-shifts and weekends. Although infrequent, position will require some periodic off-shift support for development and testing tasks.

skills:

• Experience with ClearQuest, ClearCase, DOORS, and other CM tools.
• ASQ Certified Software Quality Engineer (CSQE)
• Strong knowledge of Industry recognized Quality systems / models such as Capability Maturity Model Integrated (CMMI) and International (ISO)
• Experience in software systems test
• Knowledge of SAP/ERP
• Experience with JIRA and Confluence
• Experience with Code Collaborator
• Current Secret Security clearance and ability to obtain COMSEC and Crypto.
• Current MRB certification. Experience making Preliminary Review / Material Review Board decisions.
• Experience in executing test planning, processing, and non-conformance processing including root cause analysis and corrective action development.
• Experience in establishing quality assurance performance metrics for identifying process improvement.
• Experience with US Military customers.
• Experience working with DCMA and other government customer support organizations.
• Experience working with space vehicle subcontractors and suppliers.
• Understanding of export control and ITAR requirements for working with international suppliers.
• Lean/Six Sigma black (or green) belt.
• Proficient skill level with Microsoft Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage and develop rapport with the team and multiple partners and external customers.

title: Optical Payload Electronics Manager
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet…or any other… are with Lockheed Martin (LM) Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus, and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) as an Optical Payload Electronics Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are seeking a leader with a track record of delivering to technical, schedule, and financial commitments, and driving the best customer and enterprise value as a result. We want someone who demonstrates a breadth of technical knowledge across multiple functions and a variety of program experience. Our Optical Payload Electronics Manager is someone with exceptional communication skills, and a proven ability to represent the organization to customers, employees, and partners.

As the Optical Payload Electronics Manager, you will:
• Partner with Lines of Business (LOB), OPCoE Program Development, and OPCoE Payload Systems Engineering teams to develop architectures in a consistent manner to allow use of common products
• Develop transition plans for low TRL products from the science and technology community
• In coordination with OPCoE Program Development, propose and execute IRAD projects with a goal of standardization and maturation
• Enhance relationships with strategic suppliers and other LM Business Areas (BAs) to compliment the in-house OPCoE team
• Perform as part of the Integrated Product Team (IPT) in cases where an OPCOE make is selected
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers. Fold emerging mission trends into product roadmap to ensure a discriminating edge
• Implement and lead technical knowledge management to develop and maintain core competencies, key technical skills, knowledge continuity and facilitate career advancement opportunities to employees
• Handle staffing requirements sustain engineering capabilities and preserve critical skills.

Ideally, you will have a background in electro-optical engineering and possess degree from an accredited program in a related discipline, such as Bachelors degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or other Engineering/Science field.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
qualifications:
• Demonstrated experience with delivering space flight electronics
• Established experience in developing technical talent and building pipelines to sustain technical expertise within the organization
• US Citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a government clearance
skills:
• Have experience in interfacing, biasing and controlling focal plane assemblies. For passive EO, we work with staring and scanning FPAs in the visible and IR domain. For active EO, we work across multiple types of lidar receiver arrays, primarily GmAPD
• Have experience working across space and ground applications. Our systems include ground-to-ground, space to ground (and vice versa), and space to space
• Have experience in developing payload controller and image data processors. The Payload controller typically receives high level commands from the bus controller. The payload controller is responsible for decomposing bus commands into smaller, discrete commands that may be pushed out to a variety of nodes on the payload
• Have experience in developing image data processors. These image data processors may perform a range of processing. The processing may be relatively straightforward computations such as bad pixel mapping and non-uniformity correction. More complex processing may include machine learning/deep learning and autonomous decision making
• Have experience in developing laser/lidar controllers. These controllers must have the ability to control and sequence a laser system through various turn on/turn off sequences. This includes the laser power sources (DC-DC convertors) and any thermal regulation
• Variety of customer experience and exposure across Space Lines-Of-Businesses. Mission applications for optical payloads include remote sensing (earth pointing and deep space), directed energy, and missile seekers/interceptors
• Excellent communications skills both verbal and written with the proven ability to communicate
• Demonstrated ability to drive closure and resolve complex technical issues/challenges.
• Prior Full Spectrum Leadership roles with proven experience leading employees to perform productively and foster relationships in a cross-functional team environment
• 12+ years of demonstrated technical expertise (10+ years with a Master’s degree or above)
• 4+ years demonstrated hands-on expertise in space OR complex hardware/software systems
• Current TS/SCI clearance

title: Digital Engineering Integrated Product Team Lead
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

The RF RADAR and Payload Center of Excellence (RFCOE) is looking for a hardworking and energetic project manager to lead development and project execution for the next generation of digital processors. Digital processors support a multitude of space missions for military, commercial, civil, and special programs customers. Digital processors process data from secure communications, remote sensing, and bus applications. This opportunity is for an Integrated Product Team (IPT) leader to lead a multi-disciplinary team to design, develop, test and deliver a cutting-edge digital processor utilizing common products, leveraging state-of-the art digital technologies, while adhering to program budget and schedule constraints. The role is challenging, but also very rewarding with significant potential for career exposure and advancement on high-visibility programs. We invite all who have a passion for space, digital technologies, and project management to apply.

title: Digital Systems Architect
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet…or any other… are with Lockheed Martin (LM) Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus, and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

As a Digital System Architect with Space you would lead the development and build of the next generation RF Digital Payload Processors and Communication Systems. Communication payloads or RF payloads are needed for every platform and serve missions ranging from human space flight, commercial broadband services, national intelligence, protected communications, navigation and more. Our product portfolio includes a wide range of international and domestic programs, addressing the important needs of our commercial, civil and military customers.

Specific responsibilities include:
•Act as program or proposal tech lead for digital processor design team
•Provide guidance to department as Chief Engineer
•Develop design concepts and technical baselines for payload communications processors and digital payload electronics
•Digital system product development leadership
•Develop digital system architecture
•Provide technical guidance and direction to electronics vendors, production, ATLO and LM design team to ensure compliance of the product with all program requirements.
•Leadership of cross-functional development teams, coordinating with partners (e.g. subcontractor, customer, SEIT, and parts organizations)
•Design, manufacturing, production, test, and ownership of documentation (design, analysis, and interface definition)
•Create technology maturation and risk reduction plans for critical payload elements and satellite subsystems
•Support proposal development activities for objective payload systems
•Coordinate with partners (e.g., subcontractor, customer, SEIT, and multiple M&P and parts organizations) and handle closure of Action Items and Liens.

This position may require domestic travel as necessary to fulfill job responsibilities.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin nurtures an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

•Medical
•Dental
•401k
•Paid time off
•Work/life balance
•Career development
•Mentorship opportunities
•Rewards & recognition

qualifications:
• Proven leadership of cross-functional development teams, vendors, and subcontractors to ensure product compliance with customer requirements
• Ability to develop and analyze technical requirements, perform trade studies, conduct major design reviews (e.g. PDR and/or CDR) and allocate functions down to subsystems and hardware/software.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including a demonstrated ability to interact effectively with customers, management, and peers.
• Ability to write technical sections of customer requests for information (RFIs) or proposals, including developing presentations to describe the technical approach in a clear manner.
• Prior experience with phases of product lifecycle (e.g., SRR, PDR, CDR, MRR, and TRR).
• Active TS/SCI Clearance
skills:
• Broad understanding of spacecraft electronics
• Existing CPE certification
• Working knowledge of current US DoD Protected Satellite Communications (i.e., Milstar/AEHF)
• Experience developing Analog/Digital interfaces
• Experience with full-life cycle of software or ASIC/FGPA development
• Prior satellite communications design experience
• Proven ability to develop analytical modeling and simulation tools/environments
• Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field

title: Optical Payload: Optical and Sensor Components Manager (Optics & FPA)
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as an Optical Payload: Optical and Sensor Components Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are looking for a strong leader to develop high TRL (test readiness level) products for missile and space hardware. You will report and be deployed into Space Engineering and Technology (E&T) Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) organization. This position will lead a group to develop a product portfolio consisting of focal plane assemblies (FPAs), optics, thin films, telescopes, calibrators and other strategic electro-optical components. This group will work with the OPCoE Chief Engineer, architects and Fellows to develop product maturation plans in accordance with Lines of Business (LOB) roadmaps and need dates. This group will keep abreast of SOA (State of Art) as well as SOP (State of Practice) to provide subject matter expertise (SME) across all program lifecycles. This group will be consulted on make/buy decisions for their products and would be the execution team if a “make” decision was determined by the program. You will significantly impact the enterprise through establishment of a dedicated team working to drive common, high TRL products across programs.

As the Optical Payload: Optical and Sensor Components Mgr, you will:
• Partner with Lines of Business (LOB), OPCoE Program Development, and OPCoE Payload Systems Engineering teams to develop architectures in a consistent manner to allow use of common products
• Develop transition plans for low TRL products from the science and technology community. An example will be to work with the ATC (Advanced Technology Center) and ensure handoffs are understood between the two organizations.
• In coordination with OPCoE Program Development, propose and execute IRAD projects with a goal of standardization and maturation. You will identify targeted products to reach a state that can be considered “high TRL”, “commodity” or “Off- the-Shelf”.
• Enhance relationships with strategic suppliers and other LM Business Areas (BAs) to compliment the in-house OPCoE team.
• Perform as part of the Integrated Product Team (IPT) in cases where an OPCOE make is selected. Your team will support through all program phases and be responsible for EU (engineering unit), qualification and flight as determined by the program. This may be at the component, sub-assembly or subsystem level.
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers. Fold emerging mission trends into product roadmap to ensure a discriminating edge.
• Implement and lead technical knowledge management to develop and maintain core competencies, key technical skills, knowledge continuity and facilitate career advancement opportunities to employees.
• Handle staffing requirements, sustain engineering capabilities and preserve critical skills.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 14-20 years of professional experience, a Masters and 12-18 years, or a PhD and 9-15 years.

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
qualifications:
• Bachelors degree in a technical discipline (i.e., mechanical, electrical, or other related engineering/science discipline); or equivalent combination of education and experience
• Demonstrated experience in manufacturing, producibility, and/or qualification of optical benches and telescopes
• Established experience in developing technical talent and building pipelines to sustain technical expertise within the organization
• US citizenship with the ability to obtain TS/SCI w/Poly clearance
skills:
• Have experience working across space and ground applications. Our systems include ground-to-ground, space to ground (and vice versa), and space to space.
• Demonstrated experience in developing calibrators, optical components and developing/evaluating optical coatings. We work with a range of optical systems starting from the sub-meter class through apertures greater than 1.5M.
• Demonstrated experience in specification and procurement of focal plane arrays (FPAs). For passive EO, we work with staring and scanning FPAs in the visible and IR domain. For active EO, we work across multiple types of lidar receiver arrays, primarily GmAPD.
• Demonstrated experience in developing and/or procuring complex sensor subsystems. These types of sensors are typically high reliability, radiation hardened, high throughput, high resolution systems that may in the visible or infra-red regimes.
• Have experience in developing space qualification plans for components
• Excellent communications skills both verbal and written with the proven ability to communicate
• Demonstrated ability to drive closure and resolve complex technical issues/challenges.
• Variety of customer experience and exposure (intelligence, defense, science, and commercial markets).
• 8 years of demonstrated technical expertise
• 3 years demonstrated hands-on expertise in space OR complex hardware/software systems
• Prior Full Spectrum Leadership roles with proven experience leading employees to perform productively and foster relationships in a cross-functional team environment
• Current TS/SCI/Poly security clearance

title: Software Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Innovation arm of the Business Innovation, Transformation, and Enterprise Excellence (BITEE) Organization in Lockheed Martin Space is focused on revolutionizing how Lockheed Martin Space does business. Many of our team projects are the tip of the spear in imagining, promoting, establishing, and delivering the future of Lockheed Martin Space in this decade and beyond.

This position is for a Software Engineer on our BITEE Innovation team responsible for designing and developing innovative software solutions within this organization. Initial projects within this position’s portfolio include HiveStar™ and SpaceCloud™ with wide impact across the business. The ideal candidate has a strong desire to learn, is self-motivated, and a team player while applying strong technical aptitude to an incredible team developing creative and novel technical solutions that have a lasting impact on our world.

Roles and responsibilities include:
• Evaluating, rapidly pilot then develop and implement new technology
• Working in an agile and DevSecOps environment
• Partnering with peers and internal stakeholders to shape project requirements through industry research, stakeholder interviews and emerging trends
• Collaborating with project managers and development team to ensure projects are on schedule
qualifications:
• Proven work experience in a software or technical field
• Software Engineering experiences using Python/Go/C++/Java or Object Oriented
• Knowledge of or experience in Agile Methodologies
• Degree in computer science or related technical discipline/experience
• Strong problem-solving skills
• Requires US Citizenship
skills:
• Knowledge of or experience in Agile Methodologies
• Results driven, strong problem-solving/out of the box thinking skills
• Experience in Services, Micro-Services, Software Factories, DevSecOps, Cloud and Service Oriented Architectures
• Understanding of Agile Methodologies with test-driven development, automated test, continuous integration and regression testing
• Strong communication skills enabling teamwork and collaboration across Agile Development Teams
• Working knowledge of Git, GitLab, Jira, Confluence, Jenkins, or other CI/CD toolsets
• Experience using message broker like RabitMQ/Kafka/etc.
• Algorithm development experience applied to software engineering solutions

title: Computer Vision Software Engineer Sr Stf
description:
Do you want the chance to re-think conventional wisdom and offer fresh, ground-breaking ideas? LM has new opportunities that provide you with a chance to challenge the status quo and experiment with new digital tools and emerging technologies that transform our mission.
Due to the classified nature of this opportunity we can’t talk about everything you’ll do on this program, but know that you will play a part in building end-to-end solutions and game-changing technology.

We are seeking engineers and scientists interested in a fast-paced design-test-learn life cycle for innovative computer vision projects for space. Utilizing world-class space development and test facilities, LM seeks to engineer the next generation of robust, autonomous space vehicle perception and visible navigation solutions across a variety of challenging missions. With an appetite for accepting risk and a drive for innovation, this team intends to employ the latest software advances in machine learning, autonomous driving, and deep learning research to meet exciting, emerging customer needs.

In this role, you can expect to be immersed within a talented team of engineers working across a variety of potential roles. Maturation of simulation environments across a range of phenomenologies are utilized for synthetic image generation. Simulation based performance analysis within a closed-loop simulation environment, inclusive of vehicle guidance, navigation, and control (GNC) simulations, demonstrates end-to-end mission capability. Development of C/C++ code for space-industry leading avionics platforms run within real-time hardware-in-the-loop (HWIL) environments enables the team to demonstrate platform performance. Test environments involving multiple robots hosting the rendezvous and proximity operation sensor platform and space object mockups enables test-like-you flight autonomous demonstrations to retire risk prior to flight. Within this group, we value employees, their contributions, and work hard to build cohesive teams aligned to meet mission needs.

This is a mid career position that typically requires having 14 years of professional experience.

This position requires no clearance at start but you must have the ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret w/SCI .

• Strong C/C++ programing background
• Kubernetes / Docker Experience
• DevOps experience

skills:

• Experience with flight software development and autocode to C++
• Experience going through a spacecraft program life cycle encompassing requirements generation, design, analysis, integration, verification, and testing of a system for space applications
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, collaborative team environment

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

This Software Engineering position requires participation in the integration and test of complex mission application software within Space Protection Programs at Lockheed Martin. Responsibilities include requirements review and assessment, test procedure and automated test development, test implementation and troubleshooting, and test data review in order to validate complex software engineering solutions. Responsible for frequent use, and application of software engineering standards and techniques, including Object Oriented Design and Agile development techniques. Will work in a highly collaborative environment with frequent and direct interaction with peers and occasional customer interactions.

Experience with Python, C/C++, WindRiver and Linux OS, and Object-Oriented design is preferred. Strong ability to perform on a small highly skilled team in a dynamic environment. The preferred candidate must work under general supervision, multi-task, adapt to change, and possess strong organizational and communication skills. Experience with algorithm/object-oriented development is also desirable. Occasional odd and/or extended hours may be required to meet program milestones.

In this exciting role you will:
• Conduct software test planning, perform functional software testing, automated software testing, system administration, or technical analysis.
• Analyze requirements and work with subject matter experts to identify functional and/or performance test cases.
• Evaluate test results and provide feedback to team members and project stakeholders.
• Learn new tools independently.
• Identify opportunities for improvement in current processes and implement new processes.
• Deliver strong communication skills (written & verbal); ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
• Participate in an Agile development team.
• Create testing environments
• Create and manage test documentation
• Identify test gaps/risks and propose tests to fill gaps
• Create schedules for testing and test completion

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

• Minimum Bachelors degree and 2 years of experience in software test engineering or a related technical discipline.
• Experience designing and documenting applications test plans.
• Exposure to the development of plans and procedures for software testing, including integration/execution, detailed data analysis, and preparation of software test.
• Top Secret Security Clearance (TS/SCI) with CI Polygraph
skills:
• Programming background in C/C++ and Python.
• Experience supporting the development of flight vehicle GNC/FSW architectures.
• Experience with Git, GitLab, and Jenkins.
• Experience with Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes.
• Knowledge of embedded systems architectures and test experience using embedded systems.
• Experience working in an Agile environment, Agile Development/Agile Process Experience.
• Demonstrated experience developing or specifying standards, methods, or procedures to determine product quality or release readiness.
• Demonstrated experience regression testing, negative testing, error or bug retests, or usability.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong social skills, and ability to build consensus among peers while building solid relationships with team members
• Demonstrated experience using automated testing tools

title: People Analytics & Technology Expert
description:
Lockheed Martin is embarking on a transformational journey – destination the future. HR systems, data science and analytics are Lockheed Martin’s path to the future where technology and information drive decisions that create value across the entire lifecycle. This includes how our workforce will operate, as well. To help us along this journey we are seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Senior Staff People Analytics & Technology.
This position can be summarized in this way:
• You will play a key role in managing the design, development and implementation of analytic solutions roadmap
• You will be able direct the analysis of actual and predictable integrated operational activities in human capital and business systems to obtain a quantitative, rational basis for decision making through logical, scientific or economic techniques - using data to create meaningful business insights
• You will have an opportunity to manage the strategy, design and creation of datasets required for analysis that use a variety of modelling and measurement techniques using mathematical and statistical methods
• You will provide consultation to clients and potentially lead cross-functional teams to address business issues

Job Description:

This critical role will drive the technical transformation of the RMS People Analytics & Technology organization by designing and implementing ways to leverage automation, driving optimization of product and service delivery.

Ability to extract, reconcile, analyze, and communicate data in a business context providing insights and storytelling. If this is something that sounds interesting and challenging to you, this is the right opportunity for you! The successful candidate will report to the Senior Manager, People Analytics & Technology for Lockheed Martin. The team is responsible for providing HR insights to HR professionals and business leaders, interfacing with a broader group of Business Area teams on reporting and HR systems.

You will work directly with HR functional organizations to understand human capital needs. You will determine what the long term technical strategy and roadmap should be, what data is relevant, pulling data out of complex databases and integrating disparate data sources.
In this position, the selected candidate will:
• Define and design of human capital analytic solutions to support stakeholder requirements and desired business outcomes
• Build of visualizations or reports that connect data to information that end-users can successfully use to obtain insights and act
• Improve established reporting tools by studying current practices and designing modifications
• Maintain user confidence and protecting operations by keeping information confidential
• Understand and communicate operational impacts of system changes
• Demonstrate inclusion and engagement with the team to achieve results
• Maintain on-going communications and strong working relationships with Human Resource colleagues, including HR Business Partners, Labor Relations, Compensation, Global Diversity and Inclusion, and Talent Acquisition.
• Utilize software tools/Solutions (e.g. SQL, Business Objects (BOBJ), WebFocus/FOCUS, R, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, WordPress, PeopleSoft, Brassring) and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Access) as needed
• Perform other duties as assigned to support the organization objectives
The position requires the ability to extract data from a data warehouse using a GUI front end tool and also a SQL-like tool. In addition, extracted data must be formatted into organized easy to follow reports and visualizations to help paint a picture for the client, making the data easily understandable. With ever increasing demands for data to influence and drive workforce decisions, expect a fast pace with requests ranging from simple to highly complex.

Influence RMS’ people strategy development and management through strategic workforce planning process.
qualifications:
• Demonstrated experience defining and implementing advanced analytic strategies.
• Demonstrated experience defining and implementing advanced analytic capabilities and data protection/discretion.
• Demonstrated experience designing and implementing company-wide or high impact data analytics processes and tools.
• Demonstrated experience managing HR systems transformation initiatives, including developing project plans, preparing corresponding communication plans, identifying milestones, deadlines and metrics to assess outcomes/results.
• Demonstrated experience delivering results for the business though proactive insights, storytelling and effective communication.
• Demonstrated experience in communication and collaboration.
• Demonstrated learning agility.
• Facilitate decision making.
• Demonstrated emphasis on customer focus and outstanding customer service.
skills:
• Demonstrated knowledge of the field/discipline of Human Resources practices, processes and regulations.
• Demonstrated knowledge and experience with Workforce Planning, Analytics, & Reporting practices, processes and results.
• Demonstrated experience leading others, setting the vision/strategy and direction, partnering with relevant orgs to achieve the intended results.
• Demonstrated experience using relevant software tools/solutions e.g., Microsoft Office, SAS, MatLab, SPSS.
• Demonstrated experience consulting with executives, Human Resources, and business leaders.
• Demonstrated ability and experience coaching leaders and employees.

title: Systems Engineer -DevSecOps and IT
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

You will serve as a DevSecOps and IT Engineer for a team tasked with setting up an open architecture infrastructure and developing web services and modern user interfaces to meet mission needs. You must use data gathered from integration and system tests, i.e. system metrics and service telemetry, to classify and solve critical issues. You will adapt to constantly evolving environments and provide support when and where needed. You will write and maintain cutting edge infrastructure as code (IAC) to support micro-service based products.

This role will work side by side with outstandingly hardworking and experienced engineers, while having the opportunity to lead and mentor less experienced individuals on the team.

Must lead systems thinking, coordinate cross-team development, drive quality, and shoulder accountability for major aspects of mission and program success. Candidate should be capable to adapt to agile methods that will require a multifaceted execution approach, depending on the time-phased needs of the program.

Summary of Key Duties for this position:

• Passionate about the craft, steadfast about product quality and focused on our customer’s mission. We constantly measure our employee’s success and reward our top performers through salary increases, bonuses and awards.
• Designing state-of-the-art concepts while delivering inventive and affordable capabilities in a new and emerging area of protecting USG space assets. This is a mission that you can be proud of, knowing that you are making a lasting difference in the world and in the Space domain.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin nurtures an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

description:

Do you have a passion for working on emerging technologies? Navy Strategic Programs (NSP) is experiencing significant growth, and we need your expertise to deliver amazing new technologies to our customers. We have opportunities that include sophisticated Hypersonic Technology, Glide Body Strike technology, and other key technology insertions. The early design and engineering phase provides you with tremendous career growth potential along with important assignments to stretch and hone your expertise. This is a rare opportunity to work closely alongside our Navy Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) partners to field a number of future strategic systems that the nation urgently needs.

Lockheed Martin is looking for a highly motivated Electrical Integration Engineer to become a member of the Weapon Systems Integration team.

As an Electrical Integration Engineer, you will:
• Support power modeling, channelization/electrical interconnect management, and review of electrical subsystem designs to ensure compliance with the technical baseline
• Maintain end to end electrical compatibility, functional allocations, and margins across Weapon System elements
• Develop and maintain weapon system electrical interconnects and interface control documentation to manage the weapon system technical baseline
• Verify that the Weapon System aligns with both the Command Media and program technical requirements

Successful candidates typically have a Bachelor's degree and 0-2 years of experience.

This position is in one of the Coolest places to work: Denver, Colorado.
qualifications:

• Ability to obtain DoD Secret Clearance, therefore, U.S. Citizenship is required.

title: Systems Engineer Staff - Lead Process Engineer - Clearance Required
description:
Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems is looking for Cybersecurity professionals to work on Cross-Domain Solution (CDS) products that protect and defend the information flow of critical and time sensitive data on many military application and networks.

As part of the Spectrum Convergence Team, you will ensure cyber security standards are met and implemented. The candidate will be leading and working in an agile Kanban development environment on RedHat Linux-based OS, and will be responsible for supporting elements of the design/sustainment/development efforts. The candidate should be a well-rounded software developer but with demonstrated ability in C/C++/Java. The candidate can expect to work in agile teams. The candidate should be a self-starter that is attentive to details and works well in a team environment.

Duties to Lead Process Engineer on a Kanban team, including software design and development in a Secure Edition Linux environment, SE Linux Policy creation, maintenance and debugging, message parser development, XML schema development, network protocol integration, shell scripting development, and software test.

Additionally, the proven ability to provide software engineering and team leadership, team member support and mentoring along with programmer guidance and assistance is required. Flexibility and agility to changing requirements and programming languages, and a desire to learn and experience new opportunities to improve team performance is a must.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.


BENEFITS OF EMPLOYMENT:
We may not know what's going to change the world next, but chances are we're already working on it, and you can, too. As part of our culture of innovation, you’ll have outstanding benefits and amenities, an inclusive work environment, ongoing career development and support, rewards and recognition to honor your hard work, and more.


HERE ARE SOME OF THE BENEFITS YOU CAN ENJOY:

- Medical (some LM locations have on-site medical)

- Dental

- 401k (with generous matching)

- Paid time off including, (we have a 4x10 schedule which means: 52 three-day weekends!)

- Work/life balance, family-friendly environment

- Career development, career-growth, and lots of learning opportunities for aspiring minds

- Knowledgeable, supportive, and engaged leadership

- Mentorship opportunities

- Rewards & recognition

- Generous Tuition Reimbursement

Whether you’re new to the area or just like being socially involved, we encourage everyone to explore among our many employee networks and employee resource groups we have on-site. Whatever your interests, there’s likely a community at Lockheed Martin for networking, becoming familiar with the area, and enjoying common activities with coworkers.

Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package. (https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits)

title: C2BMC - Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM)
description:
Lockheed Martin is a Cyber Security pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing employees are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, and education. Come and experience your future!

This position is located in Colorado Springs, CO and will support the C2BMC TO38 program. The Information System Security Manager (TO38 technical lead) will be responsible for technically leading a diverse team of Information System Security Officers (ISSOs) in the performance of mandatory information system security tasks on assigned information systems utilizing DAAPM, JSIG, DoD 8500, NIST, ICD, CNSSI, C2BMC Security Authorization documentation and other related DoD documents in support of training and operations.

The C2BMC ISSM will be overall responsible for the cybersecurity posture of the C2BMC TO38 program. The selected candidate will coordinate and participate in tasks that include, but are not limited to configuring information systems, providing information for the development of System Security Plans, establishing and maintaining configuration management plans, install/update/remove computer equipment, preparing documents to gain government approvals to operate information systems, weekly system audits, anti-virus software management, sanitizing systems and components, establishing new user accounts, preparing for and supporting inspections, participating in enterprise initiatives, continuous monitoring, self-inspection review, etc. The selected candidate will champion and be directly responsible for the performance of continuous monitoring, incident response, auditing, RMF management, SLA, and other cybersecurity requirements as required.

Successful candidate should be knowledgeable of information technology security principles, various computer/network operating systems, and Microsoft suite of applications. This is a multi-tasking environment that demands customer service, communication, leadership, and organizational skills. Mission requirements may require other than first shift work. Other duties as assigned.
qualifications:
- This position requires a secret clearance, active IAM III credentials, and active CSSP Analyst credentials.
- Must maintain DOD 8570 IAM III and CSSP Analyst certifications for the duration of your employment
- Previous experience working with the Defense Counterintelligence Security Agency (DCSA), NISPOM requirements, and their implementation of RMF
- Frequent use and application of technical principles, IA methodologies and concepts.
- Demonstrated experience managing and championing all aspects of an RMF package
skills:

- Excellent verbal, writing, and typing skills

- Experience managing an Information Assurance Program

-5+ years in a direct RMF management role.

title: Systems Engineer Staff – Requirements and Verification
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

Navy Strategic Programs (NSP) is experiencing significant growth and we need your expertise to deliver amazing new technologies to our customers. We have opportunities that include sophisticated Hypersonic Technology, Glide Body Strike technology, and other key technology insertions. The early design and engineering phase provides you with tremendous career growth potential along with important assignments to stretch and hone your expertise. This is a rare opportunity to work closely alongside our Navy Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) partners to field a number of future strategic systems that the nation urgently needs.

As a Systems Engineer for Requirements and Verification, you will:

• Be deputy to the Requirements and Verification Technical Lead responsible for verification execution across multiple flight tests
• Review, maintain, and improve the Requirements and Verification Baseline
• Model requirements and verifications within system design using Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) principles
• Work closely with the SPC counterparts to develop, test and field a strategic system
• Work closely with our subcontractors to ensure build up of the system capabilities

title: Sr. Automated Test Engineer, Top Secret
description:
Take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO!

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Come be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products! We provide the resources, inspiration and focus. If you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

We are seeking an Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE) System Integration and Test Engineer to work within the Military Support Programs. We are looking for you to perform EGSE designs and improvements, support and test execution, develop and review test documentation, and oversee the execution of subsystem and system-level EGSE testing.

KEY DUTIES FOR THIS POSITION INCLUDE:
• Documents test results and test discrepancies.

• Leads troubleshooting efforts.

• Provides technical guidance to test team members on EGSE products.

• Moderates among the interests of multi-disciplinary groups to synthesize EGSE test plans and test procedures that acknowledge technical, schedule and cost constraints.

• Perform to functional and technical specifications and standards, aid in solutions for hardware/software interface problems, and ensures integration of the entire system or subsystem through test product execution.

• Coordinates subsystem and/or system testing activities with support organizations.

• May perform impromptu briefs of test status or discrepancies to customer representatives or program management.

Please note that this position will require on call support to a 24/7 test operations schedule.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR YOU TO HAVE:
• 5 - 9 years of professional experience for this role.
• We need you to have an active Top Secret clearance to be considered.

BENEFITS OF EMPLOYMENT:
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Lockheed Martin. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
qualifications:

• Experience or coursework with electronics products design, integration or test.

• Position requires an active Top Secret clearance.
skills:
• Some experience in the area of automated test
script development, debug, and execution.
• Experience or coursework with Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE) products.
• Ability to work with a team through the execution of established procedures and processes.
• Experience in Space Vehicle Integration and Test, including: Baseline Ambient, Full Functional, Thermal Vacuum, Acoustic, EMC/EMI, and Final Functional.
• Experience with electrical test equipment such as bench top power supplies, oscilloscopes, digital multi-meters, signal generators.
• Experience in Space Vehicle Test Operations including the test development process, test execution, data analysis, and anomaly resolution.
• Experience with RF.
• Ability to read and interpret basic software scripts.
• Familiarity with Automation Framework.

title: Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Engineer
description:
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world's hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus. If you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

We are searching for a Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Research Scientist to join our exceptional team. This position will be working across several Lockheed Martin Business Areas (BAs) to build and deploy AI/ML models into air, land, sea, AND Space! This position will provide a unique experience mix with research, prototype development, and software to hardware toolchain development all within the domain of AI/ML software and targeted hardware platforms.

As an AI/ML Research Scientist, you will work with guidance from project leaders and technical leads to:
• Develop, integrate, and implement products to assist adding perception, motion/mission planning, controls, etc. functionality in LM products and platforms
• Translate requirements and apply requirements to development code, integrating autonomy, AI or machine learning algorithms to LM products and platforms
• Determine software methods to best acquire and execute knowledge
• Implement algorithms into software to aide in development of systems which can recognize patterns and perform specific functions
• Be responsible for various phases of developing and maintaining AI-based software from requirements generation, software design and development to integration, testing, troubleshooting and debugging, and implementation
• Review test outcomes, conducts troubleshooting, and works to debug issues
• Interface with other teams involved the development lifecycle for perception, mission and motion planning, simulation and modeling, testing, etc.

We are looking for someone with a strong problem solving mindset: ability to develop create solutions to difficult problems often requiring integration of conflicting and, at times, ambiguous or incomplete data on a fast-paced schedule. You should have the demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex design information, technical decision and issues to both highly technical and non-technical peers. We are also looking for the ability to build and maintain relationships, collaborate with others, engage in constructive conflict, and manage interpersonal dynamics. You should also be comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic multi-disciplinary environment.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 2-5 years of professional experience or a Masters/PhD and 0-3 years.

description:

Due to the classified nature of this opportunity we can’t talk about everything you’ll do on this program, but know that you will play a part in building end-to-end solutions and game-changing technology.

The Military Space Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GN&C) team is made up of enthusiastic and talented individuals that design and produce the hardware, algorithms, and software required to solve the challenging problems of controlling these systems in a harsh, zero-g environment. Are you willing to join this team and help solve these challenges in a team environment using your GN&C academic background and industry experience? title: Staff Opto-Mechanical Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as a Staff Opto-Mechanical Engineer!

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate experts across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Join us as a Staff Opto-Mechanical Engineer, where you will support the full life cycle of optical payload development from initial concept design through flight hardware delivery. This position is for an advanced individual contributor and/or team lead, who can perform as a Certified Principal Engineer (CPE) who owns and is accountable for all critical aspects of an assigned product throughout its lifecycle.

In this role, you will:
• Lead trade studies, analyses, design maturation, and drawing delivery for optical benches, optical element layouts, telescopes, optical mounts and fixtures, and active optical elements
• Perform structural (both static and vibrational), thermal and optical performance analyses, working with a cross-functional team of engineers to optimize payload performance
• Likely engage in the planning, conduct, and leadership of research and development efforts in the laboratory and via analysis
• Be a leading member of our team that designs and develops electro-optical instruments and payloads for civilian and military aerospace applications

You should have direct and relevant experience with optical systems, and be an emerging technical authority in opto-mechanical engineering. You will be expected to have proficiency with MS PowerPoint and Excel, and the ability to clearly communicate orally and in writing.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 9-15 years of experience, a Masters and 7-13, or a PhD and 3-10 years.

title: Subcontract Administrator, Staff
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design, and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration, and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

What is it like to work in Subcontract Administration ?

Did you ever think that you could work for a company and actually have an impact on programs that are working on putting astronauts on Mars, creating 3D printed satellites, launching payloads that learn in orbit, or that are developing national defense systems? Lockheed Martin Space technology connects millions of people around the world and we’re accelerating tomorrow’s breakthroughs to help our customers stay ahead in an ever-changing world. We’re shaping the space technologies of tomorrow, today. At Space, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin Space employee. At Space we value your skills, training, and education. Come, join us and experience your future!

quality performance issues.

title: Senior Electro-Optical Research Scientist
description:
Join the Advanced Technology Center (ATC) as an Senior Electro-Optical Research Scientist! The ATC is the research lab for Lockheed Martin Space. Through our own skills and those of our partners—including universities and research labs around the world—we’re able to put vision in motion. While we are a part of LM's space division, our technologies are far-reaching across domains. ATC’s story is written in the success of missions here on Earth and far, far into space. Our innovation extends beyond incremental change. We strive for first-of-a-kind capability with enduring impact. Whatever the application, our charter is to build groundbreaking technologies. At the ATC, we’re inspiring change in our endless pursuit of what’s next.

As a Senior Electro-Optical Research Scientist at the ATC, you will participate in the full life cycle developing optical systems from initial concept design through flight hardware delivery. We will ask you to develop and design optical systems and assume accountability for all critical aspects of an optical system throughout its lifecycle. In this role you will be part of a small research and development team of about five research scientists and technical specialists. You will spend about 50% of your time in the lab supporting multiple programs and projects, and 50% performing analysis work. Some of your responsibilities will include:

• Performing the conceptual design, analysis, detailed design and development of technologies, techniques, and implementations for fiber laser systems, non-liner optical materials, and/or other laser remote sensing systems, with emphasis on fiber laser components
• Working with optical systems and architectures engineering teams, and product engineering to ensure successful systems design, development, modeling and simulation, analysis, and testing
• Performing design trade studies and system verification analyses to optimize candidate system performance, cost, size and weight

We are looking for someone with strong analytic and communication skills who can establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, internal and external customers, suppliers, and other partners. You will be working in dynamic, multi-disciplinary system development teams, participating with architecture design & development teams in active optical system development. You have some exposure in the study of physical interactions, processes, and spectroscopy to understand their applications relative to a particular EO Sensor design. Your experience should include new concept formation & analysis, rapid prototype development, and rapid TRL progression of developed technologies to initial products. We will look to you for strong technical writing, presentation skills for reports, proposals, technical presentations, and interaction with customers, team members, and suppliers. The ability to communicate complex ideas and explain relevant technology and concepts to an audience of both specialists and non-experts will be essential to success.

**This position may require domestic travel as necessary to fulfill job responsibilities

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 5-10 years of professional experience, a Masters and 3-8 years, or a PhD and 0-5 years.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.
