qualifications:
• Experience or familiarity with optical design and analysis software tools. Examples include Zemax, FRED, GLAD, Code-V and LASCAD
• Experience or familiarity with modeling and simulation tools such as MATLAB/Simulink, LabView, MathCAD, and/or Mathematica
• Exposure to and understanding of the systems engineering, integration, and test of work products, tools, and associated processes
• US Citizenship with the ability to obtain a Secret clearance
skills:
• Knowledge and experience developing fiber-based optical sources, developing high power, high energy fiber-based master oscillator power amplifier systems, pulsed front ends, specifying fiber optic devices and components, predicting system performance, and troubleshooting fiber-based systems and components
• Knowledge and experience with nonlinear optical phenomena in optical fibers including stimulated Brillouin scattering, stimulated Raman scattering, self-phase modulation, four-wave mixing, etc., and standard mitigation strategies
• Knowledge and experience using large mode area and photonic crystal fibers
• Knowledge and experience cleaving and splicing a variety of fibers and fiber coupled components
• Knowledge of laser remote sensing and/or laser-based free-space optical communications theory, applications, systems and techniques.
• Experience is desired in end-to-end optical remote sensor development.
• Demonstrated proficiency in proposal writing and other aspects of business development is desired.
• Active TS/SCI clearance

title: Optical Payload Optical Sensor Components Senior Manager
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as an Optical Payload Optical Sensor Components Senior Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are looking for a strong leader to develop high TRL (test readiness level) products for missile and space hardware. You will report and be deployed into Space Engineering and Technology (E&T) Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) organization. This position will lead a group to develop a product portfolio consisting of focal plane assemblies (FPAs), lasers, lidar receivers, optics and optical coatings, calibrators, payload electronics and other strategic electro-optical components. As a Lockheed Martin leader, you will be responsible for recruitment, development, assignment, and evaluation of your team to support our company’s programs. You will initiate efforts to create a welcoming and diverse working environment for our employees.

The Optical Sensor Components department works with the OPCoE Chief Engineer, architects and Fellows to develop product maturation plans in accordance with Lines of Business (LOB) roadmaps and need dates. This group will keep abreast of SOA (State of Art) as well as SOP (State of Practice) to provide subject matter expertise (SME) across all program lifecycles. This group will be consulted on make/buy decisions for their products and would be the execution team if a “make” decision was determined by the program. You will significantly impact the enterprise through establishment of a dedicated team working to drive common, high TRL payload products across programs.

As the Optical Payload Optical Sensor Components Senior Manager, you will:
• Partner with Lines of Business (LOB), OPCoE Program Development, and OPCoE Payload Systems Engineering teams to develop architectures in a consistent manner to allow use of common products
• Develop transition plans for low TRL products from the science and technology community. An example will be to work with the ATC (Advanced Technology Center) and ensure handoffs are understood between the two organizations.
• In coordination with OPCoE Program Development, propose and execute IRAD projects with a goal of standardization and maturation. You will identify targeted products to reach a state that can be considered “high TRL”, “commodity” or “Off- the-Shelf”.
• Enhance relationships with strategic suppliers and other LM Business Areas (BAs) to compliment the in-house OPCoE team.
• Perform as part of the Integrated Product Team (IPT) in cases where an OPCOE make is selected. Your team will support through all program phases and be responsible for EU (engineering unit), qualification and flight as determined by the program. This may be at the component, sub-assembly or subsystem level.
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers. Fold emerging mission trends into product roadmap to ensure a discriminating edge
• Implement and lead technical knowledge management to develop and maintain core competencies, key technical skills, knowledge continuity and facilitate career advancement opportunities to employees.
• Handle staffing requirements, sustain engineering capabilities and preserve critical skills.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensi
qualifications:
• Demonstrated experience working across space and ground applications
• Established experience in developing technical talent and building pipelines to sustain technical expertise within the organization
• Bachelors degree in technical discipline (i.e., mechanical, electrical, or other engineering/science discipline), or equivalent combination of education and experience
• US citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI with Poly clearance
skills:
• Current TS/SCI clearance with Poly
• 12 years of demonstrated technical expertise
• 5 years demonstrated hands-on expertise in space OR complex hardware/software systems
• Demonstrated experience with developing and implementing focal plane arrays (FPAs). For passive EO, we work with staring and scanning FPAs in the visible and IR domain. For active EO, we work across multiple types of lidar receiver arrays, primarily GmAPD.
• Demonstrated experience with payload electronics. This may include payload controllers, image data processors, mission data routers, sensor bias and interface electronics, and laser/lidar controllers.
• Demonstrated experience in signal chains. A signal chain typically refers to the command and routing/processing/dissemination of mission data. There are usually multiple components that encompass a signal chain: front end E-O convertor (i.e., focal plane), image data processor, image data router, and image data storage
• Demonstrated experience in developing calibrators, optical components and developing/evaluating optical coatings. We work with a range of optical systems starting from the sub-meter class through apertures greater than 1.5M.
• Demonstrated experience in developing active EO (lidar systems). We work with fiber and planar waveguide lasers. These lasers output a range of power densities that encompass use in long range imaging applications all the way through directed energy applications.
• Have experience in developing space qualification plans for components
• Excellent communications skills both verbal and written with the proven ability to communicate
• Demonstrated ability to drive closure and resolve complex technical issues/challenges.
• Variety of customer experience and exposure across Space Lines-Of-Businesses.
• Prior Full Spectrum Leadership roles with proven experience leading employees to perform productively and foster relationships in a cross-functional team environment

description:
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds the satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. title: Opto-Mechanical Staff Engineer - Payload Structural Analyst
description:
The Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) at Lockheed Martin Space is seeking an experienced Opto-mechanical/Precision Mechanism Engineer and Structural Analyst to play a leading role in our design and development work on a variety of passive, active, and directed energy optical payloads. We are looking for engineers with strong mechanical skills, highly relevant and related experience, and a keen interest in optical payloads. OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members coordinate specialists across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

With a focus on structural analysis and design, integrated into full payload design and performance assessments, you will be engaged in the design, specification, and procurement support for optical bench assemblies, optical mounts and fixtures, mechanical ground support equipment, alignment fixtures, and a range of related assets to be used in the development, test and manufacture of optical payloads. This position calls for a consistent, responsible, deadline-meeting professional who will:

• Work under broad guidance from senior engineering and program leadership;
• Collaborate and contribute across the design team;
• Guide the work of junior and emerging engineers;
• Engage with prospective and selected suppliers;
• Deliver robust documents and briefings, and;
• Support customer reviews

We are seeking a team member with strong written and oral communication skills. You should also demonstrate strong quantitative skills and the ability to apply them to the formidable mechanical challenges of precision optical payload subsystems.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 9-15 years of professional experience, a Masters and 7-13 years, or a PhD and 4-10 years.

**Please note that this role can be located in Sunnyvale, CA or Louisville, CO.

• US Citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance

title: Obsolescence Sustainment Engineer
description:
Stop your job search here! Can you be the Obsolescence Engineer Lockheed Martin is looking for in Colorado Springs, Colorado?

The Obsolescence Sustainment Engineer is directly responsible for the implementation and continuous improvement of the End of Sale/End of Life (EOS-EOL) program on the Command and Control, Battle Management, and Communications (C2BMC) Operations, Maintenance, and Sustainment (OM&S) Task Order.

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:
- Conduct analyses of the hardware and software in use throughout the enterprise to track, identify, research, (EOS-EOL) conditions, then develop and present creative and thorough solutions to mitigate or resolve the obsolescence condition

- Frequent contact with Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and cross functional product teams

- These potential courses of action are presented to management, task order leadership, and the government customer for approval

- Coordinate with impacted product teams to ensure understanding and full implementation of approved courses of action to resolve obsolescence conditions

- Frequent coordination and support of other members of the Sustainment Product Team

title: Global Positioning Systems  Engineering  Manager
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Lockheed Martin Space is seeking a System Engineer Manager to join the GPS IIR/IIR-M/III On Orbit Services (GPS OOS) team. The GPS OOS team supports on-orbit operations and sustainment of GPS satellites, and support GPS systems, software labs and simulators. The successful candidate will manage a multifunctional team consisting primarily of sub-contractors, GPS Operations Specialists, Software Engineers and System Engineers whose responsibilities include performing on orbit support, sustaining ground support systems, labs and GPS simulators, responding to solicitations in support of sustainment system improvement and updates, GPS satellite operations support and program execution efforts. The System Engineering Manager will
• Manage support system, lab and simulator resources for GPS OOS to include staffing, onboarding, training and retention planning
• Provide oversight and support to GPS OOS program area Engineering proficiency sustainment including IT system sustainment, SW sustainment, simulator operations, and lab sustainment
• Provide guidance to a Systems Engineering team to include full Systems Engineering lifecycle processes for support systems
• Provide programmatic and proposal support and serve as a technical point of contact for GPS OOS support systems
• Support project/program execution including budget/spend plan monitoring and adjustment, personnel manning, reporting and stakeholder/communications management for projects related to GPS support systems, labs, and simulators
• Support project/program planning including developing, reviewing , monitoring execution of and recommending changes to Statements of Work (SOWs), specifications, and systems engineering plans as well as program and project schedules
• Ensure that System Engineering plans, processes, and requirements are implemented in the team’s efforts
This is both a working position and a management position, in which the successful candidate will utilize a flexible team to ensure all program requirements are met and staffed as necessary. This is a dynamic, fast-paced engineering team supporting multiple LM and government stakeholders, often with conflicting priorities. Some travel to the LM Waterton Campus in Littleton, Colorado, Cape Canaveral Space Force Station and other sub-contractor, LM and customer sites will be required (less than 10% of the time).

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds the satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

Come join the Space Based InfraRed System (SBIRS) program as a Software Engineer. In our product-based organization, we are looking for talented engineers to contribute to the success of our sustainment and modernization of the SBIRS system in our labs and at our operational sites. In this role, you will be required to exercise a breadth of skillsets, including software development and troubleshooting, data stream verification and troubleshooting (employing an understanding of networking concepts), and installation and general management of our software (employing infrastructure concepts). There will be a focus of learning and gaining ownership of our Data Distribution product, but there is plenty of opportunity to contribute to various projects across the SBIRS ground segment. The candidate will be expected to become familiar w/product capabilities, architecture, and software baseline to include interfaces, be able to install/config the software, contribute to the future/growth of product capabilities.

At times, this role may require working odd hours in support of our lab and operational environment, and may include occasional travel to our CONUS operational sites.

And, the opportunities don’t stop there on SBIRS; while the candidate will have a primary assignment, there are several other efforts around our Boulder facility that will desire your engineering skills in the future.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin champions an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

title: Security Representative Senior
description:
At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education.

Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Come and experience your future!

Candidate will be required to perform a variety of SCI security related duties and ensure the coordination of SCI security practices and procedures. Security disciplines include, but are not limited to, personnel security, Security Awareness Training and Education, indoctrinations, debriefings, security incident investigations, access control, visitor control, badging, and, classification management utilizing ICDs and customer specific guidelines.

Candidate will serve as the security representative for several classified programs. In that capacity, the candidate will be responsible for implementing related security requirements as established by NISPOM and other customer-specific directives; and maintain responsibility for the daily security functions of assigned programs.

This will involve effectively interfacing and partnering with internal and external customers; and effectively partnering with members of peer organizations to meet program milestones. Participate in, enhance, and support security education, training, and awareness programs. Assist program and security management with anticipating emerging compliance requirements and implement compliant solutions to operations. Support internal/external inspection activities. Support program activities related to classification management, clearance processing and document control. Assist in developing and publishing of security directives, policies & procedures and training curriculums. Investigate security violations and facilitate appropriate company response.

Candidate should have the ability to develop effective partnerships with program management. This position may require occasion travel.

title: Optical Payload Designer, Senior Staff
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should consider joining the Lockheed Martin Space Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) as a Staff Optical Payload Designer! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members bring together authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

As an Optical Payload Designer, your responsibilities will include being the lead optics designer on one or more of OPCoE's critical programs.

title: Integration and Test Technical Coordinator (ST CFPT)
description:
There are people who say some ideas are impossible, unattainable, or unrealistic. Then there are those of us who work at Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems. As a part of the Lockheed Martin community, we take on the biggest, baddest challenges in the world and find solutions using creativity and collaboration.

And where the solutions don’t exist? WE INVENT THEM.

So, if you’re looking for the challenge of a lifetime and a team of the brightest minds in the world, Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you. If you’re looking for a place where learning is a way of life, Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you. And if you’re looking for a career that’s just as fun as it is hard work, well…you know.

Join us today and let’s make a difference together.

Lockheed Martin. Your Mission is Ours.


What does this role look like?
This position requires daily technical and programmatic interaction with civilian, military, contract leadership, and technical personnel at MDIOC and Highway 83 LM Offices. Candidate will engage the C2BMC (Command & Control, Battle Management, and Communications) system for the purpose of technical support to Agile Product Teams and I&T functional area to conduct hardware, software, and system level verification and validation testing.

This position joins the ST (System Test) CFPT (Cross Functional Product Team), working closely with the I&T Technical Lead for the C2BMC National Team. The role is responsible for scheduling lab test and installation activities, coordinating with BMDSS (Ballistic Missile Defense Support Systems), IRES Contractor, and MDA BCX and the C2BMC NT Integration Team on spiral release installation and integration schedules in the test labs.

The selectee will also be responsible for coordinating with key partners in test lab build out design meetings, reviews and assisting in the resolution of test technical issues. Additionally, they will coordinate with technical leads and product owners to execute installations in sync with Task Order baselines.

The integration and test technical coordinator will execute test tasks in accordance with program processes, supporting the functional area manager in resource planning, aiding the PERB, PCCB, and ROMB and other boards as appropriate, as well as supporting Task Order and customer reviews, metrics collection and analysis.

In addition, this role will focus on the following tasks:

-Manage Formal Program Risks Related to T02 activities and verification
-Provide EE/Proposals support for T02 for Verification and PR resolutions
-Support EOS/EOL activities related to Ops and Deployment
-Position will require frequent travel to Schriever AFB -Missile Defense Integration and Operations Center (MDIOC).

Benefits of Employment:

We may not know what's going to change the world next, but chances are we're already working on it, and you can, too. As part of our culture of innovation, you’ll have outstanding benefits and amenities, an inclusive work environment, ongoing career development and support, rewards and recognition to honor your hard work, and more!

Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

-Medical (some LM locations have on-site medical)
-Dental
-401k (with generous matching)
-Paid time off including, (we have a 4x10 schedule which means: 52 three-day weekends!)
-Work/life balance, family-friendly environment
-Career development, career-growth, and lots of learning opportunities for aspiring minds
-Knowledgeable, supportive, and engaged leadership
-Mentorship opportunities
-Rewards & recognition
-Generous Tuition Reimbursement

Whether you’re new to the area or just like being socially involved, we encourage everyone to explore among our many employee networks and employee resource groups we have on-site. Whatever your interests, there’s likely a community at Lockheed Martin for networking, becoming familiar with the area, and enjoying common activities with coworkers.

-Daily use of computers with Windows, MS Office, or Linux products is a must

title: Defensive Cyberspace Operations (DCO) Analyst
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin Space is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world. Are you ready to further your career in Cyber Security working for one of the top companies in the world?
Would you like the opportunity to work with a leading team on the groundbreaking United States Space Force (USSF) Space Operations Command (SpOC) Intelligence and Cyber-defense Enterprise Services (SPICES) contract?

As a Defensive Cyberspace Operations Analyst, you will be working at Schriever AFB performing the following:

• Perform an operator role on the government provided SIEM tool.
• Employ cyber security processes, methods, techniques and tools and assure their consistent application.
• Identify, contain, and respond to cyber incidents.
• Perform incident handling procedures.
• Assess and respond to USCYBERCOM task orders.
• Assist in the development of local Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs).
• Respond to INFOCON and CPCON changes.
• Prepare mission briefs.
• Participate in Wing exercises.

Must hold an active TS/SCI

Work Schedule: This role will align with the government's 12 hour shift structure with day shift being 7am to 7pm and night shift being 7pm to 7am. The DCO operator will work 4, 12 hour shifts with 3 subsequent days off.

***This position is for day shift.
qualifications:
• DOD 8570.07-M CSSP certification.
• Experience with a SIEM Tool (LogRhythm, Splunk).
• Experience with employment of DoD cybersecurity requirements, policies, and procedures to include assessment and authorization activities.
• Experience with responding to cyber incidents.

Top Secret clearance with SCI required to start
skills:

• Experience with Secure Configuration/Hardening of DoD Information Systems.

title: Chapter Next Returnship - Software Engineer/Littleton, CO
description:
Chapter Next – Let Lockheed Martin be the next step in your Journey Back to the workforce!

Have you taken some extended time away from your career in support of family or personal obligations? At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS), we understand that sometimes we must pause our professional life to support our family and loved ones. After stepping away from the workplace to care for children, aging parents or other family obligations, the road to return to work can be challenging, and at times intimidating. This is where Chapter Next can be part of your solution!

Chapter Next is a 12-16 week paid returnship hosted by RMS. Candidates who have taken a professional career hiatus for at least 2+ years will be eligible to apply to this program.

During this returnship participants will become part of a community of similarly experienced professionals with challenging work scopes that contribute to the great innovation produced by Lockheed Martin. Selected candidates will be exposed to comprehensive training, professional development opportunities, networking opportunities, and individual based mentoring

Our goal is to provide the fundamental tools needed to be successful in your career field, and to potentially prepare you for an opportunity to join Lockheed Martin full-time. Fields of focus will be diverse across the program and include functional and technical opportunities.

This returnship position is for a Software Engineer in the Multi-Domain Weapon Systems group in Littleton CO.

The Air Force Distributed Common Ground Station (AF DCGS) family of programs is seeking a software engineer to work modernization through sustainment activities.

The selected candidate will be supporting the program in all phases of the software development process. This individual will be executing Agile software development and programming in C++ and/or Java in a team environment potentially supporting multiple projects for the various products developed by this program such as the core products CETS (signal processing system), MSCS (theater situational awareness), and SEAM (sensor asset management). The selected candidate will also collaborate closely with project management, systems integration and test engineers, as well as fellow software engineers.

Applicants must have good communication, writing, and presentation skills.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
qualifications:
- Experience developing software in C++ and/or Java
- Object oriented design and programming experience
- Experience with the full software development cycle
- Experience with Linux/Unix based systems
- Ability to collaborate with a team of developers
- Excellent organizational and communication skills, both written and oral
- Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education. Entry level.

title: Model-Based Engineering Staff Engineer
description:
As we enter a new era of Space Systems, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you have a passion for working on emerging technologies and results-oriented projects with the ability to drive significant long-term solutions? The Fleet Ballistic Missile (FBM) program is looking for an experienced and dedicated engineer to support the development and implementation of model-based electrical and mechanical engineering design (Physical World) and digital transformation technologies across the program. This critical initiative, executed through the Chief Engineer's office, provides you with the opportunity to work with multiple program organizations, engage with the LM Space Business Transformation Office (BTO), and collaborate with our Navy partners on their parallel Digital Engineering effort.

As a Model Based Engineering (MBE) Staff Engineer, you will work in the Chief Engineer's office collaborating with the Sr. Manager for MBE Implementation and be the MBE core team lead for the Physical World implementation. Responsibilities for this position include:

- Supporting the execution of the MBE strategic roadmap by leading efforts to further define the vision, strategy, and implementation plan for electrical and mechanical engineering design activities across the program

- Incorporation of MBSE into the design function and transition of design to manufacturing and production functions

- Ensuring the logical and practical transition of existing FBM programs to model-based design tools and methodologies

- Engagement with configuration management, check, manufacturing, quality, and PMP organizations to support implementation of the digital engineering workflow process

- Supporting the integration of the complete digital thread throughout engineering and support organizations

- Working with the LM Space BTO to ensure alignment of Enterprise transformation objectives with FBM objectives

- Supporting the customer’s Systems Engineering Transformation (SET) team and the alignment of the Navy’s Digital Engineering objectives with FBM objectives

- Leading collaborative teams that include customer and industry partners


Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition
qualifications:
Working knowledge of and experience using mechanical and electrical CAD tools and environments (e.g. CREO Parametric, Zuken, Windchill)

Broad knowledge and application of processes across systems engineering functions (e.g. system architecture and design, system requirements, CONOPS, systems analysis, system test, system validation and verification)

Experience in executing model-based engineering in at least one discipline

Knowledge of Model Based Engineering/Digital Transformation concepts, definitions and approaches

Proficiency in MS Office Products

Ability to obtain a DoD Secret clearance
skills:
Fleet Ballistic Missile (FBM) program experience

Advanced experience using mechanical and electrical CAD tools and environments

Familiarity with model-based systems engineering (MBSE) tools and modeling complex systems in MBSE tools and environments (e.g. DOORS, Cameo, MagicDraw, Teamwork Cloud)

Familiarity with engineering simulations and analyses (e.g. structural, environmental, finite element, stress, dynamics)

Experience developing, deriving, and implementing a model-based and/or digitally transformed architecture in a medium to large sized program

Experience and ability to lead and work with a geographically diverse, cross-functional team

Understanding of EPDM/Windchill and SAP/ERP systems

Proven ability to effectively lead and collaborate in a team environment

Strong written, communication, and presentation skills, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels with peers, leaders, and customers

Current DoD Secret clearance

title: Mass Properties Systems Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. At Lockheed Martin, we develop and build systems that really move. Some in space, while others move through the atmosphere, over land or over water. Our customers need and expect high performance from these systems and mass properties affects that performance.

Our Mass Properties Engineers help ensure our spacecraft get payloads to the right orbit around our planet or around other objects in our solar system, help our missile systems intercept a threat and protect our troops, help deliver a payload with pinpoint accuracy, or help us develop smaller, lightweight directed energy weapons, so they can be deployed on a variety of platforms.

As a Mass Properties Engineer, the job responsibilities will include:
• Ensure mass properties functions are carried out through junior or other senior Engineers
• Maintain control and handle personnel issues of the support team
• Provide technical direction to program management and customer to ensure programmatic performance
• Perform intricate analysis and actual measurements
• Lead the weight control and efforts on programs
• Coach, mentor and train engineers in complex analysis and verification
• Act as a technical consultant to programs and customers within the company
• Develop new and inventive mass properties tools and techniques in analysis, verification, and control

To promote the sharing of ideas, we at Lockheed Martin champion an inclusive work environment that supports differences and big-picture thinking.

You have opportunities to play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.

Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

You can learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package by visiting this link.
qualifications:
• Technical expertise in sophisticated mass properties analysis, including identification and quantification of error sources in accuracy and uncertainty analysis, and performing coordinate transformations
• Demonstrated experience and innovation in developing systems for high accuracy mass, center of gravity, and inertial measurements
• Experience with development and implementation of effective, low cost methods of program mass management and control
• Leadership experience within the mass properties field and as a part of a larger multi-disciplinary technical team
• US Citizenship with the ability to acquire and maintain a Secret security clearance
skills:
• Demonstrated experience leading the effort on multiple large programs, performing an intricate estimation for preliminary design concepts, and solving mass properties issues
• Develop new industry-wide mass properties engineering standards and control processes
• Experience with the responsibility of supporting and being the primary point of contact for a program
• Experience as a key contributor or as a lead for weight control and reduction efforts
• Ability to identify and resolve technical concerns with respect to weight reduction application and write Mass Properties procedures, practices and/or specifications
• Strong written (preparing monthly or quarterly weight status reports) and verbal communication (presenting mass properties summaries to management and customers)
• Experience with configuration assessment and prediction of mass properties based on preliminary design models as well as the evolving released design
• Familiarity with manufacturing and assembly techniques & processes, developing test procedures, and performing data reduction
• Self-starter, able to multitask, strive for a positive customer experience
• Missile or space segment design and test experience with one or more subsystems or areas outside of Systems Engineering
• Ability to lead multi-functional teams and lead multiple teams to communicate and coordinate work as one team with common goals
• Active Secret security clearance

title: Industrial Facilities Maintenance Manager
description:
What will the space industry look like in 50 years? Follow us to find out. We’re shaping the space technologies of tomorrow, today. As we further enhance and develop our competitive enterprise for capturing new opportunities and disrupting our competitors, Lockheed Martin Space works to provide the path forward in a dynamic environment and to stay ahead of environmental changes.
Virtually every Lockheed Martin Space mission success starts with a strong foundation of facility infrastructure design, which is built and operated risk free in support of business needs without interruption. As a Facilities Manager at Lockheed Martin Space, you’ll have the opportunity to use your education and experience to take on formidable challenges and become an integral part of our team as we build new, and maintain current, state of the art engineering facilities. At Lockheed Martin Space, you’ll use innovative approaches that help ensure reliability of electrical & machine infrastructure that produces cutting edge space systems and analyzes trends while managing operational efficiencies.

In this Facilities Manager role, you will be responsible for the following tasks:

• Leading teams consisting of Heating Ventilation & Air Conditioning (HVAC), Refrigeration, Plumbing & Pipe-fitting, Millwrights, Stationary Boiler House Operations, 2nd / 3rd Shift Operations team & Weekend Duty Lead, while implementing innovative processes that increase plant reliability, reduce business interruption risk and operating costs
• Oversee operation and maintenance care processes for infrastructure systems used within the approximately 3.7 Million square feet of Operational space in the Waterton campus in Littleton, CO.
• Actively participate in new facility project design reviews providing constructive comment to Facility Engineering
• Support project commissioning, functional check-outs to ensure designs are maintainable, while employing commonality with lifecycle costs minimized
• Managing a team budget, controlling cost, and managing organization work performance to established metrics.

• Support Predictive Maintenance technology & Digital Transformation initiatives
• Participate in the Facility Project Acceptance program, so assets are incorporated into Preventive Maintenance program with the right level of care that provides best value while maintaining assets in a reliable ready state in accordance with Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) principles
• Support other Plant Operations managers with equipment assessments, field trouble shooting, energy management, and operational planning
• Ensure spares are maintained through Crib Operations to maximize uptime while minimizing costs
• Determine organizational training requirements that enable staff to support organizational needs
• Support and keep current the Facility Condition Assessments survey data
• Support and or lead facility incident investigations through the Facility Correction Action Board
• Support Capital Refurbishment Long Range Plan process
• Support Plant Outage Planning for the Facilities organization with communication, documentation, and execution
• Oversee Plant Operations and Services contract management for service agreements and non-labor cost management within department

title: Spacecraft Systems Engineer
description:
Have you always wanted to know about Space Protection Programs (SPP)?

When you join SPP you will be part of one of the most inventive and fastest moving organizations in Space. Come help build end-to-end Space Security Systems for the DoD and other customers. Our cutting edge capabilities assure the security and health of our nation’s space assets. We push the boundary of what gets done in space. One day people may hear the full story of your achievements. When the history books are written, they may discover the critical role you’ve played to defeat the enemies of freedom. Come be one of the people working quietly to keep the light of liberty shining.

As a Spacecraft Systems Engineer, you will:

title: Data Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Model Based Engineering effort. If you have an interest in all things space and an interest in working for a company that will put astronauts on Mars, create 3D printed satellites, launch payloads that learn in orbit, or that develop national defense systems, come and be a part of our LM Space Team.

The Model Based Engineering Acceleration project, you will participate in the joint E&T/BITEE team, including activity to develop, test and deploy solutions to accelerate Model-Based Engineering (MBE) for program insertion. You will work collaboratively in product teams to successfully deliver Engineering products to the implementation teams.

In this role the candidate will have responsibility in the following areas:

• Understanding of Model Based Engineering principles to design and implement solutions that span the data lifecycle: collect, ingest, process, store, persist, access, and deliver data at scale and at speed
• Searching for and collecting information on various data topics

• Design and implement the data security required to protect and access the data
• Building data pipelines that clean, transform and aggregate unorganized data into databases or data sources
• Creating conceptual, logical and physical data model architecture, data extract/transform/load processes, reporting and analytics
The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated interest in data with an engaging, problems solving mindset

title: Systems Integration Engineer
jobclass: Systems Engineering: System of Systems Integration
description:
If you’re looking for the challenge of a lifetime and a team of the brightest minds in the world, Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you. Join us today and let’s make a difference together.

Lockheed Martin is seeking a motivated system integrator to support the C2BMC Missile Defense National Team (MDNT) by integrating C2BMC software into the C2BMC test suites at the MDIOC, primarily Virtual servers; develop site and event specific configurations to support test, war games, and exercise events.

Operate and troubleshoot C2BMC systems during test events. Work with program-external personnel to resolve test lab issues; work with C2BMC Operations and Sustainment personnel to resolve installation and processing issues; create and modify scripts to extract specific information from log files; perform data analysis of input, internal, and output message data; troubleshoot both test and operational issues; document test results and prepare test status documentation; author Spiral and build-level test plan documents and procedures; create Test Discrepancy Reports to document issues; assist software development personnel with the investigation and resolution of issues; develop troubleshooting procedures and work-around documents; develop and execute detailed test plans and procedures to test C2BMC in an integrated environment or to test specific capabilities; plan and lead integration C2BMC tests with external elements and sensors; review and provide feedback of system specifications, development, test, network documents as necessary; attend meetings with other C2BMC FAs, customers, etc. and represent the Integration team.

Position is based in Colorado Springs at the MDIOC but sometimes multi-week travel to customer sites (e.g. EUCOM, CENTCOM) and contractor sites (e.g. Huntsville, HWY83) may be required. Ability to travel is a requirement.

title: Logistics Project Manager
description:
The candidate will assume the Logistics Program Integration responsibilities leading a team consisting of supply chain, repair depot, training, technical document, field technical services, and logistics analysis professionals. Candidate will be responsible for the execution of all logistics efforts supporting multiple radar and other sensor programs. The position will work closely with Program Managers to determine staffing levels, required skillsets, and day to day management, measurement, and reporting of contract scope. The Program Integrator devises and implements plans, budgets, and schedules in response to program requirements. He/she will monitor work progress of logistics personnel assigned to tasks to ensure milestones are met. Devises solutions in response to problems that negatively affect successful accomplishment of tasks assigned throughout the team. Advises, coordinates, and assists in training assigned logistics personnel.
The Logistics Project Manager will be a member program Configuration Control Boards and review design changes for logistics impacts. The candidate will be responsible for design for sustainment activities and participate in reliability, availability and maintainability engineering activities.

title: Technician: Advanced Career
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.  Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. We have an excellent opportunity in Littleton, CO for a Technician Senior Specialist to work within the Special Programs organization. Special Programs has an excellent track record of stable programs with highly evolving technical requirements that drives subcontract changes on a regular basis. Special Programs has developed a significant number of future leaders with a wide variety of engagement programs and challenging work to develop individual potential.

The Electrical Aerospace Ground Equipment (EAGE) Operation and Maintenance Department (O&M) Team is looking for a person with a desire to engage in a team-based high performance work group. Performs a variety of duties in the electronic, mechanical, electromechanical, and/or optical areas.

• Constructs, troubleshoots, calibrates, adjusts, tests, diagnoses, and maintains equipment, components, devices, or systems.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you looking for an exciting career as a Software Engineer at one of the top Aerospace and Defense Companies? A fulfilling position that challenges your mind, grows your skills, and contributes to our Nation’s most critical missions is right in front of you! At Lockheed Martin Space, we advance the frontiers of science, help the military protect what matters most, and solve problems that others think are impossible. We have challenging missions that will inspire and innovate!

Our Next Gen Geo Mission Processing team is looking for a motivated Software Engineer to augment our Agile Team in support of our Overhead Persistent Infrared (OPIR) Mission Processing Product. We are seeking a dynamic Software Engineer to help support these critical efforts, which include development of solutions in support of OPIR sensor data stream processing to be used for missile warning.

As a member of a high-performing team you must be passionate about your trade, focused on mission system quality, and supportive of timely delivery of features and capabilities. This position involves design, development and maintenance, and testing of mainly C++ code. Challenges will include adapting and testing framework for new interfaces, developing APIs, and developing mission processing applications.

title: Senior Manager, Signal and Image Processing
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as an Optical Payload Image Signal Processing Sr. Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are seeking a leader with a track record of delivering to technical, schedule, and financial commitments, and driving the best customer and enterprise value as a result. We want someone who demonstrates a breadth of technical knowledge across multiple functions and a variety of program experience. Our Senior Manager, Signal and Image Processing is someone with outstanding interpersonal skills, and a validated ability to represent the organization to customers, employees, and partners.

More specifically, you will:
• Partner with Lines of Business (LOB), OPCoE Program Development, and OPCoE Payload Systems Engineering teams to develop image processing capability in a consistent manner to enable reuse across multiple programs
• Develop transition plans for low Technology Readiness Level (TRL) products from the science and technology community
• Lead or support intellectual property evaluations and development of patent applications
• Propose and execute IRAD projects with a goal of standardization and maturation, in coordination with OPCoE Program Development
• Enhance relationships with strategic suppliers and other LM Business Areas (BAs) to compliment the in-house OPCoE team
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers. Fold emerging mission trends into product roadmap to ensure a discriminating edge
• Implement and lead technical knowledge management to develop and maintain strengths, key technical skills, knowledge continuity and facilitate career advancement opportunities to employees
• Handle staffing requirements, sustain engineering capabilities and preserve critical skills

Working location can be in Littleton, Colorado OR Sunnyvale, California:

Signal Processing, Image Processing, Digital Signal Processing, DSP. Electro-Optical, Optical Engineering, Payload Engineering, Space Communications, Sensors, Remote Sensing, Electro Magnetic effects, EMC, EMI, Engineering Management, Technical Leadership, Algorithm Development, IRAD, Internal Research and Development and Classified Programs.

title: Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Engineer
description:
The Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) Artificial Intelligence (AI) team is seeking motivated engineers with a strong background in software engineering, DevOps, artificial intelligence and machine learning to support the RMS AI team and product portfolio.

The RMS AI Engineering & Technology team is focused on a broad range of projects from research & development to prototype development, culminating in deployment of our products to customers. We are on the bleeding edge, inserting AI into defense systems, delivered through our AI Software Factory. This role will get a unique mix with research, prototype development, and software to hardware toolchain development all within the domain of AI / ML programs.

At Lockheed Martin, we build solutions for some of the world's hardest engineering problems across a wide portfolio and our culture encourages employees to think big and innovate, perform with excellence, and bring ideas to life. Our team cultivates a learning mindset with practical implementation, and fosters an inclusive environment, harnessing the best of a diverse set of perspectives for our products and solutions.

The RMS AI team has an immediate opportunity for a dynamic, hardworking, motivated engineer who wants to join our team. If you have an interest and passion for making AI / ML real, come and be a part of our team. At Lockheed Martin, we are driven by innovation and integrity, and we are excited to bring cutting edge technology to our customers & their missions.

This role is responsible for the development of technologies and products that leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning to provide discriminating capability to our customers. This requires engagement in every phase of the system development lifecycle including: requirements generation, system and software design, implementation, integration & test, and verification & validation. Activities will range from low TRL research, development of prototypes, building demos, and transitioning to production.

This role is expected to utilize current AI paradigms, algorithms, and models (e.g. deep learning, reinforcement learning, computer vision); applying these techniques in relevant domains to solve complex problems and create innovative solutions. This also requires a candidate to maintain awareness of emerging analytics, AI / ML, and domain-specific technologies. This role may be based at any RMS site, or remotely via telecommuting depending on program needs.

This job is aligned with our 21st Century Warfare (21CWFAIA) initiative to help the U.S. and its allies leverage emerging technologies to deter threats to economic prosperity and national security.
qualifications:
Must be eligible for a clearance
Experience with AI/ML domain programming languages (e.g. Python, C++, Java, GO, MatLab)
Experience developing and deploying AI/ML models, and a knowledge of machine learning frameworks and deep learning toolsets (e.g. SciKit-learn, TensorFlow PyTorch, Caffe, Keras)
DevOps experience including CI/CD pipelines to build, test, deploy
Strong problem solving mindset: ability to develop create solutions to difficult problems often requiring integration of conflicting and, at times, ambiguous or incomplete data on a fast-paced schedule
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex design information, technical decision and issues to both highly technical and non-technical peers
Ability to build and maintain relationships, collaborate with others, engage in constructive conflict, and manage interpersonal dynamics
Comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic multi-disciplinary environment
skills:
Experience developing applications on Linux
Familiarity with high-performance computing
Familiarity with network/messaging (UDP, ZeroMQ, RESTful API, etc.)
Familiarity interfacing with databases (SQL, MongoDB, etc.)
Familiarity with signal processing & domain expertise
Familiarity with one or more of the AI disciplines (e.g. Natural Language Processing, Anomaly Detection, Markov Chain and Monte Carlo (MCMC) Methods, Machine Learning, Predictive Modeling, Statistical Analysis and Hypothesis Testing)

title: Solution Architect
description:
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world's hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus. If you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Lockheed Martin Space seeks a Joint All-Domain Operations (JADO) Solutions Architect for emerging JADO and Air Force Battle Management (ABMS) programs. The JADO Solutions Architect will shape our business and technical strategies for the Air Force and Space Force JADO/ABMS systems-of-systems. The primary technical domains are wireless military communications, military command and control, and sensor-to-shooter threads.
The JADO Solutions Architect will work under the guidance of LM Fellows to support directors and business development representatives and provide critical contributions to major new programs.
The Solutions Architect will contribute to long-term plans, technology roadmaps, evolution strategies, and support new business captures and LM R&D planning. The Communications Solutions Architect will be an author for RFI and RFP responses.

Job can be performed at any LM Space site.

description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for space applications as a Staff Electro-Optical Engineer!

The Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Specific responsibilities include:
• System interfaces including structural attachment for installation, thermal characteristics, chassis design
• Specification and selection of COTS (Commercial-off-the-Shelf), ROTS (Ruggedized-off-the-Shelf), NDI (Non-Developmental Item) and/or custom components

You are someone with strong: prioritization skills, possess the ability to establish and delegate changing tasks and coordinate with partners. You should demonstrate effective verbal communication, develop concise and professional technical presentations, and deliver briefings to peers, leadership, and US Government customers. We are seeking a new colleague who is willing and able to work in a classified environment.

**This position can be located in Sunnyvale, CA or Louisville, CO.

title: Senior Opto-Mechanical Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) as an Opto-Mechanical Engineer!

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate experts across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Join us as an Senior Opto-Mechanical Engineer, where you will support the full life cycle of optical payload development from initial concept design through flight hardware delivery. The position is for an individual contributor, with growth potential to team lead, and the potential to become a Certified Principal Engineer (CPE) who owns and is accountable for all critical aspects of an assigned product throughout its lifecycle.

In this role, you will:
• Get into the heart of trade studies, analyses, design maturation, and drawing delivery for optical benches, optical element layouts, telescopes, optical mounts and fixtures, and active optical elements
• Perform structural (both static and vibrational), thermal and optical performance analyses, working with a cross-functional team of engineers to optimize payload performance
• Be a key member of our team that designs and develops electro-optical instruments and payloads for civilian and military aerospace applications
• Succeed with a passion for and mounting experience with optical systems, and a goal of continuously growing your capabilities through study, analysis, collaboration, and practice.

We will look for proficiency with MS PowerPoint and Excel, and the ability to clearly communicate orally and in writing.

You would typically have a Bachelors and 5-10 years of professional experience, a Masters and 3-8 years, or a PhD and 0-5 years.

title: Lockheed Martin Research Scientist - University of Arizona
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Advanced Technology Center (ATC).

The ATC is the research lab for LM Space. Through our own skills and those of our partners—including universities and research labs around the world—we’re able to put vision in motion. While we are a part of LM's space division, our technologies are far-reaching across domains. Napkin sketches of lasers that can shoot down UAVs—we made it real. Changing molecules so metals behave differently? We invented that. ATC’s story is written in the success of missions here on Earth and far, far into space. Our innovation extends beyond incremental change. We strive for first-of-a-kind capability with enduring impact. Whatever the application, our charter is to create game-changing technologies. At the ATC, we’re inspiring change in our endless pursuit of what’s next.

Our employees perform scientific experiments, investigations, observations and related research studies into the nature and operation of natural phenomena in a variety of fields, using the scientific methods. They develop theories for understanding, characterizing and organizing natural phenomena into a systematic and meaningful pattern for the benefit of project advancement and emerging technologies.

Our facilities are located in Sunnyvale & Palo Alto, CA and Littleton, CO.

ATC primarily hires Research Engineers and Research Scientists, often with backgrounds in optical sciences, systems engineering, materials science, data science, autonomous systems, artificial intelligence, hypersonics, and many other related fields.

title: Software Engineer Senior Staff
description:
Are you looking for an exciting career as a Software Engineer at one of the top Aerospace and Defense Companies? A fulfilling position that challenges your mind, grows your skills, and contributes to our Nation’s most critical missions is right in front of you! At Lockheed Martin Space, we advance the frontiers of science, help the military protect what matters most, and solve problems that others think are impossible. We have challenging missions that will inspire and innovate!

Our Next Gen Geo Mission Processing team is looking for a motivated Software Engineer to augment our Agile Team in support of our Overhead Persistent Infrared (OPIR) Mission Processing product. We are seeking a dynamic Software Engineer to help support these critical efforts, which include development of solutions in support of OPIR sensor data stream processing to be used for missile warning.

As a member of a high-performing team you must be passionate about your trade, focused on mission system quality, and supportive of timely delivery of features and capabilities. This position designs and develop software systems and applications for mainly C++ code. This position will be a high level decision maker for a software development team, focused on design, configuration management, technical standards, etc. The software development team’s focus is on developing APIs and developing mission processing applications that will run on a new framework.

title: Business Development Analysis Sr Mgr
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Lockheed Martin has been on the leading edge of Space and Defense Innovation for over 100 years. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unrivaled skills and experiences to create, design & build solutions to some of the nation’s biggest challenges. Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with perfection & build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

We are seeking a Business Development Senior Manager within our Space Military Space, Space Security mission area. This position requires an active TS/SCI clearance & previous affiliations and/or relevant experience with Space DoD & Intelligence Communities.

In this role, you will focus on Enterprise Strategy, capture opportunities within our Defense & Space Security mission that meet Long Range Plan (LRP) requirements and management of business development and capture management professionals. You will assist in the development of the LRP related to this mission area with the Space Security Strategy & Business Development Director. You will use your expertise to address critical customer needs while growing the business and building on the history and success of Lockheed Martin while building on your career achievements.

Summary of Key Duties for this position:

• Develop an overall customer-focused strategic plan focused on both short & long-term growth opportunities.
• Identify & establish key industry partnerships to maximize new business growth for our key customers.
• Support development of a robust LRP with a balance of "A" & "B" orders.
• Actively support capture team on key opportunities.
• Lead efforts with executives to develop & execute strategic growth plans focused on Space Security.
• Collaborate with Space Security and Engineering Leadership to create technology roadmaps & related Internal Research & Development (IR&D) projects to create discriminators necessary to develop new business.
• Lead the integration & partnership with other Space lines of business related to our customers.
• Maintain accountability to shape & win new business through a balanced focus on customer value, the competitive environment, & the corporation's best interests.
• Develop & maintain effective customer, teammate, & internal relationships.

How to define your success in this position:

• Ability to build strong internal & external networks and teams.
• Success with identifying, shaping, & winning new business.
• Development & growth of new business pipelines.
• Effective use/management of New Business Acquisition Expense (NBAE).
• Effectiveness with Capture Management (leading competitive captures).
• Success with new market penetration.
• Meeting Long Range Plan commitments.


Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of our many benefits available to you :

• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance

• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

title: Asc Mgr, Financial Management
description:
At Lockheed Martin, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our capacity – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, education and background.

Do you want to be part of an environment that encourages and supports employees to think big, perform with quality, and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the resourcefulness and courage to work hard, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Come and experience your future!

Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team lead will coordinate all forecasting, reporting and analysis of financial metrics (Orders, Sales, Profit, Cash, and Capital) for IWSS line of business (LOB) to internal leadership as well as POC to RMS/CHQ FP&A personnel. Provide guidance and mentoring to senior and staff financial analysts as well as FLDPs assigned to markets segments on IWSS FP&A team. Collaborate with and provide guidance to the four IWSS Market Segments for related FP&A rhythms and deliverables. Coordinate scheduling and execution of critical forecasting and reporting exercises plus responding to ad hoc requests from LOB staff, RMS and CHQ.

Benefits: In addition to the responsibilities highlighted above we offer extensive benefits to include competitive 401k, insurance, and a new 4/10 schedule. We remain an equal opportunity company.
qualifications:
Appropriate degree from an accredited college, or equivalent experience/combined education, with professional experience and specialized training commensurate with assignment.

Broad financial background including Program Finance, Pricing and FP&A (Financial Planning and Analysis) experience.

SAP, Hyperion, Microsoft Excel and Power Point experience.

Excellent communications skills to provide clear, concise and confident presentations to brief executive leadership.

Leadership skills to act as FP&A team lead when Sr. Manager is unavailable.

SAP and Hyperion tool expert

title: Opto-Mechanical Senior Staff Engineer - Payload Structural Analyst
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

The Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) at Lockheed Martin Space is seeking an experienced Opto-mechanical/Precision Mechanism Engineer and Structural Analyst to play a leading role in our design and development work on a variety of passive, active, and directed energy optical payloads. We are looking for engineers with strong mechanical skills, highly relevant and related experience, and a keen interest in optical payloads. OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members coordinate specialists across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

With a focus on structural analysis and design, integrated into full payload design and performance assessments, you will be engaged in the design, specification, and procurement support for optical bench assemblies, optical mounts and fixtures, mechanical ground support equipment, alignment fixtures, and a range of related assets to be used in the development, test and manufacture of optical payloads. This position calls for a consistent, responsible, deadline-meeting professional who will:

- Work under broad guidance from senior engineering and program leadership;

- Collaborate and contribute across the design team;

- Guide the work of junior and emerging engineers;

- Engage with prospective and selected suppliers;

- Deliver robust documents and briefings, and;

- Support customer reviews

We are seeking a team member with strong written and oral communication skills. You should also demonstrate strong quantitative skills and the ability to apply them to the formidable mechanical challenges of precision optical payload subsystems.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 14-20 years of professional experience, a Masters and 12 -18 years, or a PhD and 9-15 years.

**Please note that this role can be located in Sunnyvale, CA or Louisville, CO. If located in Sunnyvale the role has current funding. If located in Louisville, the role is contingent upon funding expected in the 4th quarter of 2021.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin cultivates an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package.
qualifications:
- Bachelor's Degree in a technical/engineering field; or equivalent combination of education and experience

- Opto-mechanical design and engineering experience on complex optical subsystems and assemblies, and/or highly correlated high precision equipment

- Extensive experience with industry standard Computer Aided Design and Structural Analysis tools such as CREO, NASTRAN, and NX

- US Citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance
skills:

description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Digital transformation is Lockheed Martin’s path to the future with its interconnected environment where data becomes information and information drives decisions that create value across the entire lifecycle. To help us along this journey Space is seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Space Workstream Transformation Business Process Engineer. We’re looking for someone with passion and enthusiasm to enable and deliver on the Space Business Transformation!

Business Process Engineer contributing to Business Transformation at Lockheed Martin Space. As a member of the Workstream Transformation team, the successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing business and technical processes to formulate and develop new and modified business processes based on evolving and advanced digital capabilities of business systems. Evaluating, reinventing, and streamlining to optimize processes to leverage new digital capabilities. Represent business process needs with technology teams to define requirements and business cases for the technology developments. Coordinates with business and technology teams, ascertaining system requirements, such as program functions, output requirements, input data acquisition, and system techniques and controls. Work directly with Space Business Transformation systems engineering and architecture team to ensure integration across transformation architectures. Work with Space Business Transformation Implementation Team and Functional Leadership teams to identify opportunities to drive implementation of new processes and prepare for change management required to execute new processes.

title: Guidance, Navigation & Control Sr Stf Engr
description:
Do you want the chance to re-think conventional wisdom and offer fresh, ground-breaking ideas? LM has new opportunities that provide you with a chance to challenge the status quo and experiment with new digital tools and emerging technologies that transform our mission.
Due to the classified nature of this opportunity we can’t talk about everything you’ll do on this program, but know that you will play a part in building end-to-end solutions and game-changing technology.


The Military Space Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GN&C) team is made up of enthusiastic and talented individuals that design and produce the hardware, algorithms, and software required to solve the challenging problems of controlling these systems in a harsh, zero-g environment. Are you willing to join this team and help solve these challenges in a team environment using your GN&C academic background and spacecraft industry experience? Do you have experience in leading a team of GN&C engineers? If so, consider this GN&C technical leadership position on an exciting space program. You will be the GN&C Responsible Subsystem Engineer (RSE) for this new exciting smallsat program.

This position in contingent upon program award expected around Q3 2021 .


You will typically have 14 years of professional experience and a bachelor's degree in this position.

This position requires that you will be willing and able to obtain a Top Secret DoD clearance w/SCI .
