title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
This is a position for the Space Software Product Line (SSPL) organization as a DevSecOps Software Engineer. SSPL is revolutionizing how LM designs, develops, and delivers spacecraft software, whether for NASA deep space missions, Global Positioning System (GPS) satellites, the U.S. Intelligence Community, and many other customers. This includes leveraging the latest DevSecOps tools and methodologies to deliver value to our customers quickly, efficiently, and repeatably. The selected candidate will join the SSPL team and will support multiple efforts related to DevSecOps development, implementation, and maintenance. The successful candidate will be a Systems Thinker who will help mature SSPL’s DevSecOps strategy across all software product lines. Additionally, the candidate will help mature SSPL’s DevSecOps implementation and have a strong desire to automate processes rather than doing them twice.

The successful candidate will:
• Possess strong understanding in DevSecOps

• Enjoy using Agile best practices, including the many feedback mechanisms for improvement

• Understand the benefits of Test-Driven-Development

• Have experience in a wide range of DevSecOps and CI/CD tools

• Be highly motivated to deliver results in a dynamic work environment

• Be comfortable with automated build processes, including automated testing and continuous deployment

• Be an emerging technical leader with a strong desire to grow SSPL’s DevSecOps strategy

• Want to be part of an awesome SSPL work environment and contribute to its creative, fun, and engaging work culture

This position is essential as each of the four software product lines has experienced and are expecting to continue to experience significant growth in the near future. A key objective of this position will be to develop CI/CD solutions which effectively package multiple products from our product lines in order to execute in a more cost and schedule efficient manner for our customers.

title: AI/ML Training and Summit Coordinator
description:
When it comes to using cutting-edge to tackle complex problems, is driven by a singular mission focus and desire to continuously innovate. Today’s challenges to global security aren’t just changing – they’re accelerating faster than ever before. Through our dedication to our mission, our -enabled systems are changing the way militaries operate and protect their forces, the way first responders fight fires, and how researchers explore the far reaches of space and the ocean’s depths.

The Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy individual with a strong working knowledge in engineering, and to support the Applied team and product portfolio, focusing on a broad range of projects across the LAIC. The team is focused on exploiting small, innovative and teams to rapidly iterate and mature solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the enterprise and in the field for our customers.

The selected candidate will focus on the of technologies and products that leverage to provide discriminating capability to our customers. This will require engagement in every phase of the system lifecycle including requirements generation, system and design, implementation, integration, and flight test. Activities will range from low TRL research, proof of concepts, of prototypes, building demonstrators, and transition to production. The selected candidate can expect to utilize current paradigms including computer vision, , and reinforcement , applying these techniques to solve complex problems and field innovative solutions.

Must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time and interpersonal skills.


The Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy individual with a strong working knowledge of and to organize and manage and (/ML) training initiatives across the enterprise. You will be part of a team of front-end and back-end developers, engineers, /ML specialists, product managers, and other scientists. The AiMLabs team is focused on building a strong and vibrant AI/ML community at including tools, training, events, and knowledge sharing.

The selected candidate will coordinate AI/ML training initiatives across the enterprise. Responsibilities include
• Shaping content needs through discussions with AI/ML subject matter experts, internal and external training providers, project managers, and more
• Managing continuous improvement of training content by engaging with stakeholders and providers
• Administering live training events like courses, hackathons, bootcamps, and summits across the enterprise
• Staying abreast of emerging technologies, tools, and processes in the AI/ML field and anticipating future training gaps
• Must be a US citizen

title: Software Engineer
description:
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Are you a software engineer looking for something different? Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can make a difference to a very important mission? This is an exciting software development position supporting the growing Space Security division within Mission Solutions Line of Business.

The selected candidate will join the Arches program's Agile (scrum) Software Development Team. We're looking for a highly motivated and experienced software engineer to join our fast-paced development effort and contribute to the success of a very challenging and rewarding mission.

Typical Agile responsibilities include participation in daily scrums, sprint/release planning, demos, and retrospectives. Development responsibilities include software design, code and unit test, investigation into ad hoc issues, and the ability to analyze and resolve complex mission problems quickly and independently. The successful candidate will have a commendable work ethic, good communication skills, a great attitude, be a results oriented team player, creative thinker and problem-solver, and follow all ethical standards of the Lockheed Martin Corporation.

Selected candidate must have a TS/SCI security clearance and be cleared to the program to start.

title: Guidance, Navigation & Control Hardware CPE Senior
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to craft, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Do you want join a culture that inspires employees to think creatively, exceed their own expectations and build incredible products? We provide the resources, support and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Enterprise Product Center Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GN&C) team is made up of enthusiastic and talented individuals that design and produce the hardware, algorithms, and software required to solve the challenging problems of controlling these systems in a harsh, zero-g environment. Are you willing to join this team and help solve these challenges in a team environment using your academic background and experience?

This position reports to the Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GNC) Products Manager within the Enterprise Product Center organization. The role specifically is for a CPE of the GNC Standard Products efforts with particular emphasis on the LM2100, LM400, and NexGen Interceptor platforms. The position must be capable of performing Material Review Boards, Failure Review Board, Critical Design Reviews, Qualification Review Boards, Design and testing oversight of hardware throughout the Enterprise, including Mil Space, Special Programs, Commercial, and Civil Space. Focus with be on Inertia Measurement Units and Star Trackers but could development into other product areas. In an effort to further broaden common products opportunities, the role will expand to explore potential overlap between space and missile products.

The incumbent of this role will typically have 5 years of professional related experience.

This position requires obtaining and maintaining an Active DoD Top Secret Clearance, which requires U.S. Citizenship.

title: Automated Test Engineer, Early Career, TS/SCI
description:
Take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO!

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

We are seeking an Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE) System Integration and Test Engineer to work within the Military Support Programs. We are looking for you to perform EGSE designs and improvements, support and test execution, develop and review test documentation, and oversee the execution of subsystem and system-level EGSE testing.

KEY DUTIES FOR THIS POSITION INCLUDE:
• Documents test results and test discrepancies.

• Leads troubleshooting efforts.

• Provides technical guidance to test team members on EGSE products.

• Moderates among the interests of multi-disciplinary groups to synthesize EGSE test plans and test procedures that acknowledge technical, schedule and cost constraints.

• Perform to functional and technical specifications and standards, aid in solutions for hardware/software interface problems, and ensures integration of the entire system or subsystem through test product execution.

• Coordinates subsystem and/or system testing activities with support organizations.

• May perform impromptu briefs of test status or discrepancies to customer representatives or program management.

Please note that this position will require on call support to a 24/7 test operations schedule.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR YOU TO HAVE:

• We need you to have an active TS/SCI clearance to be considered.

title: Spacecraft Lead Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

As the Spacecraft Lead Engineer, you will work closely with design and analysis teams to develop and deliver a product that meets mission needs. You will be heavily involved with the spacecraft bus supplier with a goal of understanding all technical aspects of the spacecraft design and the corresponding requirements. You will oversee and support the efforts of the spacecraft subsystems including electronics, software, thermal, structures, propulsion, GN&C, power, stress, dynamics, and specialty engineering in support of your product.

Specific responsibilities include:
• Direction of efforts with your supplier to investigate pertinent design factors such as ease of manufacture, availability of materials and equipment, interchangeability, replace-ability, and contractual specification requirements and cost
• Coordination with other organizations affected by design development; identify design errors, omissions, and other deficiencies, and drive revision and/or improvement recommendations
• Drive resolution of spacecraft issues, developing solutions to technical problems of varying complexity while assuring sound technical content and timely closure
• Development and maintenance of schedules and budgets in support of program milestones and hardware deliveries
• Measurement and maintenance of progress across spacecraft subsystems to meet critical program dates
• Support to spacecraft assembly, integration and test efforts and support to launch vehicle integration and general launch operations efforts, as necessary

description:

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. The early design and engineering phase provides you with tremendous career growth potential along with important assignments to stretch and hone your expertise. This position supports NSP within the Strategic Missile Defense Line of Business in Lockheed Martin Space.

As a Flight Systems Electrical Integrator, you will:

• Lead anomaly investigations to closure during integration and test phase

description:

Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can contribute to a very important mission? Come and be part of our team in the dynamic world of Lockheed Martin Space. We are seeking a Composite Technician to work at our Littleton, CO site.

The role will involve working from engineering drawings, written work instructions and process specifications. This role will assemble structural and precision mechanical components in a shop environment. Tasks will include but are not limited to:
-Installation and torqueing of fasteners, drilling, installation of rivets, adhesive bonding, measurement and shimming interfaces to close tolerances.
-Aerospace paint, aerospace primer and other aerospace coating application using spray, brush, swab techniques.
-Surface prep, using grit blast, hand abrade and power abrasion techniques.
-Prepreg and wet layup fabrication techniques, including vacuum bag processing, bonding, and oven/autoclave curing.
-Tooling fabrication from various materials such as aluminum, composites, and wood.
-Working with small shop power tools (saws, routers, sanders, and grinders).
-Machine shop equipment operation (mill, lathe, table saw, band saw, etc.).
-Assembly of composite structures including setup, bonding, and fastener applications.
-Operation of measuring devices such as calipers, height gages, micrometers, and torque wrenches.

title: Lunar Exploration Campaign Chief Technologist
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Do you have the passion to get humans back to the moon and eventually to Mars? NASA has developed a vision for exploration that includes the development of a Human Lander System and a Gateway Habitat in the next 5 years. The nation received a White House mandate to place humans back on the surface of the Moon by 2024. Lockheed Martin Space in onboard to be part of this historic event and is looking to build a core team of highly-motivated engineers excited to be working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. This is a rare opportunity for you to help NASA meet the challenges of the first step in achieving that "long-term presence at the Moon" and the stepping point for human missions to Mars.

As the Chief Technologist over Soft Goods within the Lunar Exploration Campaign organization , you will:
• Manage a softgoods engineering team
• Serve as the systems engineering lead and work with the program, engineering organization, and line of business to stand up this core capability within LM
• Drive new business capture activities for future soft-goods programs
• Provide guidance to a Systems Engineering team to include full Systems Engineering lifecycle processes, from architecture and requirements development through system operations and integration, and their application to the lunar exploration campaign

title: Program Manager for Research Programs
description:
Lockheed Martin Corporate Engineering and Technology Office (CETO) is looking for high energy, enthusiastic and out of the box thinkers for career progression opportunities to work across the enterprise in managing Commercial partnership programs to develop generation-after-next technologies critical to the future success of the corporation. You will play a vital role in defining our future by driving innovative solutions for our customers. The Technology Collaboration charter is to work collaboratively across the enterprise to support developing discriminating and longer-term, far-reaching capabilities needed to enable Lockheed Martin’s 21st Century Warfare technology strategy. Technology Collaboration is assigned responsibility, authority, and accountability for process documentation and guidance, execution of technology collaborations in the case of CTO assigned collaborations, and support in the case of other Corporate, Engineering, Technology and Operations (CETO) teams. The role focuses on enabling CEO commercial collaboration initiatives. The area is also responsible for Technology Scouting, including supporting other Research &Technology areas in commercial collaboration analysis for partnerships and technology landscaping.

The successful candidate will assist in generation and reporting on the following:

• Execute the CTO requested collaborations, including agreements and IP management
• Document and maintain Technology Collaboration process which is approved by CTO
• Deliver Tech Scouting reports of value to SVP and his leadership team
• Contribute actively to Technology Landscape and Partnership analysis work by other Research &Technology Teams
• Consider ideas and possibilities that others do not see & inspire them to follow the Vision
• Maintain a high level of expertise in multiple fields through continuous learning
• Partner with company architects of infrastructure and integrated systems to appraise impact of delivered services
qualifications:
Experience in 2 or more of the 21st Century technology domains: Spectrum Dominance, Autonomy and MUM-T, Joint All Domain Operations, Resilient and Responsive Space, Cyber/Electronic Warfare, Advanced Comms/5G, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning, Edge Computing, Hypersonics/Advanced Weapons, Directed Energy, Quantum Information Sciences or Synthetic Biology

• Minimum of 3 years program management experience on a large IRAD or program
• Minimum of 3 years of leading diverse technical teams
• Experience in coordination across multiple lines of business and multi-functional organizations for internally funded research and development (IRAD) investments
• Experience planning technical efforts, include schedules, metrics and budgets; solid understanding of earned value management
• Experience with projects that include development, implementation, integration and testing
• Customer knowledge and proven technology transition experience
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Demonstrated ability to thrive in a virtual, matrixed organization
• Ability to obtain US Govt Security Clearance
skills:

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.


What does this role look like?


Supply Chain’s vision is to enable customer and mission success through supply chain strategies and execution that deliver superior operational program performance and create competitive advantage through continuous improvement. It is our mission to deliver affordable supply chain solutions that meet all program requirements and manage supply chain risks to ensure positive supplier performance through all phases of the program life-cycle from capture to sustainment.

This role will offer you the following daily challenges:

• Administering subcontract effort of suppliers across the Mission Solutions portfolio.
• Working with the members of the LM Subcontractor Management Team (SPM, CPE, QA & various SMEs), administering the subcontract through all phases of the procurement process, from contract award to contract closeout
• Ensuring that the program performance, quality, and mission success requirements are flowed to the supplier and that the supplier is managed to ensure commitments and requirements are met
• Ensuring compliance with all appropriate prime contract flow downs and will be responsible for new business requirements, to include RFP's to assigned supplier, technical evaluations, and Basis of Estimate requirements thru negotiations and definitization of the subcontractor
• Oversees the negotiation and coordination of additions, deletions, or modifications to subcontracts

This position may be based in either Denver, CO Or in King of Prussia, PA
qualifications:
To be successful, you will need to possess these basic qualifications:

• Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 6 years of professional experience; or 4 years of professional experience with a related Masters's degree.
• Experience working with SAP, P2P, or equivalent.
• Experience working in a collaborative/teaming environment.
• Demonstrated ability to bring matters/issues to successful closure.
• Understanding and working knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulations.
• Experience in administering multiple contract types (Cost recovery, T&M/LH, FFP, IDIQ).
• Proven exceptional strategic communication skills, both written, verbal, and presentation, to effectively communicate business cases to all levels of peers, suppliers, as well as program and executive management, with an ability to persuade and motivate action.
skills:

• Ability to analyze a problem and recommend solutions
• Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment and work well under pressure.

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Responsible for managing the Trusted Security Solutions program. This program supports the sustainment and development of two Cyber Security Cross Domain Solution product lines (the Trusted Manager and Radiant Mercury). This includes the field support of 1300 systems deployed worldwide.
The PM will be responsible for collaborating with E&T, and Business Development to shape the future of the product line and contract growth in the Portfolio area.
Directs all phases of the program from inception through completion. Responsible for all aspects of program cost, schedule and technical performance and execution.
qualifications:
10+ years of Experience with Program Management leading engineering teams in matrix environment across multiple sites. Experience working across Market Segments and Business Areas to leverage synergies and drive growth.
The Candidate should also have Capture Management Experience. Leadership experience and skills, strong interpersonal skills, excellent communication skills, oral and written. Experience with managing the sustainment of multiple product baselines and multiple customers.
skills: Experience with the following customers: NSA, Naval Information Warfare Center (NIWC) Pacific, PMW 130, AF DCGS-Warner Robins, LM Internal Customers (ex. LM Aero), and Various FMS CDS Customers. Basic working knowledge of: Cyber Security, computer networking and the Linux operating system.  Experience with multiple contract types to include: IDIQ (task order and delivery orders), CPFF and FFP.

title: Software Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Summary of Key Duties for this position:
The successful candidate will serve as a software developer for a team tasked with setting up an open architecture infrastructure and developing web services and modern user interfaces to meet mission needs.

You will be designing state-of-the-art concepts while delivering innovative and affordable capabilities in a new and emerging area of protecting USG space assets. You will be working on a mission that you can be proud of, knowing that you are making a lasting difference in the world and in space. You will be working side by side with extraordinarily talented and experienced engineers, while having the opportunity to lead and mentor less experienced individuals on the team. Candidate must be able to lead systems thinking, coordinate cross-team development, drive quality, and shoulder accountability for major aspects of mission and program success. Candidate must have the ability to adapt to agile methods that will require a dynamic execution approach, depending on the time-phased needs of the program.

• Experience in planning and scheduling/resource optimization application domains

• Ability to communicate effectively and work in a collaborative environment
• Must be a US citizen, will be subject to a government security investigation, and must meet eligibility requirements for an elevated clearance for access to classified information.

• Experience with test automation and continuous integration and deployment
• Experience integrating software components via machine-to-machine interfaces (e.g., RESTful APIs, ActiveMQ, etc.)

• Strong background developing / debugging and/or testing of web applications and web services
• Experience designing microservice-based architectures
• Experience with test automation and continuous integration and deployment
• Experience integrating software components via machine-to-machine interfaces (e.g., RESTful APIs, ActiveMQ, etc.)

title: C2BMC SW Architect
description:
Are you ready to join Lockheed Martin's C2BMC team in Colorado Springs? Then come join us as a Software Architect where your responsibilities will include defining and leading all aspects of the implementation of the overall software architecture for a Java-based missile defense command and control system. You will also ensure the architecture is consistent with the architecture design tenets on the C2BMC program.

This includes providing direct technical support to the chief architect and coordinating across engineering fields (e.g. Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Integration & test, sustainment).

EXAMPLES OF TASKING TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE:
- Perform trade studies and analysis for current and future C2BMC development activities

- Maintain the software architecture artifacts for the program, overseeing the development of all software design documentation

- Determine ramifications and impacts of proposed architectural changes to the software baselines

- Analyze system performance to include quantifying performance, identifying bottlenecks, and measuring throughput

- Support briefings, presentations and demonstrations to customer

- Support analysis, design, and implementation of cyber requirements in the software
qualifications:
*Must currently have an active DoD Secret Security Clearance to be considered for this position*

Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 9 years of professional experience; or 7 years of professional experience with a related Master's degree

Software engineering and architecture experience on large software systems to include:

- Recent experience in software architecture and distributed systems design and implementation

- Experience performing trade studies and analysis across software engineering subject areas

- Familiarity with the system engineering discipline

- Hands-on application development experience in the use of the Java (or similar structured programming languages)

- Previous experience with missile defense, command and control and software architecture

HERE ARE SOME OF THE BENEFITS YOU CAN ENJOY:
- Medical (some LM locations have on-site medical)
- Dental
- 401k (with generous matching)
- Paid time off including, (we have a 4/10 Flex schedule which means every Friday off!)
- Work/life balance, family-friendly environment
- Generous Tuition Reimbursement

LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR COMPETITIVE AND COMPREHENSIVE BENEFITS PACKAGE:
https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits

- Proficiency with Excel, and Visio

title: Research Engineering Senior Manager
description: The Senior Manager for Research and Technology leads expert research project/program managers and Lockheed Martin’s most critical enterprise portfolios in the Research and Technology organization under the office of the Vice President and Chief Technology Officer in Corporate. The Research and Technology team works in a “Team of Teams” manner with leaders across the enterprise, customers, and partners/suppliers. The Research and Technology senior manager partners with colleagues in the business areas to manage Research and Development portfolios which identify and develop generation-after next technologies critical to the future success of the corporation. You will play a vital role in defining our future by driving innovative solutions for our customers. The charter is to work collaboratively across the enterprise to enable the next generation of Lockheed Martin operations and manufacturing technologies.  You will lead development of advanced manufacturing technologies within the Emerging Technologies team and lead research project managers who collaborate with the Lockheed Martin advanced manufacturing community.  The senior manager leads expert, high level research experts responsible for facilitating project/program definition, guidance, and management (cost, schedule, technical execution, transition planning and facilitation).Position may be located at any major Lockheed Martin site.

title: Data Engineer Staff
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design, and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Need for a Data Engineer to Support Lockheed Martin's Business Transformation Efforts, and help the company grow and accelerate in an increasingly advanced technological landscape.
This position requires a deep understanding of SQL and the ability to create various views/tables, and passion around working with software developers and data scientists to build data pipelines that enable application users to easily access and navigate relevant data to support their day-to-day activities.
Join a collaborative team and help the business transformation become a reality.
The ideal candidate will drive innovation by aligning and leveraging data to drive strategic growth. Understanding and architecting data solutions will be key to this endeavor.
This individual will have the opportunity to support the Workstream Transformation portfolio, driving business transformation for functional users in conjunction with architects, software developers, and data scientists. They will be responsible for understanding the existing solution, virtualizing necessary data, and aligning the data models to enable the team to reuse various sources of data for a variety of solutions across several functional areas in the business.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Successfully creating data pipelines and tables/views, connecting data source systems via traditional ETL in SQL, or data virtualization in TIBCO using SQL
• ETL (joining, manipulating, “cleansing”) of source systems via SQL or other mechanisms
• Virtualization of data in TIBCO to create a virtual “clean” data output table and views
• Extension of security requirements from input, any AD Groups or other access limiters
qualifications:
•Minimum 7-9 years of related experience within a corporate environment required; experience must include successful track record with data modeling, ETL processing, data architecture, understanding of reporting platforms, and machine learning and predictive analytic solutions
•Strong experience writing SQL queries to create/modify views and tables via Extracting/Transforming/Loading (ETL).
•Experience leading practices and SAP/Oracle solution capabilities for the in-scope business analytics, including finance, procurement, supply chain management, manufacturing, quality management, logistics, and order to cash
•Strong experience working with HANA studio, HANA calculation views/ CDS and BOBJ (WEBI, Lumira) Demonstrated success working in cross-functional teams with both business and technical resources
•Ability to adapt to change quickly (high flexibility)
•Excellent written and oral communication skills
skills:
•Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Data Engineering, Data Science or a related field, required
•Experience using Tibco Data Virtualization across multiple source systems
•Broad experience and expertise working with various technologies such as Python and Python Libraries (i.e. Pandas, matplotlib, numpy, statsmodels, sklearn, sqlite, etc.)
•Knowledge of information access and delivery methods, and an understanding of data warehousing/mining, ETL, data cleansing, and architecture

title: Sr. Electrical Harness Design Engineer
description:
Are you ready to take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO?

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

We are a community of engineers looking for a dependable early career engineer to join our tight-knit group. This role will support many of the Programs that LM Space supports, where partnership, integrity, and reliability are prioritized.

The Harness and Cable Design group is an organization that is responsible for mechanical and electrical design tasks relating to wire harness, cable design, and interconnecting of electronic equipment. This position is for an Electrical Engineer that collaborates well in a team environment, has excellent communication skills, and proactively takes initiative.

This role will be responsible for interpretation and accurate implementation of detailed component performance specifications and Interface Control Drawings (ICD). Support will include helping our team meet safety, schedule, and cost as it relates to Spacecraft Harness Design.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY WILL INCLUDE:
• Technical development and coordination of harness and cable wire connection lists
• Engineering change support
• Schematic capture of wiring diagrams.

Additionally, your contributions will aid in investigating design factors such as part availability, manufacturability, ease of assembly, weight, and cost.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES MAY INCLUDE:
• Documentation release
• Testing requirement definition
• Interface Control Drawing (ICD) interpretation
• Detailed Component Performance Specification interpretation
• Conceptual designs
• Trade studies.

Strong collaboration skills will be key to success as you work alongside early career and experienced engineers in partnership with other disciplines, such as Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, and Quality Engineering.

As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a flexible and dynamic team environment while gaining direct product knowledge from experienced engineers. Additionally, there will be numerous opportunities to help represent the Harness and Cable team, with many opportunities for career development along the way.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
• 5 - 9 years of professional experience for this role.
• Willingness to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI w/Poly clearance, thus US Citizenship is required for this position.

BENEFITS OF EMPLOYMENT:
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Lockheed Martin. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
qualifications:
• Bachelor of Science or higher from an accredited college in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education.

• Coursework/experience in electrical design.

• Fluency in ECAD applications (Zuken E3, etc.) tools.

• Willing and able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI w/Poly Clearance.
skills:
• Electrical interconnect experience including wire list generation and schematic experience.
• Familiarity with Space programs, flight specifications, and/or COTS electronic equipment/components.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Ability to work in a collaborative and team-based environment.
• Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and problem solve.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Have you always wanted to know about Space Protection Programs (SPP) ?

When you join SPP you will be part of one of the most innovative and fastest moving organizations in Space. Come help build end-to-end Space Security Systems for the DoD and other customers. Our cutting edge capabilities assure the security and health of our nation’s space assets. We push the boundary of what gets done in space. One day people may hear the full story of your achievements. When the history books are written, they may discover the critical role you’ve played to defeat the enemies of freedom. Come be one of the women and men working quietly to keep the light of liberty shining. As a Space Element testbed and simulation engineer for Space Protection Programs, you will directly help establish the technical solution for one of our country's most vital and complex Space Systems.

You will work closely with a team of top technical talent from across the program to provide the best, integrated solution that meets overall performance, cost and schedule needs. This smallsat SPP program is built around a fast-paced, build-test-learn culture, with one of the most audacious set of mission objectives within LM-Space.

In this exciting role you will:
• Develop and integrate Simulations and Models to accurately predict the behavior of the system
• Integrate lower level (e.g. subsystem) models into the system model to enable a comprehensive and integrated perspective of system performance
• Use your excellent communication skills to work across the Lockheed Martin organization and customer/user community to ensure consensus and understanding of system performance and trades
• Lead the development of testbeds, automated test scripts, procedures, telemetry displays, limit files, Test Information Sheets, and other documentation used to conduct Space Vehicle (SV) and Subsystem level testing
• Be responsible for integrating a complex set of processor in the loop (PIL), hardware in the loop (HWIL) and FlatSat environments spanning a diverse set of hardware (avionics, sensor engineering development units, payloads) and software domains (GNC, mission-specific algorithms, hardware peripherals)
• Building demonstrations that shows evolving hardware and software maturity for the customer
• Develop and manage a system-level continuous integration (CI) release stream that’s compatible with the various development and verification environments

title: Cyber Security Analyst
description:
Lockheed Martin invites you to step up to one of today’s most daunting challenges: the use of advanced electronics to undermine our way of life. As a cybersecurity professional at Lockheed Martin, you’ll protect the networks that our citizens and the world depend upon each minute: Financial assets. Healthcare information. Critical infrastructure. Hazardous materials. The uninterrupted flow of energy that keeps modern life moving. Here, you’ll work with cybersecurity experts on the forefront of threat protection and proactive prevention. In this fast-paced, real-world environment, you’ll draw on all of your education and experience as well as the resources of Lockheed Martin to keep the threats at bay.

The candidate will be a member of the Network Assurance Team supporting a US Government customer as part of our Ogden, UT. The candidate will perform cyber threat intelligence analysis, correlate actionable security events, perform network traffic analysis using raw packet data, net flow, IDS, IPS and custom sensor output as it pertains to the cyber security of communications networks, and participate in the coordination of resources during incident response efforts.

Enter into the cyber terrain that most people know only from headlines and sci-fi. Become part of the Cybersecurity Team at Lockheed Martin. You are meant to make a difference.
qualifications:
-Hold DoD-8570 baseline certification (Security+, CEH, CYSA+, CISSP, or equivalent).
-Possess an active Secret security clearance.
-Practical experience with cyber specific analysis tools
-General understanding of intrusion detection and incident response
-Working knowledge of TCP/IP, common networking ports and protocols, network traffic flow, countermeasure techniques, OSI model, defense-in-depth, Cyber Kill Chain or similar attack model.
-Willing to perform shift work.
skills:
-Computer Network Defense experience (Protect, Detect, Respond, and Sustain) within a Computer Incident Response organization.
-Demonstrated understanding of the life cycle of network threats, attacks, attack vectors, and methods of exploitation with an understanding of intrusion set Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures.
-Demonstrated hands-on experience analyzing high volumes of logs, network data (e.g. Netflow, Full Packet Capture), and other artifacts in support of incident investigations.
-In-depth knowledge of architecture, engineering, and operations of at least one enterprise SIEM platform (e.g. Nitro/McAfee Enterprise Security Manager, ArcSight, QRadar, LogLogic, Splunk).
-Experience and proficiency with any of the following: Anti-Virus, HIPS, IDS/IPS, Wireshark, Full Packet Capture, Host-Based Analysis, intel threat analysis.
-Familiar with encryption methods and encoding of data
-Experience with malware analysis concepts and methods.
-UNIX/LINUX command line experience.
-Scripting and programming experience.
-Motivated self-starter with strong written and verbal communications skills, and the ability to create complex technical reports on analytic findings.

title: Program Planner/Scheduler (early to mid-career level)
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Space is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing team is on a mission to make a difference in the world. Every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to craft, design, and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and build incredible products. We provide the resources, support, and focus. You bring the passion and courage to envision limitless possibilities and we’ll build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters! Lockheed Martin Space builds satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for our government and commercial customers. Connecting people, advancing discovery, and protecting what matters most. Our satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide. As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. As that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you? Come, join our Program Management team in the dynamic world Space. Here, we are driven by innovation and integrity. By applying the highest standards of business ethics and a forward-thinking mindset, we believe everything is within our reach – and yours -- as a Lockheed Martin employee.

Our facility in Littleton, CO has an immediate opportunity for an early to mid-career level Program Planner/Scheduler to join our mission supporting the Commercial Civil Space (CCS) line of business in Littleton, CO. This is an exciting opportunity in which you will have the ability to support various programs in Deep Space, Advanced Programs, Weather and Earth Science, and Communications Satellite Solutions. As a Program Planner on our planning team, you will conduct and manage a variety of activities for programs and proposals.

Summary of Key Duties: In this role you will….

• Interface with programs, proposal teams and product teams on schedule related topics

• Identify and drive planning process improvements for the line of business

• Develop and maintain Integrated Master Schedules in MS Project Server

• Combine multi-functional inputs to encompass the end-to-end program lifecycle

• Conduct critical path & risk analyses and output into actionable data for the program

• Communicate schedule impacts and develop corrective action proposals

• Provide guidance to Control Account Managers in the application of Earned Value

• Develop schedules that incorporate contractual scope, workflow, and resources

Our employees working in this level of position typically have 5- 10 years of experience.


Join us. Let’s do Space!

title: Manager, Optical Payload Requirements & Verification
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for space applications as an Optical Payload System Engineering Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are looking for a strong leader to drive the Optical Payload Requirements and Verification group for optical instruments. This department provides the Optical Payload systems engineering function within payload IPTs (Integrated Product Teams) to deliver optical subsystems to the LOBs (Lines of Businesses).

As Manager, you will:
• Champion the development of specifications for active / passive optical payloads.
• Advocate the use of consistent templates optical payload programs.
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers and key performance parameters. Fold emerging mission trends into current practices to ensure a discriminating edge.
• Enable common usage of products across multiple applications in Space, thereby strengthening designs.

We are seeking a colleague with strong verbal and written communication skills in order to build effective relationships across organizations, disciplines (electrical, mechanical, thermal, software) and with customers.

That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

Every day, our 110,000 employees come to work with one focus – our customers’ missions. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience, and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

What does this role look like?

We Do Space at Lockheed Martin. Eleven Mars-bound orbiters and landers. The next human-rated spacecraft destined for the Moon and beyond. The first-ever comet sample return. The first 3D-printed parts in deep space. More interplanetary spacecraft than any other U.S. company. And we’re just getting started. Now we need your help in telling our story to the world

This role will offer you the following daily challenges:

We’re looking for a motivated communications professional to support executive communications as a member of the Lockheed Martin Space Communications team. Reporting to the Manager of Executive Communications, the person in this role will orchestrate key executive leaders across the Space business to deliver a compelling narrative using reputation-building channels, as well as secure internal and external opportunities for thought leadership. This position will have the unique opportunity to interact with leaders at the highest levels of the company and learn the fundamentals of being a trusted communications advisor for executive leadership. The successful candidate will be a highly organized, driven self-starter who can successfully manage multiple projects and deadlines.

• Build and execute an annual engagement strategy that helps key executives share a clear enterprise-wide vision and connects them more directly with internal and external stakeholders.

• Develop integrated communications plans and execute deliverables to ensure key executives are seen and heard in venues that provide clear opportunities to engage with stakeholders and shape dialogue.

• Work cross-functionally with members of the Space Communications team and key stakeholders across the business to ensure an integrated approach to communications engagements.

This position is in one of the Coolest places to work: Denver, Colorado.
qualifications:
To be successful, you will need to possess these basic qualifications:

• Bachelor's Degree in one of the following disciplines: Communications, Journalism, English or equivalent experience/combined education, with professional experience and specialized training commensurate with assignment.
• 5+ years relevant experience in corporate communications, PR, and/or marketing communications.
• Excellent writing and editing skills, including the use of AP Style.
• Experience creating and implementing communications plans.
• Ability to build both strategic and tactical plans that drive perceptions, deliver key messages and get results.
• Familiarity with a wide variety of communication channels, techniques and emerging technologies, with a natural curiosity that leads to continuous improvement.
• Proven exceptional strategic, written, and verbal communication skills, with an ability to persuade and motivate action.
• You will need to be a US Citizen, as well as successfully pass a drug and background check, in order to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
skills:

• Attention to detail, adaptability, and a sense of urgency.
• Strong work ethic and positive attitude.
• A self-starter who can be depended upon to ensure the accuracy and quality of content with minimal day-to-day supervision.
• Ability to multitask, adapt and work well in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

title: Electro-Optical Payload Electronics CPE
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as a Payload Electronics Certified Principal Engineer (CPE)!

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

As a Payload Electronics CPE you will be: (a) working with Systems Engineering and subcontractors to develop specifications; (b) assuring optical payload electronic configuration Items, circuitry designs and electrical components with specific characteristics are within specified electrical requirements and perform according to specifications, (c) a part of a team developing designs, analyzes, and tests for electro-optical systems and components to drive common, high TRL payload products across programs.

Responsibilities include:
• Performing as a CPE for the development of optical payload electronics systems
• Leading design reviews, Engineering Material Review Board (EMRB) hardware discrepancy decisions and Failure Review Board (FRB) as required
• Resolving test anomalies and troubleshooting
• Generation, review and presentation of payload electronics Product Certifications
• Support of system level testing
• Providing technical guidance and direction to electronics vendors and LM electrical design teams to ensure compliance of optical payload electronics products with all program requirements
• Leadership of cross-functional development teams, coordinating with partners (e.g. subcontractor, customer, SEIT, and parts organizations)
• Ownership of optical payload electronics documentation (design, analysis, and interface definitions)
• Creation of technology maturation and risk reduction plans for critical electrical payload elements and subsystems
• Supporting proposal development activities for objective payload systems
• Coordinating with partners and stakeholders (e.g., subcontractor, customer, SEIT, and multiple M&P and parts organizations) and handling closure of Action Items and Liens
• Managing risk and identifying mitigation plans to meet productivity, quality, cost, schedule, and mission success objectives

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

qualifications:

• Experience leading others as a project or team lead in developing optical and/or electrical products through all phases of the life cycle
• Experience in development of analog or digital electronic circuitry
• Experience as a technical product lead of analog and/or digital electronics systems
• U.S. citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI /Poly clearance
skills:

title: Delivery Management Project Lead
jobcode: E2294:Mult Fnc Info Sys Anlst Stf
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. This position is a Project Lead within the Delivery Management Team. The Delivery Management Team is responsible for the deployment phase within the baseline life cycle. They are the project leads for the promotion of software baselines, COTS, GOTS and Hardware to the local test system and the operational system. They perform audits of baseline content, research and resolve inconsistencies from the audits, maintain the release content documentation, customize the detailed promotion installation checklist, conduct the execution of the promotion checklist during the baseline promotions, brief status to Management and Customers, lead the lessons learned and best practices process, maintains the team’s process and procedure documentation, and maintain promotion metrics. The operational system is a 24X7, large scale, Linux-based system written primarily in C++ using Oracle Relational Databases.

In this position you will:

• Develop and maintain executable plans/schedules to deliver COTS, GOTS, program specific custom software, and hardware to multiple locations;
• Be able to design, develop and analyze baseline releases containing software and hardware to produce schedule that manage timelines and interdependencies using historical data as a starting footprint that is tuned with process improvements;
• Using tools, be able to measure progress and anticipate resource dependencies/bottlenecks with detail reports that show where and slack exists or where schedules do not close;
• Enable team members to manage tasks, collaborate, and/or flag issues and risks to proposed schedules and with concurrence, make the necessary adjustments to the schedule;
• With reports, enable upper management to define business drivers, measure strategic impact of competing ideas, and view project and resource status across the enterprise.

title: Deer Creek - Information Systems Security Officer
description:
Lockheed Martin is a Cyber Security pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing employees are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education. Come and experience your future!

Journeyman level member of a team of Classified Cybersecurity Professionals in support of multiple programs at Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) Deer Creek Facility in Littleton .

The candidate must have experience with the development, implementation, and maintenance of Windows and Linux Servers/Clients, PC Desktops, network devices, supported applications, and/or Government-Off-The-Shelf (GOTS) solutions. Successful candidates will have a detailed understanding of the US Government system accreditation process under Risk Management Framework (RMF). This may include one or more of the following guidance directives: Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency (DCSA) Assessment and Authorization Process Manual (DAAPM), Joint Special Access Program (SAP) Implementation Guide (JSIG), Intelligence Community Directive (ICD) 503, Department of Defense Instruction (DoDI) 8500.01, National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publication (SP) 800-37, NIST SP 800-53, and Committee on National Security Systems Instruction (CNSSI) 1253. The candidate will be responsible for systems security, testing, and system accreditation activities for multiple platforms. The candidate will apply information technology security principles and configure security settings, complete weekly system audits, scan and assist with security patches, and conduct media reviews. Assist in the development and implementation of government approved information security procedures and plans for the operation of multiple networked systems, and coordinate government agency approvals. Consult on the design, development, integration, and analysis of classified computing systems with the programs and Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM). Assist with self-inspection reviews. Assist in conducting comprehensive investigation of computer security incidents, coordinating with other organizations for expertise.

Mission requirements may require other than first-shift work. Other duties as assigned.
RMSLI2021

title: Thrust Vector Control Design and Integration Lead
description:
As we enter a new era of Weapon Systems, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems! Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

Navy Strategic Programs (NSP) is experiencing significant growth, and we need your expertise to deliver amazing new technologies to our customers.We have opportunities that include sophisticated Hypersonic Technology, Glide Body Strike technology, and other key technology insertions. The early design and engineering phase provides you with tremendous career growth potential along with important assignments to stretch and hone your expertise. This is a rare opportunity to work closely alongside our Navy Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) partners to field a number of future strategic systems that the nation urgently needs. Lockheed Martin (LM) is looking for a dedicated Mechanical Systems Design and Integration Engineer to become a member of the Mechanical Controls Team.

The Thrust Vector Control Design and Integration Leadwill be responsible for leading the team in charge of the design, development, assembly, qualification, and integration of an electromechanical thrust vector control subsystem.

In this role, responsibilities will include:

• Provide technical expertise and leadership to ensure the Thrust Vector Control Subsystem design satisfies all requirements and is successful integrated into the next higher assembly
• Provide technical program management to subcontractors

title: Full Stack Cloud Engineer
description:
This is a Full Stack Engineering role to support service onboarding and utilization within our Cloud Services Engineering team, working for Lockheed Martin Enterprise Business Services (EBS). The position will be part of a motivated team of engineers who are focused on the design, development, and deployment of infrastructure, platform, and application services for the LM Hybrid Cloud environment.
Additionally, the qualified candidate would be expected to consume new concepts and technologies quickly, as well as be able to educate technologists on their applicability and usage. title: Mission Planner
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Lockheed Martin Space Systems Company seeks a Mission Planner to join the team in Aurora, CO.

Mission planners utilize complex system software to accomplish all ground and space system tasks and recommend improvements, and analyze software and system performance with respect to mission operations.
You will be required to successfully complete the Mission Planner certification.

This position will also support new systems deliveries and contribute to the implementation of both software and hardware to support future deliveries om National Level Systems.

Additional certifications, including support to 24/7 shift operations, may be required after initial certification.
Applicants selected will be subject to government security investigations and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Must have a current SSBI and SCI access.

title: Staff Electro-Optical Engineer - Camera CPE
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for space applications as a Staff Electro-Optical Engineer!

The Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Some of your specific responsibilities will include being the Certified Principal Engineer (CPE), and:
• Work with systems engineering and subcontractors to develop specifications
• Assure electronic circuitry designs and optical components with specific characteristics fit within specified mechanical & power limits and perform according to specifications
• Manage a team developing designs, analyzes, and tests for optical and electro-optical systems and components

We are looking for a strong background in electro-optical engineering. This would include both practical and theoretical knowledge of laboratory hardware for electro-optical sensor and component characterization. You should demonstrate effective verbal communication, develop concise and professional technical presentations, and deliver briefings to peers, leadership, and US Government customers. We are seeking a new colleague who is willing and able to work in a classified environment.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 7-10 years of professional experience, a Masters and 5-8 years, or a PhD and 2-5 years.

description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. As a Reliability Engineer, you will support the Systems Engineering (SE) Special Disciplines Organization in one or more of the following areas: Reliability and/or Anomaly Detection & Resolution (ADR) / Fault Management. In this role your responsibilities will include:
• Applying, maintaining and executing the Reliability & Maintainability (R&M) program plan per the customer requirements
• Working along with Domain Experts in various fields, performing analyses at all levels of the total system product over its life cycle to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal
• Working with Statements of Work (SOWs) and System Specifications to ensure the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total system solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints
• Performing or assisting in technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems
• Performing detailed trade studies and requirements allocation and interface definition studies in your subject area to translate customer requirements into hardware and/or software specifications

title: Systems Integration / Test Engineer, Senior Staff
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.  Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. We offer business resource groups such as African American Council for Excellence (AACE), The Women’s Impact Network (WIN), Hispanic Organization for Leadership & Awareness (HOLA), Military/Veterans Network, PRIDE LGBT Professional Network, and more. We are also committed to enabling transitioning veterans to connect with their communities and find new purpose as they reintegrate into civilian life. By clicking on the links, you can find out more on how we proudly support Global Diversity and Hiring Our Heroes.

We are seeking a Systems Integration/Test Engineer to represent ATLO (Assembly, Test, and Launch Operations) on the Hawkeye Program within the Optical Center of Excellence (OPCoE) organization. You will work shoulder-to-shoulder and partner with Hawkeye OPCoE Leadership and Subject Matter Experts to successfully Assemble, Integrate, and Test Hawkeye products.

Summary of Key Duties for this position:
• Development and execution of the overall Assembly, Integration, and Test Plan
• Planning and execution of detailed schedules
• Reviewing Engineering Specs/Drawings and championing Design for Integration and Test (DFx) requirements that positively influence the system design for ATLO
• Identifying, designing, and fabricating Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE) and Mechanical Ground Support Equipment (MGSE)
• Preparing Facilities for Assembly, Integration, and Test (AI&T) activities
• Developing and releasing Integration & Test Procedures, Test Scripts, and Manufacturing Work Instructions
• Communicating ATLO status to peers, leadership, and customers
• Presenting at Program Management Reviews (PMR), Design Reviews (PDR/CDR), and Test Readiness Reviews (TRR)
