title: Program Quality Eng Staff
description:
At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education.

Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Come and experience your future!

The Program Quality Engineer will have responsibility for alignment of process & product quality on the C2BMC program. This position requires a strong understanding of Software Quality Assurance, Hardware Quality processes, Supplier Quality practices, and the ability to adapt to program needs. You will help to guide technical decisions that craft the software system design and drive design evolution. Having a Program Quality Assurance approach, you will use independent & objective judgement of process performance against Software, Network, and Cyber product quality. You will work side by side with engineering and program management, evaluating product and processes to drive detailed improvements, and facilitate those activities, to improve product quality and process cycle times. Using Supplier Quality practices, you will help ensure accurate flow-down & trace of standard and quality requirements to suppliers and subcontractors. There will be occasions for subcontractor Evaluations both programmatic and at the subcontractor site. Through an understanding of the Hardware Quality processes, you will review engineering drawings and Work Orders, inspect assembled product, and inspect installations at various CONUS and OCONUS locations. Additionally, you will recommend and analyze program and quality process performance and product quality metrics and drive their implementation with the ability to identify adverse trends, understand/identify risks, and drive effective corrective action. The candidate will collaborate with the Quality Program Manager and work closely with both the Quality team and the Multi-functional Product Teams apply, change, and maintain the quality management system that drives the delivery of objectives and features that the Missile Defense Agency customer has defined in their Statement of Work and C2BMC Element Specification, for operational deployment.

Additional Program Quality Engineer’s responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

•For issues discovered, facilitate Root Cause Analysis events that identify complete root causes and associated corrective actions.

•Evaluate process/product performance and participate/collaborate with the engineering counterparts on program activities to assure processes and products are compliant to contractual requirements.

•Supervise the product development including requirements allocation, architecture, design, development, integration & test, and acceptance of products and solutions.

•Ability to evaluate data to identify systemic issues and trends; provide reports to senior management.

•Provide inputs to the Quality Program Manager to ensure sound labor estimates on ECPs and ongoing proposal efforts.

•Perform HW Configuration audits and Software Configuration audits.

•Witness testing activities and formal quality testing, as required.
qualifications:
- Previous experience in Software Development Lifecycles (e.g., Agile, Iterative, Waterfall, Spiral). Previous experience in Systems Engineering Methodologies (Model Based and DoDAF).

- Experienced in performing Configuration Audits of both developed and COTS systems. Experienced in validating Software requirements sell-off and associated tool usage (such as DOORS, RTM, JIRA). Code and peer review experience.

- Experienced reviewer of technical documentation. Experienced root cause analysis practitioner. Experienced in writing and managing performance of corrective and preventative actions. Process auditing experience.

- Secret security clearance required to start.
skills:
- Software, Computer, and/or Electrical Engineering degree/background. 5+ years of quality engineering experience.

- Basic understanding of Software Languages (such as C#, C++ and Java).

- DoD contract experience.

- Knowledge of LM RMS process and procedures.

- Lean/Six Sigma black (or green) belt certification.

- Formal Process Auditing training and experience.

- Experienced with peer reviews of software systems or documents.

- Experience in Process and performance measurement: developing, collecting and analyzing metrics.

- Self-starter who is detail oriented, well organized and able to self-prioritize and complete tasks within in a dynamic and demanding environment. Strong interpersonal and conflict management skills working within a diverse environment and across many disciplines. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to build and provide briefings and status reports.

- Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Math, Computer Science or related professional experience.

title: Senior Focal Plane Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for space applications as an Electro-Optical Engineer!

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Defending against modern day missile threats requires constant collaboration and innovation. That’s why we’re able to integrate systems from end to end so you can detect, control and engage the full spectrum of missile threats across every domain. We’re investing in disruptive technology like directed energy, space-based capabilities, and solid state-radar to create layers of defense that help keep us all safe.

Shooting a missile down with a missile was once a concept only dreamed up in science fiction novels. We’ve made it scientific fact!

So what does it take to spot an enemy missile launch, identify its intended target, calculate its exact trajectory, launch an interceptor and guide it to destroy the threat in mid-air all in a matter of seconds? It’s not easy – but at Lockheed Martin, we help customers solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with perfection and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

As an OPCoE Senior Focal Plane Engineer, your responsibilities will include:
• Work under broad guidance from senior engineering and program leadership
• Collaborate and contribute across the design team
• Guide the work of junior and emerging engineers
• Engage with prospective and selected suppliers
• Deliver robust documents and briefings
• Support customer reviews

You must have a strong understanding of physics and mathematics associated with design, development, and use of photo-detectors, readout integrated circuits (ROICs), and interface/control electronics and software for use in remote sensing and communications applications.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree with 5 years of professional experience, a Masters degree with 3 years, or a PhD.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
qualifications:
• Background in electro-optic sensors and/or electronics
• Experience with imaging focal planes and relevant performance parameters
• Practical and theoretical knowledge of laboratory hardware for electro-optical sensor and component characterization
• Experience with integration, test and verification of electronics and sensor systems
• Experience with electronics processor requirements and usage
• Experience deriving requirements and writing specifications based on customer requirements
• Experience in the development of verification plans and approaches to support development
• The ability to obtain and maintain a DOD security clearance; US citizenship is required
skills:
• Knowledge of a wide range of detector technologies for use in the full optical spectrum from ultraviolet (UV) through long-wave infrared (LWIR) wavelengths
• Experience with both direct-detection and coherent-detection techniques
• Ability to develop novel sensor concepts and architectures, including: strawman sensor concept design, architecture trade studies, feasibility analysis, modeling and simulation, optical design
• Expertise in optical theory and design, including radiometry, geometrical optics, physical optics, Fourier optics, adaptive optics, and/or fiber optics

• Knowledge and/or experience in related technologies, including:
• Real-time processing systems, FPGAs, micro-controllers, measurement and acquisition hardware
• Photonic-Integrated Circuit (PIC) physics, design, technologies and applications.
• RF electronics, analog electronics, digital electronics
• Control systems, including theory, design, and operation
• Signal and data processing, including processing hardware and software/algorithms

• Active TS/SCI

title: Laser Communications Engineer
description:
Come join the Lockheed Martin Space RF & Radar Payload Center of Excellence and shape the future! You can work on challenging programs in support of Space Vehicles, Hypersonics, Missile Defense and more.
The coolest jobs on this planet…or any other… are with Lockheed Martin (LM) Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus, and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.
Do you have a passion for working on emerging technologies?
As a Laser Communication Engineer with LM Space you will contribute toward the development and delivery of Laser Communication subsystem solutions for space platforms. Laser Communication subsystems are an emerging need for our platforms and serve missions ranging from human space flight, commercial broadband services, national intelligence, protected communications, Pointing/Navigation/Timing, and more. Our product portfolio addresses the critical needs of our commercial, civil, and government customers to field 5G communication solutions.
The Laser Communication Engineer will contribute to the design, development, test and integration of space-based optical communication systems. You will develop specifications, perform product trade analyses, execute detailed implementation, conduct laboratory and field testing, validate performance through analysis and testing, certify a deliverable product, and/or integrate the product onto a space vehicle.
The Laser Communication Engineer emphasizes ‘systems thinking’ throughout the product lifecycle. To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin nurtures an inclusive work environment that inspires diverse perspectives and big-picture thinking.

description:

Candidate will work collaboratively with the SEIT Manager and other project leads to ensure successful delivery of Systems Engineering products to the implementation teams. title: Systems Engineer Sr - Integration and Test
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Looking for a career with purpose? One that challenges your mind, grows your skills and contributes to our Nation’s most critical missions? Do you pride yourself on solving problems that others think are impossible?

If you answered yes to these questions, then we would like you to join Lockheed Martin's Space Mission Solutions, S2CO Engineering Team!

Mission Solutions develops, delivers, and operates affordable engineering and sustainment solutions for commercial, military and intelligence users across the globe.

These mission critical efforts include development of innovative enterprise, cloud and application-based solutions for mission management, command and control, collection orchestration and tasking, processing, data analysis and analytics along with premier operations and sustainment capabilities of space- based programs in support of national security.

Establishes functional and technical specifications and standards, solves hardware/software interface problems, defines input/output parameters, and ensures integration of the entire system or subsystem.

Reviews, evaluates and derives requirements for testability, develops and directs preparation and execution of comprehensive test plans, procedures and schedules for complete systems and/or subsystems.

Coordinates subsystem and/or system testing activities with programs and other organizations.

Performs analysis of test results and prepares comprehensive subsystem and/or system level evaluation reports which verify and validate system performance at the CI level.

Writes discrepancy reports and performs integration regression testing to verify/validate incorporated fixes to software, components, subsystems and systems.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. A TS/SCI Clearance required for this role.

title: Systems Engineer-IT Staff
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Summary of Key Duties for this position:
We're seeking candidates who are passionate about their craft, adamant about product quality and focused on our customer’s mission. We constantly measure our employee’s success and reward our top performers through salary increases, bonuses and awards.
You will be designing state-of-the-art concepts while delivering innovative and affordable capabilities in a new and emerging area of protecting USG space assets. You will be working on a mission that you can be proud of, knowing that you are making a lasting difference in the world and in the Space domain.

You will serve as a DevSecOps and IT Engineer for a team tasked with setting up an open architecture infrastructure and developing web services and modern user interfaces to meet mission needs. You must leverage data gathered from integration and system tests, i.e. system metrics and service telemetry, to classify and solve critical issues. You will adapt to ever changing environments and provide support when and where needed. You will write and maintain cutting edge infrastructure as code (IAC) to support micro-service based products.
You will be working side by side with extraordinarily talented and experienced engineers, while having the opportunity to lead and mentor less experienced individuals on the team.
Candidate must be able to lead systems thinking, coordinate cross-team development, drive quality, and shoulder accountability for major aspects of mission and program success. Candidate must have the ability to adapt to agile methods that will require a dynamic execution approach, depending on the time-phased needs of the program.

title: Electronics Engineer, Electrical Power Subsystem Manager, TS/SCI
description:
Are you ready to take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO?

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. This position will support multiple programs within Remote Sensing. Specific job responsibilities include:
• Serving as Integrated Product Team Lead for the Electrical Power Subsystem
• Leading a team of 5-8 engineers responsible for electronics box design, integration, and test
• Control Account Management (CAM), with cost and schedule responsibility
• Regular interaction with manufacturing team to support program deliveries

In this role, you will:
• Lead and coordinate technical design changes.
• Conduct and support design reviews, Engineering Material Review Board (EMRB) hardware discrepancy decisions and Failure Review Board(FRB) as required.
• Resolve test anomalies and troubleshooting, and generation, review and presentation of Product Certification, and also support system level testing.
• Manage risk and identify mitigation plans to meet productivity, quality, cost, schedule, and mission success objectives.

IT WOULD BE GREAT IF YOU:
• Have a project lead track record of success in meeting technical, schedule, and cost objective is desired.
• Have knowledge of satellite power subsystems.
• Have excellent written and verbal communication skills with personnel of various skill levels, technical backgrounds, management, and customers.
• Previously worked on integrated product teams.
• Enjoy working in a manufacturing and test environment with hands-on hardware interaction.

FOR THIS POSITION, YOU WILL TYPICALLY HAVE:
• 10+ years of professional experience for this role.
• Must have an active TS/SCI clearance to be considered for this position.

description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should consider joining the Lockheed Martin Space Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) as a Staff Optical Payload Designer! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members bring together authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

As an Optical Payload Designer, your responsibilities will include being the lead optics designer on one or more of OPCoE's critical programs.

title: Proposal Analyst Stf
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

Do you have a passion and dream to be a difference maker? Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can contribute to a very important mission? Come and be part of our team in the dynamic world of Lockheed Martin Space. We are seeking strategic thinkers to develop proposals and secure pursuits to further connect Lockheed Martin Space to the advancement of discovery, and protection of what matters most, while benefiting the future of our country.

This position offers an exciting opportunity to join the LM Space estimating organization and will be a key member in the LM Space Central Estimating organization which is responsible for the LM Space Estimating System. The successful candidate will:

• Provide strategic guidance to LM Space proposal teams and management throughout proposal development, negotiation and certification activities to ensure proposals are delivered in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and Lockheed Martin requirements.

title: Multi Functional Finance Analyst Senior
description:
Our world is a dynamic place, more so today than ever before. Come join us on Special Programs as we navigate the ever-changing global landscape. If you love all things space and get excited about the prospect of building premier spacecraft for our customers, then Special Programs is the place for you to make a difference. Do what matters.

The Military Support Program (MSP) within the Special Programs Line of Business is seeking an energetic and proactive person to join the Finance and Business Operations (F&BO) team. MSP offers a broad portfolio of contracts that fall into all stages of the product lifecycle (initial baseline, program execution and closeout), which creates an exciting and dynamic environment where the candidate should be comfortable with balancing competing priorities. Strong communication skills are required as this role interfaces with many functions (Planning, Program Management, Engineering, Subcontract Management, etc.).

The successful candidate will perform cost management and Earned Value Management (EVM) activities on multiple contracts within MSP including: support to Control Account Managers (CAMs), Integrated Product Teams (IPTs), and analysis of financial data in order provide information to the management team to enable sound business decisions.
Duties include:
• Establishing and maintaining control account budget baseline and estimates at complete.
• Analyzing EV performance data and advising CAMs on financial matters.
• Input and maintenance in cost tool (COBRA)
• Support Rolling Wave Planning, Integrated Baseline and Internal Surveillance Reviews.
• Interfacing with Planning to ensure cost and schedule integration meets expectations.

title: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Engineer Stf
description:
When it comes to using cutting-edge machine learning to tackle complex problems, Lockheed Martin is driven by a singular mission focus and desire to continuously innovate. Today’s challenges to global security aren’t just changing – they’re accelerating faster than ever before. Through our dedication to our mission, our AI-enabled systems are changing the way militaries operate and protect their forces, the way first responders fight fires, and how researchers explore the far reaches of space and the ocean’s depths.

The Lockheed Martin Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy professional with a strong background in software engineering, artificial intelligence and machine learning to support the Applied AI team and product portfolio, focusing on a broad range of projects across the LAIC. The team is focused on exploiting small, innovative and agile teams to rapidly iterate and mature solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the Lockheed Martin enterprise and in the field for our customers.

The selected candidate will focus on the development of technologies and products that leverage Artificial Intelligence to provide discriminating capability to our customers. This will require engagement in every phase of the system development lifecycle including requirements generation, system and software design, implementation, integration, and flight test. Activities will range from low TRL research, proof of concepts, development of prototypes, building demonstrators, and transition to production. The selected candidate can expect to utilize current AI paradigms including computer vision, deep learning, and reinforcement learning, applying these techniques to solve complex problems and field innovative solutions. The selected candidate will also be expected to assume technical lead responsibilities, take ownership of critical tasks and mentor junior engineers.

Must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time management and interpersonal skills.

There is a preference for the selected candidate to be based in Shelton, Connecticut with the core team. However, the selected candidate can work at any major Lockheed Martin facility or remotely.

Must be a US Citizen.
qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience, with 9 years of professional experience; or 7 years of professional experience with a related Master’s degree.
• Experience using machine learning frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow, MxNet, Caffe, etc.)
• Experience with Python and multiple libraries (NumPy, OpenCV, Scikit, Pandas, etc.)
• Experience with C++, Java, GO, and other compiled languages
• Experience with DevOps tools: Docker, Git [GitLab, GitHub], Continuous Integration [CI], Continuous Deployment [CD]
• Experience with modern Computer Vision
• Experience developing applications on Linux
• Experience with high-performance computing
• Experience with network/messaging (UDP, ZeroMQ, RESTful API, etc.)
• Experience interfacing with databases (SQL, MongoDB, etc.)
• Must be a US Citizen

Performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, mission analysis, orbital dynamics analysis, test, installation, operations, maintenance, and disposal. Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications.

title: Responsible Electronics Engineer, Power Subsystem Lead, TS/SCI
description:
Take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO!

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Do you want join a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

As a Electrical Power Subsystem Responsible Electronics Engineer for LM 400, you will directly help establish the technical solution and overall system design for one of our country's most vital and sophisticated Space Systems!

RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:
• Lead the design and development of system and sub system power design for complex missions touching space and ground segments
• Perform modeling and analysis (such as Battery, Power Budget and Solar Array Power Performance) on power architectures to evaluate against mission and performance needs
• Ensuring the logical and detailed conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions
• Establishing system architecture and CONOPS, perform system trades and analysis, flow down the architecture and CONOPS into requirements and interfaces, and support verification planning

*Position is contingent upon program award expected September 2021.

== YOU WILL TYPICALLY HAVE: ===
• 9 - 15 years of professional experience.
• Must have an active TS/SCI clearance to be considered for this position.

title: Spacecraft Systems Engineer
description:
Have you always wanted to know about Space Protection Programs (SPP)?

When you join SPP you will be part of one of the most inventive and fastest moving organizations in Space. Come help build end-to-end Space Security Systems for the DoD and other customers. Our cutting edge capabilities assure the security and health of our nation’s space assets. We push the boundary of what gets done in space. One day people may hear the full story of your achievements. When the history books are written, they may discover the critical role you’ve played to defeat the enemies of freedom. Come be one of the people working quietly to keep the light of liberty shining.

As a Spacecraft Systems Engineer, you will:
• Define the Requirements and Verification Baseline
• Develop Specification and Interface Control Documents
• Support development of SPP program baselines, ground and flight test planning, and design reviews
• Participate in value driven Systems Engineering team and drive design evolution in a systematic and thoughtful way
• Work closely with customer counterparts to develop, test and field a strategic system

title: Software Engineer
description:
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Are you a software engineer looking for something different? Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can make a difference to a very important mission? This is an exciting software development position supporting the growing Space Security division within Mission Solutions Line of Business.

The selected candidate will join the Arches program's Agile (scrum) Software Development Team. We're looking for a highly motivated and experienced software engineer to join our fast-paced development effort and contribute to the success of a very challenging and rewarding mission.

Typical Agile responsibilities include participation in daily scrums, sprint/release planning, demos, and retrospectives. Development responsibilities include software design, code and unit test, investigation into ad hoc issues, and the ability to analyze and resolve complex mission problems quickly and independently. The successful candidate will have a commendable work ethic, good communication skills, a great attitude, be a results oriented team player, creative thinker and problem-solver, and follow all ethical standards of the Lockheed Martin Corporation.

Selected candidate must have a TS/SCI security clearance and be cleared to the program to start.

title: AI/Machine Learning Engineer
description:
When it comes to using cutting-edge machine learning to tackle complex problems, Lockheed Martin is driven by a singular mission focus and desire to continuously innovate. Today’s challenges to global security aren’t just changing – they’re accelerating faster than ever before. Through our dedication to our mission, our AI-enabled systems are changing the way militaries operate and protect their forces, the way first responders fight fires, and how researchers explore the far reaches of space and the ocean’s depths.

The AimLabs Consulting Team is looking for a high energy individual with a strong background in machine learning and data science to help grow its business and streamline AI processes. The selected candidate will apply machine learning techniques in support of missions through Lockheed Martin programs and business functions. This role will have a particular focus on supporting the development of machine learning products by working with stakeholders to understand their business needs, translate them into data problems, and then set the direction of projects to solve those data problems. This individual must drive the work from prototype through to completion and delivery of a minimum viable product or final product so that the business users capture value from the work of the team.
The AimLabs Consulting Team’s mission includes serving as a center of excellence for AI at Lockheed Martin. The candidate will work to disseminate best practices of the AimLabs Consulting Team to other AI and data science teams in the corporation. The candidate will be required to create knowledge materials to publish these best practices, as well as meet with other data science leaders in Lockheed Martin to teach and discuss these practices.
The responsibilities of this position include collaboration with business stakeholders to identify business opportunities and requirements to develop associated analytical models that deliver useful, actionable recommendations, or which augment human capabilities in various work settings. The candidate is responsible for modeling complex business and engineering problems, discovering insights and deploying AI capabilities using machine learning and associated feature engineering techniques. Responsibilities also include tracking projects and driving work on them through to completion, as well as implementing best technical practices from the fields of machine learning and software engineering.
The candidate will need a combination of business focus, creative thinking, strong analytical and problem solving skills, and programming knowledge to be able to quickly cycle hypotheses through the discovery phase of the project. Excellent communications skills to understand the needs of the business, and to communicate the value of the models built back to the business.
Domestic travel will be required when travel resumes.

MUST BE A US CITIZEN.
qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience, with 5 years of professional experience; or 3 years of experience required with a related Master’s degree.
• Previous experience building machine learning models by way of work, projects, courses, etc.
• Previous experience in applying any of the following machine learning areas to business problems:
natural language processing, deep learning, anomaly detection, reinforcement learning.
• Previous experience evaluating model performance, including performance metric selection.
• Previous experience with feature engineering and data cleaning/pre-processing.
• Experience with developing software and software engineering best practices.
• Demonstrated creativity and innovation in identifying valuable ways of incorporating machine learning into business workflows and processes.
• Superlative communication and interpersonal skills.
• The ability to stay updated on new technologies in the rapidly evolving field of AI.
• Must have strong problem-solving skills, business acumen, and demonstrated excellent oral and written communication skills.
• Experience in running data product projects from start to finish and interacting with end user customers.
• Experience with stakeholder communication and defining requirements
• Preferred languages: Python or R.
• Must be a US citizen
skills:
• Experience with integration of data products into customer applications.
• Experience with or knowledge of data engineering.
• Experience with or knowledge of AWS.
• Experience with or expertise in manufacturing and/or engineering processes.
• Expertise in natural language processing.
• Expertise in deep learning, especially CNNs, RNNS, LSTMs, and reinforcement learning Story-telling and visualization.
• Experience with UI/UX and/or human-machine interaction.
• Experience with SQL, Hive, Spark.

title: ISSO - Classified Cybersecurity
description:
Active Secret clearance is required with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance.

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) will support Information Systems (IS) located at the LM Wooten facility in Colorado Springs, CO. This position will oversee day-to-day information system security operations including hardware and software implementations. Under general direction, the ISSO carries out technical administration of IS in accordance with internal LM and customer security requirements under the Risk Management Framework (RMF).

Job duties include:

- Ensure compliance with contract security specifications, customer governing requirements, DCSA Assessment and Authorization Process Manual (DAAPM), and LM Space security policies.
- Auditing of the IS
- Constant upkeep, monitoring, analysis, and response to network and security events
- Ensures systems are operated, maintained, and disposed of in accordance with internal security policies and practices outlined in the security plan
- Ensures configuration management (CM) for security-relevant IS software, hardware, and firmware is maintained and documented
- Evaluates proposed changes or additions to the information system, and advises the ISSM of their security relevance
- Ensures all information system security-related documentation is current and accessible to properly authorized individuals and maintained
- Assist and conduct security IS education
- Participates in internal/external security audits/inspections; performs risk assessments
- Ensures proper protection and / or corrective measures have been taken when an incident or vulnerability has been discovered
- Communicates, implements and manages a formal Information Security / Information Systems Security Program together with ISSM and contract program security representative (PSR)

Candidate will typically have a Bachelor's Degree and 5+ years of experience.

title: Alternate Information Systems Security Manager
description:
This position requires a Secret clearance with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance.

The Classified Cybersecurity Staff will partner with the security team, GPS and SBIRS Programs, and Government customers to perform as an Alternate Information Systems Security Manager (AISSM) for Information Systems (IS) located at the LM Facility in Colorado Springs, CO.

The desired candidate has experience in Information Systems Security Engineering.

In this role, you will:
• Oversee day-to-day information system security operations including assisting the ISSM on all technical security matters.
• Carry out technical administration of IS in accordance with internal LM and customer security requirements, primarily Risk Management Framework (RMF).
• Participating in auditing and continuous monitoring of the IS.
• Review and oversee RMF Package authorizations.
• Upkeep, monitor, analyze, and respond to security events.
• Document compliance actions within the approved automated compliance tracking system or develop a plan of actions and milestones (POA&M).
• Ensure systems are operated, maintained, and disposed of in accordance with internal security policies and practices.
• Ensure configuration management (CM) for security-relevant IS software, hardware, firmware, and system documentation.
• Ensure all information systems lifecycle management documentation are maintained.
• Evaluate proposed changes or additions to the information system, and advise the ISSM of their security relevance.
• Assist and conduct security IS education and training.
• Participate in internal/external security audits/inspections; performs risk assessments.
• Assist in conducting investigations of computer security violations and incidents.
• Ensure proper protection and corrective measures are taken when an incident or vulnerability has been discovered.
• Implement and enforce Information Security Policies and Procedures together with ISSM and CPSO.
qualifications:
• Final Secret Clearance with the ability to obtain a Top-Secret Clearance.
• DoD 8570 IAM Level III certification.
• Demonstrated technical experience for Windows, Networking, and NIX-based operating systems.
• Knowledge of cybersecurity requirements and best practices.
skills:
• Knowledge and experience in performing Agile and Lean operations.
• Sound collaboration, business acumen and project management skills, understanding of DevSecOps and CI/CD.
• Experience with information system accreditation authorities and their implementation of the Risk Management Framework (RMF).
• Experience with industry-standard Information Assurance tools and processes such as auditing, scanning and configuration management software.
• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a related discipline with 9 years of professional experience, or equivalent experience/combined education; or Masters degree in related discipline with 7 years of professional experience.

title: Software Quality Engineer Senior
description:
Your invitation to an exciting future!

Space technology connects millions of people around the world and we’re accelerating tomorrow’s breakthroughs to help our customers stay ahead in an ever-changing world. At Lockheed Martin Space, we are motivated by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin Space employee. Space values your skills, training, and education. Come and experience your future!

Lockheed Martin Space Systems Company is seeking energized individuals who are passionate about building the space technologies of tomorrow. We have an opportunity for a Software Quality Engineer (SQE) Senior at our Littleton, CO location. You will be supporting our Navigation Systems Quality Assurance efforts within Space Operations. We invite you to join the team in keeping this nation and our allies secure and enjoy a career with tremendous impact beyond any one individual. We offer you rare career opportunities and challenges in a program with a rich history and exciting future.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking. Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.

Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards and Recognition

You can learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package by visiting this link.
qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in technical discipline (e.g., engineering field) or equivalent discipline (e.g., math, physics, chemistry, etc.), with 5 years of professional experience; or 3 years of professional experience with a related Masters degree.
• Technical experience in a related discipline (e.g. Quality Engineering, System Safety, Engineering, Manufacturing, Integration & Test).
• Ability to obtain Secret Security clearance, COMSEC and Crypto. Position is contingent upon receiving final Secret clearance.
• Current US Citizenship.
• Knowledge of Quality systems/processes and knowledge of external quality standards such as ISO9001 and/or AS9100.
• Software Quality or Engineering experience in Requirements Analysis, Design/Development, Product Integration and Test.
• Ability to interpret software design and code (C/C++) to verify implementation of requirements.
• Ability to work off-shifts and weekends. Although infrequent, position will require some periodic off-shift support for development and testing tasks.
• Some travel (although infrequent) will be required for this position in order to support program objectives.
skills:
• Ability to work well in an environment with challenging requirements and dynamic schedules. Self-motivated.
• Experience with ClearQuest, ClearCase, DOORS, and other CM tools.
• ASQ Certified Software Quality Engineer (CSQE)
• Strong knowledge of Industry recognized Quality systems / models such as Capability Maturity Model Integrated (CMMI) and International (ISO)
• Experience in software systems test
• Knowledge of SAP/ERP
• Experience with JIRA and Confluence
• Experience with Code Collaborator
• Current Secret Security clearance and ability to obtain COMSEC and Crypto.
• Current MRB certification. Experience making Preliminary Review / Material Review Board decisions.
• Experience in executing test planning, processing, and non-conformance processing including root cause analysis and corrective action development.
• Experience in establishing quality assurance performance metrics for identifying process improvement.
• Experience with US Military customers.
• Experience working with DCMA and other government customer support organizations.
• Experience working with space vehicle subcontractors and suppliers.
• Understanding of export control and ITAR requirements for working with international suppliers.
• Lean/Six Sigma black (or green) belt.
• Proficient skill level with Microsoft Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage and develop rapport with the team and multiple partners and external customers.

title: Optical Payload Electronics Manager
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet…or any other… are with Lockheed Martin (LM) Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus, and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) as an Optical Payload Electronics Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are seeking a leader with a track record of delivering to technical, schedule, and financial commitments, and driving the best customer and enterprise value as a result. We want someone who demonstrates a breadth of technical knowledge across multiple functions and a variety of program experience. Our Optical Payload Electronics Manager is someone with exceptional communication skills, and a proven ability to represent the organization to customers, employees, and partners.

As the Optical Payload Electronics Manager, you will:
• Partner with Lines of Business (LOB), OPCoE Program Development, and OPCoE Payload Systems Engineering teams to develop architectures in a consistent manner to allow use of common products
• Develop transition plans for low TRL products from the science and technology community
• In coordination with OPCoE Program Development, propose and execute IRAD projects with a goal of standardization and maturation
• Enhance relationships with strategic suppliers and other LM Business Areas (BAs) to compliment the in-house OPCoE team
• Perform as part of the Integrated Product Team (IPT) in cases where an OPCOE make is selected
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers. Fold emerging mission trends into product roadmap to ensure a discriminating edge
• Implement and lead technical knowledge management to develop and maintain core competencies, key technical skills, knowledge continuity and facilitate career advancement opportunities to employees
• Handle staffing requirements sustain engineering capabilities and preserve critical skills.

Ideally, you will have a background in electro-optical engineering and possess degree from an accredited program in a related discipline, such as Bachelors degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or other Engineering/Science field.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
qualifications:
• Demonstrated experience with delivering space flight electronics
• Established experience in developing technical talent and building pipelines to sustain technical expertise within the organization
• US Citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a government clearance
skills:
• Have experience in interfacing, biasing and controlling focal plane assemblies. For passive EO, we work with staring and scanning FPAs in the visible and IR domain. For active EO, we work across multiple types of lidar receiver arrays, primarily GmAPD
• Have experience working across space and ground applications. Our systems include ground-to-ground, space to ground (and vice versa), and space to space
• Have experience in developing payload controller and image data processors. The Payload controller typically receives high level commands from the bus controller. The payload controller is responsible for decomposing bus commands into smaller, discrete commands that may be pushed out to a variety of nodes on the payload
• Have experience in developing image data processors. These image data processors may perform a range of processing. The processing may be relatively straightforward computations such as bad pixel mapping and non-uniformity correction. More complex processing may include machine learning/deep learning and autonomous decision making
• Have experience in developing laser/lidar controllers. These controllers must have the ability to control and sequence a laser system through various turn on/turn off sequences. This includes the laser power sources (DC-DC convertors) and any thermal regulation
• Variety of customer experience and exposure across Space Lines-Of-Businesses. Mission applications for optical payloads include remote sensing (earth pointing and deep space), directed energy, and missile seekers/interceptors
• Excellent communications skills both verbal and written with the proven ability to communicate
• Demonstrated ability to drive closure and resolve complex technical issues/challenges.
• Prior Full Spectrum Leadership roles with proven experience leading employees to perform productively and foster relationships in a cross-functional team environment
• 12+ years of demonstrated technical expertise (10+ years with a Master’s degree or above)
• 4+ years demonstrated hands-on expertise in space OR complex hardware/software systems
• Current TS/SCI clearance

title: Digital Engineering Integrated Product Team Lead
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

The RF RADAR and Payload Center of Excellence (RFCOE) is looking for a hardworking and energetic project manager to lead development and project execution for the next generation of digital processors. Digital processors support a multitude of space missions for military, commercial, civil, and special programs customers. Digital processors process data from secure communications, remote sensing, and bus applications. This opportunity is for an Integrated Product Team (IPT) leader to lead a multi-disciplinary team to design, develop, test and deliver a cutting-edge digital processor utilizing common products, leveraging state-of-the art digital technologies, while adhering to program budget and schedule constraints. The role is challenging, but also very rewarding with significant potential for career exposure and advancement on high-visibility programs. We invite all who have a passion for space, digital technologies, and project management to apply.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. title: Digital Systems Architect
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet…or any other… are with Lockheed Martin (LM) Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus, and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

As a Digital System Architect with Space you would lead the development and build of the next generation RF Digital Payload Processors and Communication Systems. Communication payloads or RF payloads are needed for every platform and serve missions ranging from human space flight, commercial broadband services, national intelligence, protected communications, navigation and more. Our product portfolio includes a wide range of international and domestic programs, addressing the important needs of our commercial, civil and military customers.

Specific responsibilities include:
•Act as program or proposal tech lead for digital processor design team
•Provide guidance to department as Chief Engineer
•Develop design concepts and technical baselines for payload communications processors and digital payload electronics
•Digital system product development leadership
•Develop digital system architecture
•Provide technical guidance and direction to electronics vendors, production, ATLO and LM design team to ensure compliance of the product with all program requirements.
•Leadership of cross-functional development teams, coordinating with partners (e.g. subcontractor, customer, SEIT, and parts organizations)
•Design, manufacturing, production, test, and ownership of documentation (design, analysis, and interface definition)
•Create technology maturation and risk reduction plans for critical payload elements and satellite subsystems
•Support proposal development activities for objective payload systems
•Coordinate with partners (e.g., subcontractor, customer, SEIT, and multiple M&P and parts organizations) and handle closure of Action Items and Liens.

This position may require domestic travel as necessary to fulfill job responsibilities.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin nurtures an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

qualifications:
• Proven leadership of cross-functional development teams, vendors, and subcontractors to ensure product compliance with customer requirements
• Ability to develop and analyze technical requirements, perform trade studies, conduct major design reviews (e.g. PDR and/or CDR) and allocate functions down to subsystems and hardware/software.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including a demonstrated ability to interact effectively with customers, management, and peers.
• Ability to write technical sections of customer requests for information (RFIs) or proposals, including developing presentations to describe the technical approach in a clear manner.
• Prior experience with phases of product lifecycle (e.g., SRR, PDR, CDR, MRR, and TRR).
• Active TS/SCI Clearance
skills:
• Broad understanding of spacecraft electronics
• Existing CPE certification
• Working knowledge of current US DoD Protected Satellite Communications (i.e., Milstar/AEHF)
• Experience developing Analog/Digital interfaces
• Experience with full-life cycle of software or ASIC/FGPA development
• Prior satellite communications design experience
• Proven ability to develop analytical modeling and simulation tools/environments
• Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field

title: Optical Payload: Optical and Sensor Components Manager (Optics & FPA)
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as an Optical Payload: Optical and Sensor Components Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are looking for a strong leader to develop high TRL (test readiness level) products for missile and space hardware. You will report and be deployed into Space Engineering and Technology (E&T) Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) organization. This position will lead a group to develop a product portfolio consisting of focal plane assemblies (FPAs), optics, thin films, telescopes, calibrators and other strategic electro-optical components. This group will work with the OPCoE Chief Engineer, architects and Fellows to develop product maturation plans in accordance with Lines of Business (LOB) roadmaps and need dates. This group will keep abreast of SOA (State of Art) as well as SOP (State of Practice) to provide subject matter expertise (SME) across all program lifecycles. This group will be consulted on make/buy decisions for their products and would be the execution team if a “make” decision was determined by the program. You will significantly impact the enterprise through establishment of a dedicated team working to drive common, high TRL products across programs.

As the Optical Payload: Optical and Sensor Components Mgr, you will:
• Partner with Lines of Business (LOB), OPCoE Program Development, and OPCoE Payload Systems Engineering teams to develop architectures in a consistent manner to allow use of common products
• Develop transition plans for low TRL products from the science and technology community. An example will be to work with the ATC (Advanced Technology Center) and ensure handoffs are understood between the two organizations.
• In coordination with OPCoE Program Development, propose and execute IRAD projects with a goal of standardization and maturation. You will identify targeted products to reach a state that can be considered “high TRL”, “commodity” or “Off- the-Shelf”.
• Enhance relationships with strategic suppliers and other LM Business Areas (BAs) to compliment the in-house OPCoE team.
• Perform as part of the Integrated Product Team (IPT) in cases where an OPCOE make is selected. Your team will support through all program phases and be responsible for EU (engineering unit), qualification and flight as determined by the program. This may be at the component, sub-assembly or subsystem level.
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers. Fold emerging mission trends into product roadmap to ensure a discriminating edge.
• Implement and lead technical knowledge management to develop and maintain core competencies, key technical skills, knowledge continuity and facilitate career advancement opportunities to employees.
• Handle staffing requirements, sustain engineering capabilities and preserve critical skills.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 14-20 years of professional experience, a Masters and 12-18 years, or a PhD and 9-15 years.

• Demonstrated experience in manufacturing, producibility, and/or qualification of optical benches and telescopes
• Established experience in developing technical talent and building pipelines to sustain technical expertise within the organization
• US citizenship with the ability to obtain TS/SCI w/Poly clearance
skills:

• Demonstrated experience in developing calibrators, optical components and developing/evaluating optical coatings. We work with a range of optical systems starting from the sub-meter class through apertures greater than 1.5M.

title: Computer Vision Software Engineer Sr Stf
description:
Do you want the chance to re-think conventional wisdom and offer fresh, ground-breaking ideas? LM has new opportunities that provide you with a chance to challenge the status quo and experiment with new digital tools and emerging technologies that transform our mission.
Due to the classified nature of this opportunity we can’t talk about everything you’ll do on this program, but know that you will play a part in building end-to-end solutions and game-changing technology.

We are seeking engineers and scientists interested in a fast-paced design-test-learn life cycle for innovative computer vision projects for space. Utilizing world-class space development and test facilities, LM seeks to engineer the next generation of robust, autonomous space vehicle perception and visible navigation solutions across a variety of challenging missions. With an appetite for accepting risk and a drive for innovation, this team intends to employ the latest software advances in machine learning, autonomous driving, and deep learning research to meet exciting, emerging customer needs.

In this role, you can expect to be immersed within a talented team of engineers working across a variety of potential roles. Maturation of simulation environments across a range of phenomenologies are utilized for synthetic image generation. Simulation based performance analysis within a closed-loop simulation environment, inclusive of vehicle guidance, navigation, and control (GNC) simulations, demonstrates end-to-end mission capability. Development of C/C++ code for space-industry leading avionics platforms run within real-time hardware-in-the-loop (HWIL) environments enables the team to demonstrate platform performance. Test environments involving multiple robots hosting the rendezvous and proximity operation sensor platform and space object mockups enables test-like-you flight autonomous demonstrations to retire risk prior to flight. Within this group, we value employees, their contributions, and work hard to build cohesive teams aligned to meet mission needs.

This is a mid career position that typically requires having 14 years of professional experience.

This position requires no clearance at start but you must have the ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret w/SCI .

title: People Analytics & Technology Expert
description:
Lockheed Martin is embarking on a transformational journey – destination the future. HR systems, data science and analytics are Lockheed Martin’s path to the future where technology and information drive decisions that create value across the entire lifecycle. This includes how our workforce will operate, as well. To help us along this journey we are seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Senior Staff People Analytics & Technology.
This position can be summarized in this way:
• You will play a key role in managing the design, development and implementation of analytic solutions roadmap
• You will be able direct the analysis of actual and predictable integrated operational activities in human capital and business systems to obtain a quantitative, rational basis for decision making through logical, scientific or economic techniques - using data to create meaningful business insights
• You will have an opportunity to manage the strategy, design and creation of datasets required for analysis that use a variety of modelling and measurement techniques using mathematical and statistical methods
• You will provide consultation to clients and potentially lead cross-functional teams to address business issues

Job Description:

This critical role will drive the technical transformation of the RMS People Analytics & Technology organization by designing and implementing ways to leverage automation, driving optimization of product and service delivery.

Ability to extract, reconcile, analyze, and communicate data in a business context providing insights and storytelling. If this is something that sounds interesting and challenging to you, this is the right opportunity for you! The successful candidate will report to the Senior Manager, People Analytics & Technology for Lockheed Martin. The team is responsible for providing HR insights to HR professionals and business leaders, interfacing with a broader group of Business Area teams on reporting and HR systems.

You will work directly with HR functional organizations to understand human capital needs. You will determine what the long term technical strategy and roadmap should be, what data is relevant, pulling data out of complex databases and integrating disparate data sources.
In this position, the selected candidate will:
• Define and design of human capital analytic solutions to support stakeholder requirements and desired business outcomes
• Build of visualizations or reports that connect data to information that end-users can successfully use to obtain insights and act
• Improve established reporting tools by studying current practices and designing modifications
• Maintain user confidence and protecting operations by keeping information confidential
• Understand and communicate operational impacts of system changes
• Demonstrate inclusion and engagement with the team to achieve results
• Maintain on-going communications and strong working relationships with Human Resource colleagues, including HR Business Partners, Labor Relations, Compensation, Global Diversity and Inclusion, and Talent Acquisition.
• Utilize software tools/Solutions (e.g. SQL, Business Objects (BOBJ), WebFocus/FOCUS, R, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, WordPress, PeopleSoft, Brassring) and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Access) as needed
• Perform other duties as assigned to support the organization objectives
The position requires the ability to extract data from a data warehouse using a GUI front end tool and also a SQL-like tool. In addition, extracted data must be formatted into organized easy to follow reports and visualizations to help paint a picture for the client, making the data easily understandable. With ever increasing demands for data to influence and drive workforce decisions, expect a fast pace with requests ranging from simple to highly complex.

Influence RMS’ people strategy development and management through strategic workforce planning process.
qualifications:
• Demonstrated experience defining and implementing advanced analytic strategies.
• Demonstrated experience defining and implementing advanced analytic capabilities and data protection/discretion.
• Demonstrated experience designing and implementing company-wide or high impact data analytics processes and tools.
• Demonstrated experience managing HR systems transformation initiatives, including developing project plans, preparing corresponding communication plans, identifying milestones, deadlines and metrics to assess outcomes/results.
• Demonstrated experience delivering results for the business though proactive insights, storytelling and effective communication.
• Demonstrated experience in communication and collaboration.
• Demonstrated learning agility.
• Facilitate decision making.
• Demonstrated emphasis on customer focus and outstanding customer service.
skills:

• Demonstrated knowledge and experience with Workforce Planning, Analytics, & Reporting practices, processes and results.
• Demonstrated experience leading others, setting the vision/strategy and direction, partnering with relevant orgs to achieve the intended results.
• Demonstrated experience using relevant software tools/solutions e.g., Microsoft Office, SAS, MatLab, SPSS.
• Demonstrated experience consulting with executives, Human Resources, and business leaders.
• Demonstrated ability and experience coaching leaders and employees.
• Demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders using multiple methods based on context.
• Basic to moderate knowledge and experience with change management principals and methodology; preference for using Prosci methodology.
• Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships, collaborate with others, engage in constructive conflict, and manage interpersonal dynamics.
• Demonstrate strong decision making and judgment, oral and written communication, and business acumen.

• Adaptable consulting and facilitation skills

• Translate requirements into actionable tasks
• Translate requirements into meaningful solutions

Navy Strategic Programs (NSP) is experiencing significant growth, and we need your expertise to deliver amazing new technologies to our customers. We have opportunities that include sophisticated Hypersonic Technology, Glide Body Strike technology, and other key technology insertions. Lockheed Martin is looking for a highly motivated Electrical Integration Engineer to become a member of the Weapon Systems Integration team.

• Develop and maintain weapon system electrical interconnects and interface control documentation to manage the weapon system technical baseline
• Verify that the Weapon System aligns with both the Command Media and program technical requirements

Successful candidates typically have a Bachelor's degree and 0-2 years of experience.

This position is in one of the Coolest places to work: Denver, Colorado.

title: Staff Agile Software Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

Space Protection Programs is seeking an experienced Software Engineer and Leader who can guide a team through complex mission software development lifecycle. Candidate must have the ability to take ownership of software development activities and drive the application of agile methods that require a multifaceted execution approach, depending on the time-phased needs of the program. Responsible for frequent use and application of software engineering standards and techniques, including Object Oriented Design and Agile development techniques, a successful candidate will guide software requirements development, architecture, design, implementation, and test. Will work in a highly collaborative environment with frequent and direct interaction with various engineering disciplines and customer.

Experience with C/C++, Python, WindRiver and Linux OS, and Object-Oriented design is preferred. Strong ability to perform on a small highly skilled team in a dynamic environment. The preferred candidate must be able to work under limited direction and will be given considerable altitude in determining technical objectives and approaches. Candidate will be required to multi-task, adapt to change, and possess strong organizational and communication skills.

In this role you will:
• Be leading member of an Agile development team. Conduct Agile Release Planning, Sprint Planning, and guide agile development execution. Provide leadership in the guidance and mentorship of agile methods to a multi-disciplined team of software and systems engineers.
• Participate in embedded software development and/or software test activities.
• Act as a role model for the team. Lead by doing.
• Exercise considerable latitude in determining approaches to assignments.
• Evaluate sprint results and provide feedback to team members and project stakeholders.
• Learn new tools independently.
• Identify opportunities for improvement in current processes and implement new processes.
• Create schedules for software and test completion.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin cultivates an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

qualifications:

• Knowledge of embedded systems architectures and test experience using embedded systems
• Demonstrated experience using the Agile methodology in the development, integration and test of complex software systems and environments
• Demonstrated experience with the management and control of schedule/scope/cost on a challenging program
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong social skills, and ability to build consensus among peers while building solid relationships across Agile Development Teams
• Demonstrated experience working in an Agile Scrum environment
• Ability to design software solutions to address complex problems
skills:

• Programming background in C/C++ and Python.
• Control Account Manager (CAM) experience.

• Experience with program lifecycle execution from concept phase through end-of-life phase.
• Comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic multi-disciplinary environment.
