title: Systems Engineer Staff - Lead Process Engineer - Clearance Required
description:
Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems is looking for Cybersecurity professionals to work on Cross-Domain Solution (CDS) products that protect and defend the information flow of critical and time sensitive data on many military application and networks.

As part of the Spectrum Convergence Team, you will ensure cyber security standards are met and implemented. The candidate will be leading and working in an agile Kanban development environment on RedHat Linux-based OS, and will be responsible for supporting elements of the design/sustainment/development efforts. The candidate should be a well-rounded software developer but with demonstrated ability in C/C++/Java. The candidate can expect to work in agile teams. The candidate should be a self-starter that is attentive to details and works well in a team environment.

Duties to Lead Process Engineer on a Kanban team, including software design and development in a Secure Edition Linux environment, SE Linux Policy creation, maintenance and debugging, message parser development, XML schema development, network protocol integration, shell scripting development, and software test.

Additionally, the proven ability to provide software engineering and team leadership, team member support and mentoring along with programmer guidance and assistance is required. Flexibility and agility to changing requirements and programming languages, and a desire to learn and experience new opportunities to improve team performance is a must.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.


BENEFITS OF EMPLOYMENT:
We may not know what's going to change the world next, but chances are we're already working on it, and you can, too. As part of our culture of innovation, you’ll have outstanding benefits and amenities, an inclusive work environment, ongoing career development and support, rewards and recognition to honor your hard work, and more.


HERE ARE SOME OF THE BENEFITS YOU CAN ENJOY:

- Medical (some LM locations have on-site medical)

- Dental

- 401k (with generous matching)

- Paid time off including, (we have a 4x10 schedule which means: 52 three-day weekends!)

- Work/life balance, family-friendly environment

- Career development, career-growth, and lots of learning opportunities for aspiring minds

- Knowledgeable, supportive, and engaged leadership

- Mentorship opportunities

- Rewards & recognition

- Generous Tuition Reimbursement

Whether you’re new to the area or just like being socially involved, we encourage everyone to explore among our many employee networks and employee resource groups we have on-site. Whatever your interests, there’s likely a community at Lockheed Martin for networking, becoming familiar with the area, and enjoying common activities with coworkers.

Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package. (https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits)
qualifications:
DEMONSTRATED EXPERIENCE LEADING A KANBAN TEAM

- Proven experience in reporting Kanban metrics to project leadership

- Proficiency with one or more of the following software languages: C, C++, Java

- Proficient working in Linux/Unix operating system environment

- Ability to demonstrate a dedication to personal and corporate perfection, ethical behavior and integrity

- Strong analytical and problem solving skills

- Ability to communicate effectively, with excellent written and oral skills

- Software Development Lifecycle experience, including Agile software development experience

- Ability and desire to provide team and project leadership as well as mentoring more junior programmer staff

- Current/active DoD Secret Security Clearance with the ability to obtain a final TS/SCI DoD security clearance
skills:
- Networking experience

- Strong teammate

- Experience with the following: LDAP, PKI and Security coding practice, XML, XSLT, JMS, Cross Domain Solution

- Develop Cybersecurity applications to NIST SP 800-53 Risk Mgmt Framework

- RHEL 6+

- DoD Cybersecurity certification

- Agile S/W Development and supporting tools for continuous integration

- The successful candidate will have strong Agile experience.

- 9 years of professional experience; or 7 years of professional experience with a related Master’s degree.

title: System Administrator Sr
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

This position is within Lockheed Martin Space new Business Innovation Technology Enterprise Excellence (BITEE) organization. If you’re looking for your next challenge in a fast pace, innovation-oriented group, look no further!

The candidate will be a System Administrator for a brand-new enterprise WAN solution: DarkStar!
The candidate will be responsible for driving new capabilities within the DarkStar team. The selected candidate will closely work with the Systems Engineer to design, develop, and implement new capabilities across the entire infrastructure. This will include high performance compute (HPC) system, a brand-new DarkStar Cloud solution utilizing Open Shift and more. Knowledge and familiarity with San Storage Hardware and System configuration as well as Windows OS is required. Candidate must be comfortable working in environment supporting a large number of different platforms which range from small/midsize servers to enterprise servers and supercomputers. Candidate will be responsible for operating system installations, upgrades, configurations, software installation, and secure technical implementations. Knowledge of various protocols such as DNS, NFS, CIFS, Samba, SSL, SSH, SFTP, SMTP, and system and network tuning and configuration.
qualifications:

• Experience/hands on with RedHat Open Shift containerization

• Demonstrated experience with configuring and deploying physical and virtual servers
• Experience with patching process’ on Windows & Linux
• Experience with Script Writing, Ansible, Python or other automation/scripting tools
• Fiber Channel (SAN and Direct Attach) Storage Array Administration Experience
• Substantial understanding of IT systems
• Basic network configuration and troubleshooting
• Demonstrated ability to work seamlessly across organization boundaries
• Self-starter with the ability to spot potential for process improvement
• Capable of building effective relationships with teams and subject matter experts
skills:

title: C2BMC - Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM)
description:
Lockheed Martin is a Cyber Security pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing employees are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, and education. Come and experience your future!

This position is located in Colorado Springs, CO and will support the C2BMC TO38 program. The Information System Security Manager (TO38 technical lead) will be responsible for technically leading a diverse team of Information System Security Officers (ISSOs) in the performance of mandatory information system security tasks on assigned information systems utilizing DAAPM, JSIG, DoD 8500, NIST, ICD, CNSSI, C2BMC Security Authorization documentation and other related DoD documents in support of training and operations.

The C2BMC ISSM will be overall responsible for the cybersecurity posture of the C2BMC TO38 program. The selected candidate will coordinate and participate in tasks that include, but are not limited to configuring information systems, providing information for the development of System Security Plans, establishing and maintaining configuration management plans, install/update/remove computer equipment, preparing documents to gain government approvals to operate information systems, weekly system audits, anti-virus software management, sanitizing systems and components, establishing new user accounts, preparing for and supporting inspections, participating in enterprise initiatives, continuous monitoring, self-inspection review, etc. The selected candidate will champion and be directly responsible for the performance of continuous monitoring, incident response, auditing, RMF management, SLA, and other cybersecurity requirements as required.

Successful candidate should be knowledgeable of information technology security principles, various computer/network operating systems, and Microsoft suite of applications. This is a multi-tasking environment that demands customer service, communication, leadership, and organizational skills. Mission requirements may require other than first shift work. Other duties as assigned.
qualifications:
- This position requires a secret clearance, active IAM III credentials, and active CSSP Analyst credentials.
- Must maintain DOD 8570 IAM III and CSSP Analyst certifications for the duration of your employment
- Previous experience working with the Defense Counterintelligence Security Agency (DCSA), NISPOM requirements, and their implementation of RMF
- Frequent use and application of technical principles, IA methodologies and concepts.
- Demonstrated experience managing and championing all aspects of an RMF package
skills:

- Ability to lead peers
- Experience working in a military environment.
- Experience working with Collateral Secret environment
- Keen attention to detail and adherence to established security policies.
- Excellent verbal, writing, and typing skills
- Prior experience leading cyber security professionals
- Experience managing an Information Assurance Program
-10+ years in a cyber security role or related field
-5+ years in a direct RMF management role.

title: Systems Engineer Staff – Requirements and Verification
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Navy Strategic Programs (NSP) is experiencing significant growth and we need your expertise to deliver amazing new technologies to our customers. We have opportunities that include sophisticated Hypersonic Technology, Glide Body Strike technology, and other key technology insertions. The early design and engineering phase provides you with tremendous career growth potential along with important assignments to stretch and hone your expertise. This is a rare opportunity to work closely alongside our Navy Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) partners to field a number of future strategic systems that the nation urgently needs.

As a Systems Engineer for Requirements and Verification, you will:

• Be deputy to the Requirements and Verification Technical Lead responsible for verification execution across multiple flight tests
• Review, maintain, and improve the Requirements and Verification Baseline
• Model requirements and verifications within system design using Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) principles
• Work closely with the SPC counterparts to develop, test and field a strategic system
• Work closely with our subcontractors to ensure build up of the system capabilities

Typically has 2 - 5 years of professional experience.

title: Sr. Automated Test Engineer, Top Secret
description:
Take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO!

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Come be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products! We provide the resources, inspiration and focus. If you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

We are seeking an Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE) System Integration and Test Engineer to work within the Military Support Programs. We are looking for you to perform EGSE designs and improvements, support and test execution, develop and review test documentation, and oversee the execution of subsystem and system-level EGSE testing.

KEY DUTIES FOR THIS POSITION INCLUDE:
• Documents test results and test discrepancies.

• Leads troubleshooting efforts.

• Provides technical guidance to test team members on EGSE products.

• Moderates among the interests of multi-disciplinary groups to synthesize EGSE test plans and test procedures that acknowledge technical, schedule and cost constraints.

• Perform to functional and technical specifications and standards, aid in solutions for hardware/software interface problems, and ensures integration of the entire system or subsystem through test product execution.

• Coordinates subsystem and/or system testing activities with support organizations.

• May perform impromptu briefs of test status or discrepancies to customer representatives or program management.

Please note that this position will require on call support to a 24/7 test operations schedule.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR YOU TO HAVE:
• 5 - 9 years of professional experience for this role.
• We need you to have an active Top Secret clearance to be considered.

BENEFITS OF EMPLOYMENT:
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Lockheed Martin. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

script development, debug, and execution.

Good communication skills are required for this high visibility position. This position is expected to necessitate domestic travel at approximately 25% time. title: Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Engineer
description:
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world's hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus. If you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

We are searching for a Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Research Scientist to join our exceptional team. This position will be working across several Lockheed Martin Business Areas (BAs) to build and deploy AI/ML models into air, land, sea, AND Space! This position will provide a unique experience mix with research, prototype development, and software to hardware toolchain development all within the domain of AI/ML software and targeted hardware platforms.

As an AI/ML Research Scientist, you will work with guidance from project leaders and technical leads to:
• Develop, integrate, and implement products to assist adding perception, motion/mission planning, controls, etc. functionality in LM products and platforms
• Translate requirements and apply requirements to development code, integrating autonomy, AI or machine learning algorithms to LM products and platforms
• Determine software methods to best acquire and execute knowledge
• Implement algorithms into software to aide in development of systems which can recognize patterns and perform specific functions
• Be responsible for various phases of developing and maintaining AI-based software from requirements generation, software design and development to integration, testing, troubleshooting and debugging, and implementation
• Review test outcomes, conducts troubleshooting, and works to debug issues
• Interface with other teams involved the development lifecycle for perception, mission and motion planning, simulation and modeling, testing, etc.

We are looking for someone with a strong problem solving mindset: ability to develop create solutions to difficult problems often requiring integration of conflicting and, at times, ambiguous or incomplete data on a fast-paced schedule. You should have the demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex design information, technical decision and issues to both highly technical and non-technical peers. We are also looking for the ability to build and maintain relationships, collaborate with others, engage in constructive conflict, and manage interpersonal dynamics. You should also be comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic multi-disciplinary environment.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 2-5 years of professional experience or a Masters/PhD and 0-3 years.

title: Staff Opto-Mechanical Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as a Staff Opto-Mechanical Engineer!

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate experts across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Join us as a Staff Opto-Mechanical Engineer, where you will support the full life cycle of optical payload development from initial concept design through flight hardware delivery. This position is for an advanced individual contributor and/or team lead, who can perform as a Certified Principal Engineer (CPE) who owns and is accountable for all critical aspects of an assigned product throughout its lifecycle.

In this role, you will:
• Lead trade studies, analyses, design maturation, and drawing delivery for optical benches, optical element layouts, telescopes, optical mounts and fixtures, and active optical elements
• Perform structural (both static and vibrational), thermal and optical performance analyses, working with a cross-functional team of engineers to optimize payload performance
• Likely engage in the planning, conduct, and leadership of research and development efforts in the laboratory and via analysis
• Be a leading member of our team that designs and develops electro-optical instruments and payloads for civilian and military aerospace applications

You should have direct and relevant experience with optical systems, and be an emerging technical authority in opto-mechanical engineering. You will be expected to have proficiency with MS PowerPoint and Excel, and the ability to clearly communicate orally and in writing.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 9-15 years of experience, a Masters and 7-13, or a PhD and 3-10 years.

• Experience with specification development, vendor interface, parts selection, and/or configuration control

description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design, and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration, and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

What is it like to work in Subcontract Administration ?

Did you ever think that you could work for a company and actually have an impact on programs that are working on putting astronauts on Mars, creating 3D printed satellites, launching payloads that learn in orbit, or that are developing national defense systems? Lockheed Martin Space technology connects millions of people around the world and we’re accelerating tomorrow’s breakthroughs to help our customers stay ahead in an ever-changing world. title: Senior Electro-Optical Research Scientist
description:
Join the Advanced Technology Center (ATC) as an Senior Electro-Optical Research Scientist! The ATC is the research lab for Lockheed Martin Space. Through our own skills and those of our partners—including universities and research labs around the world—we’re able to put vision in motion. While we are a part of LM's space division, our technologies are far-reaching across domains. ATC’s story is written in the success of missions here on Earth and far, far into space. Our innovation extends beyond incremental change. We strive for first-of-a-kind capability with enduring impact. Whatever the application, our charter is to build groundbreaking technologies. At the ATC, we’re inspiring change in our endless pursuit of what’s next.

As a Senior Electro-Optical Research Scientist at the ATC, you will participate in the full life cycle developing optical systems from initial concept design through flight hardware delivery. We will ask you to develop and design optical systems and assume accountability for all critical aspects of an optical system throughout its lifecycle. In this role you will be part of a small research and development team of about five research scientists and technical specialists. You will spend about 50% of your time in the lab supporting multiple programs and projects, and 50% performing analysis work. Some of your responsibilities will include:

• Performing the conceptual design, analysis, detailed design and development of technologies, techniques, and implementations for fiber laser systems, non-liner optical materials, and/or other laser remote sensing systems, with emphasis on fiber laser components
• Working with optical systems and architectures engineering teams, and product engineering to ensure successful systems design, development, modeling and simulation, analysis, and testing
• Performing design trade studies and system verification analyses to optimize candidate system performance, cost, size and weight

We are looking for someone with strong analytic and communication skills who can establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, internal and external customers, suppliers, and other partners. You will be working in dynamic, multi-disciplinary system development teams, participating with architecture design & development teams in active optical system development. You have some exposure in the study of physical interactions, processes, and spectroscopy to understand their applications relative to a particular EO Sensor design. Your experience should include new concept formation & analysis, rapid prototype development, and rapid TRL progression of developed technologies to initial products. We will look to you for strong technical writing, presentation skills for reports, proposals, technical presentations, and interaction with customers, team members, and suppliers. The ability to communicate complex ideas and explain relevant technology and concepts to an audience of both specialists and non-experts will be essential to success.

**This position may require domestic travel as necessary to fulfill job responsibilities

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 5-10 years of professional experience, a Masters and 3-8 years, or a PhD and 0-5 years.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.

qualifications:
• Experience or familiarity with optical design and analysis software tools. Examples include Zemax, FRED, GLAD, Code-V and LASCAD
• Experience or familiarity with modeling and simulation tools such as MATLAB/Simulink, LabView, MathCAD, and/or Mathematica
• Exposure to and understanding of the systems engineering, integration, and test of work products, tools, and associated processes
• US Citizenship with the ability to obtain a Secret clearance
skills:
• Knowledge and experience developing fiber-based optical sources, developing high power, high energy fiber-based master oscillator power amplifier systems, pulsed front ends, specifying fiber optic devices and components, predicting system performance, and troubleshooting fiber-based systems and components
• Knowledge and experience with nonlinear optical phenomena in optical fibers including stimulated Brillouin scattering, stimulated Raman scattering, self-phase modulation, four-wave mixing, etc., and standard mitigation strategies
• Knowledge and experience using large mode area and photonic crystal fibers
• Knowledge and experience cleaving and splicing a variety of fibers and fiber coupled components
• Knowledge of laser remote sensing and/or laser-based free-space optical communications theory, applications, systems and techniques.
• Experience is desired in end-to-end optical remote sensor development.
• Demonstrated proficiency in proposal writing and other aspects of business development is desired.
• Active TS/SCI clearance

title: Cyber Security Engineer, MBSE
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.


Lockheed Martin Space's DevSecOps Organization is looking for a Cyber Security Engineer with a focus on Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE).

The successful candidate will employ cyber security requirements into Model Based Systems Engineering approaches across program developing Systems Engineering products using SysML and MBSE tools to capture, maintain, and visualize needed views of model data to communicate system design and facilitate automation of Systems Engineering integration with other domains.

As a Cyber Security Engineer for Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) , you will:
- Support or lead MBSE efforts on program; solicit stakeholder needs for MBSE implementation
- Develop architecture and interface documentation from model data
- Elicit stakeholder needs and requirements from model data
- Use system design data from model to develop assembly, integration and verification data from model

title: Software Engineering Sr Staff - Software Associate Chief Engineer
description:
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds the satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

What does this role look like?

Every day, our 100,000 employees come to work with one focus – our customers’ missions. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

Lockheed Martin Space is not just about satellites... the Strategic & Missile Defense business area offers growing opportunities to work programs focused on the protection of our nation and allies from a multitude of threats. Our exciting programs are dynamic in nature and often times focus on significant geo-political trends.

This role will offer you the following daily challenges:

As the Associate Chief Engineer for Software Engineering in Lockheed Martin’s Space Systems Company, you’ll design revolutionary systems for a wide range of customers. You will coordinate technical requirements among diverse projects to obtain maximum synergy across designs and leverage the latest design principles including service-oriented architecture and cloud design. You will be the Ground Segment Technical Authority for Software Engineering, manage the SBIRS Ground SW Technical Baseline and provide Technical Leadership for SBIRS Ground Enterprise SW for Development

Typically has 14 - 20 years of professional experience.
qualifications:
To be successful, you need to possess these basic qualifications:
• Fluency in a wide range of software design principles that enable maintainability, reuse, and interoperability
• Coordinate across a diverse set of projects to attain design synergy and reduce costs and effort
• Develop long-term technical roadmaps and convince nontechnical audiences of their value
• Define system level solutions to fulfill customer needs
• Mastery of service-oriented architecture or microservices-based architectures
• Mastery of at least one enterprise-grade programming language: Java, C++, or equivalent
• Conversant in a wide range of other programming languages
• Bachelor’s degree in technical discipline
skills:
• Master’s degree in Computer Science or master’s degree in technical field with ample software experience strongly preferred
• Applications Programming Interface (API) Design
• Publish/subscribe architectures
• High-volume data streams
• Real time systems
• Algorithm design and performance analysis
• High availability systems
• Ecosystem development
• Agile software development
• Proposals and business development
• Cloud based architectures
• Container-based design, such as through Docker or comparable technology
• Satellite ground system experience
• Experience with ecosystems of applications
• Experience with satellite imagery, computer vision, or imagery analysis
• Unified Modelling Language (UML), or other structured design language
• Software test methodology and test automation
• Must be eligible for/willing to apply for TS/SCI security clearance

title: Opto-Mechanical Staff Engineer - Payload Structural Analyst
description:
The Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) at Lockheed Martin Space is seeking an experienced Opto-mechanical/Precision Mechanism Engineer and Structural Analyst to play a leading role in our design and development work on a variety of passive, active, and directed energy optical payloads. We are looking for engineers with strong mechanical skills, highly relevant and related experience, and a keen interest in optical payloads. OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members coordinate specialists across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

With a focus on structural analysis and design, integrated into full payload design and performance assessments, you will be engaged in the design, specification, and procurement support for optical bench assemblies, optical mounts and fixtures, mechanical ground support equipment, alignment fixtures, and a range of related assets to be used in the development, test and manufacture of optical payloads. This position calls for a consistent, responsible, deadline-meeting professional who will:

• Work under broad guidance from senior engineering and program leadership;
• Collaborate and contribute across the design team;
• Guide the work of junior and emerging engineers;
• Engage with prospective and selected suppliers;
• Deliver robust documents and briefings, and;
• Support customer reviews

We are seeking a team member with strong written and oral communication skills. You should also demonstrate strong quantitative skills and the ability to apply them to the formidable mechanical challenges of precision optical payload subsystems.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 9-15 years of professional experience, a Masters and 7-13 years, or a PhD and 4-10 years.

**Please note that this role can be located in Sunnyvale, CA or Louisville, CO.

title: Obsolescence Sustainment Engineer
description:
Stop your job search here! Can you be the Obsolescence Engineer Lockheed Martin is looking for in Colorado Springs, Colorado?

The Obsolescence Sustainment Engineer is directly responsible for the implementation and continuous improvement of the End of Sale/End of Life (EOS-EOL) program on the Command and Control, Battle Management, and Communications (C2BMC) Operations, Maintenance, and Sustainment (OM&S) Task Order.

SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE:
- Conduct analyses of the hardware and software in use throughout the enterprise to track, identify, research, (EOS-EOL) conditions, then develop and present creative and thorough solutions to mitigate or resolve the obsolescence condition

- Frequent contact with Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and cross functional product teams

- These potential courses of action are presented to management, task order leadership, and the government customer for approval

- Coordinate with impacted product teams to ensure understanding and full implementation of approved courses of action to resolve obsolescence conditions

- Frequent coordination and support of other members of the Sustainment Product Team

title: Global Positioning Systems  Engineering  Manager
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Lockheed Martin Space is seeking a System Engineer Manager to join the GPS IIR/IIR-M/III On Orbit Services (GPS OOS) team. The GPS OOS team supports on-orbit operations and sustainment of GPS satellites, and support GPS systems, software labs and simulators. The successful candidate will manage a multifunctional team consisting primarily of sub-contractors, GPS Operations Specialists, Software Engineers and System Engineers whose responsibilities include performing on orbit support, sustaining ground support systems, labs and GPS simulators, responding to solicitations in support of sustainment system improvement and updates, GPS satellite operations support and program execution efforts. The System Engineering Manager will
• Manage support system, lab and simulator resources for GPS OOS to include staffing, onboarding, training and retention planning
• Provide oversight and support to GPS OOS program area Engineering proficiency sustainment including IT system sustainment, SW sustainment, simulator operations, and lab sustainment
• Provide guidance to a Systems Engineering team to include full Systems Engineering lifecycle processes for support systems
• Provide programmatic and proposal support and serve as a technical point of contact for GPS OOS support systems
• Support project/program execution including budget/spend plan monitoring and adjustment, personnel manning, reporting and stakeholder/communications management for projects related to GPS support systems, labs, and simulators
• Support project/program planning including developing, reviewing , monitoring execution of and recommending changes to Statements of Work (SOWs), specifications, and systems engineering plans as well as program and project schedules
• Ensure that System Engineering plans, processes, and requirements are implemented in the team’s efforts
This is both a working position and a management position, in which the successful candidate will utilize a flexible team to ensure all program requirements are met and staffed as necessary. title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds the satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

Come join the Space Based InfraRed System (SBIRS) program as a Software Engineer. In our product-based organization, we are looking for talented engineers to contribute to the success of our sustainment and modernization of the SBIRS system in our labs and at our operational sites. In this role, you will be required to exercise a breadth of skillsets, including software development and troubleshooting, data stream verification and troubleshooting (employing an understanding of networking concepts), and installation and general management of our software (employing infrastructure concepts). There will be a focus of learning and gaining ownership of our Data Distribution product, but there is plenty of opportunity to contribute to various projects across the SBIRS ground segment. The candidate will be expected to become familiar w/product capabilities, architecture, and software baseline to include interfaces, be able to install/config the software, contribute to the future/growth of product capabilities.

At times, this role may require working odd hours in support of our lab and operational environment, and may include occasional travel to our CONUS operational sites.

And, the opportunities don’t stop there on SBIRS; while the candidate will have a primary assignment, there are several other efforts around our Boulder facility that will desire your engineering skills in the future.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin champions an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

• Software Installation Skills: RPMs, YUM repo management, Docker/containers, Understanding of HW concepts (HDD, CPU, RAM, Bandwidth), Setting software configs

title: Security Representative Senior
description:
At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education.

Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Come and experience your future!

Candidate will be required to perform a variety of SCI security related duties and ensure the coordination of SCI security practices and procedures. Security disciplines include, but are not limited to, personnel security, Security Awareness Training and Education, indoctrinations, debriefings, security incident investigations, access control, visitor control, badging, and, classification management utilizing ICDs and customer specific guidelines.

Candidate will serve as the security representative for several classified programs. In that capacity, the candidate will be responsible for implementing related security requirements as established by NISPOM and other customer-specific directives; and maintain responsibility for the daily security functions of assigned programs.

This will involve effectively interfacing and partnering with internal and external customers; and effectively partnering with members of peer organizations to meet program milestones. Participate in, enhance, and support security education, training, and awareness programs. Assist program and security management with anticipating emerging compliance requirements and implement compliant solutions to operations. Support internal/external inspection activities. Support program activities related to classification management, clearance processing and document control. Assist in developing and publishing of security directives, policies & procedures and training curriculums. Investigate security violations and facilitate appropriate company response.

Candidate should have the ability to develop effective partnerships with program management. This position may require occasion travel.

Experience in DoD / SCI Program Security
Knowledge of NISPOM requirements and implementation strategies.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Are you a systems engineer looking for something different? Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can make a difference to a very important mission?

This is an exciting systems engineering position supporting the growing Space Security division within the Mission Solutions Line of Business. Lockheed Martin is seeking a creative and high energy Systems Engineer to support a ground breaking new mission area. Selected candidate will perform systems engineering tasks supporting a program through operations, using agile methodologies, and supporting customers interested in developing new system capabilities. Program efforts will include requirements analysis, mission engineering analysis, test and integration support, CONOPSs development, and customer interactions. We are looking for talented engineers who can deal with uncertainty and thrive in a fast-paced environment and on a high performing team.

Performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, mission analysis, orbital dynamics analysis, test, installation, operations, maintenance, and disposal. Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications.

title: Optical Payload Designer, Senior Staff
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should consider joining the Lockheed Martin Space Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) as a Staff Optical Payload Designer! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members bring together authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

As an Optical Payload Designer, your responsibilities will include being the lead optics designer on one or more of OPCoE's critical programs.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 14-20 years of professional experience, a Masters and 12-18 years, or a PhD and 9-15 years.

title: Integration and Test Technical Coordinator (ST CFPT)
description:
There are people who say some ideas are impossible, unattainable, or unrealistic. Then there are those of us who work at Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems. As a part of the Lockheed Martin community, we take on the biggest, baddest challenges in the world and find solutions using creativity and collaboration.

And where the solutions don’t exist? WE INVENT THEM.

So, if you’re looking for the challenge of a lifetime and a team of the brightest minds in the world, Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you. If you’re looking for a place where learning is a way of life, Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you. And if you’re looking for a career that’s just as fun as it is hard work, well…you know.

Join us today and let’s make a difference together.

Lockheed Martin. Your Mission is Ours.


What does this role look like?
This position requires daily technical and programmatic interaction with civilian, military, contract leadership, and technical personnel at MDIOC and Highway 83 LM Offices. Candidate will engage the C2BMC (Command & Control, Battle Management, and Communications) system for the purpose of technical support to Agile Product Teams and I&T functional area to conduct hardware, software, and system level verification and validation testing.

This position joins the ST (System Test) CFPT (Cross Functional Product Team), working closely with the I&T Technical Lead for the C2BMC National Team. The role is responsible for scheduling lab test and installation activities, coordinating with BMDSS (Ballistic Missile Defense Support Systems), IRES Contractor, and MDA BCX and the C2BMC NT Integration Team on spiral release installation and integration schedules in the test labs.

The selectee will also be responsible for coordinating with key partners in test lab build out design meetings, reviews and assisting in the resolution of test technical issues. Additionally, they will coordinate with technical leads and product owners to execute installations in sync with Task Order baselines.

The integration and test technical coordinator will execute test tasks in accordance with program processes, supporting the functional area manager in resource planning, aiding the PERB, PCCB, and ROMB and other boards as appropriate, as well as supporting Task Order and customer reviews, metrics collection and analysis.

In addition, this role will focus on the following tasks:

-Manage Formal Program Risks Related to T02 activities and verification
-Provide EE/Proposals support for T02 for Verification and PR resolutions
-Support EOS/EOL activities related to Ops and Deployment
-Position will require frequent travel to Schriever AFB -Missile Defense Integration and Operations Center (MDIOC).

Benefits of Employment:

We may not know what's going to change the world next, but chances are we're already working on it, and you can, too. As part of our culture of innovation, you’ll have outstanding benefits and amenities, an inclusive work environment, ongoing career development and support, rewards and recognition to honor your hard work, and more!

Whatever your interests, there’s likely a community at Lockheed Martin for networking, becoming familiar with the area, and enjoying common activities with coworkers.

description: Come be a part of the development of the new Hypersonic Conventional Prompt Strike (CPS) weapon. This new multi-platform launched weapon system will include phases progressing through design, flight test, initial production and deployment of the weapon system. Join the Lockheed Martin team and be a part of the company that has developed and flown more hypersonic vehicles than any other U.S. Company and has decades of hypersonic development and flight test experience from government contracts as well as internal investments in research and development projects.  Candidate will be a Hardware in the Loop Software Engineer Product Owner for the Conventional Prompt Strike (CPS) program designing and developing the roadmap for the flight software Testbeds, and integrating the Hardware in the Loop Testbed (HWIL) used for the weapon system.

title: Defensive Cyberspace Operations (DCO) Analyst
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin Space is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world. Every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to craft, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture inspires employees to dream big, perform with excellence and build incredible products. We provide the resources, support, and the focus. You bring the passion and courage to envision limitless possibilities, and we’ll build a better tomorrow with you!

Are you ready to further your career in Cyber Security working for one of the top companies in the world?
Would you like the opportunity to work with a leading team on the groundbreaking United States Space Force (USSF) Space Operations Command (SpOC) Intelligence and Cyber-defense Enterprise Services (SPICES) contract?

As a Defensive Cyberspace Operations Analyst, you will be working at Schriever AFB performing the following:

• Perform an operator role on the government provided SIEM tool.
• Employ cyber security processes, methods, techniques and tools and assure their consistent application.
• Identify, contain, and respond to cyber incidents.
• Perform incident handling procedures.
• Assess and respond to USCYBERCOM task orders.
• Assist in the development of local Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs).
• Respond to INFOCON and CPCON changes.
• Prepare mission briefs.
• Participate in Wing exercises.

Must hold an active TS/SCI

Work Schedule: This role will align with the government's 12 hour shift structure with day shift being 7am to 7pm and night shift being 7pm to 7am. The DCO operator will work 4, 12 hour shifts with 3 subsequent days off.

***This position is for day shift.
qualifications:
• DOD 8570.07-M CSSP certification.
• Experience with a SIEM Tool (LogRhythm, Splunk).
• Experience with employment of DoD cybersecurity requirements, policies, and procedures to include assessment and authorization activities.
• Experience with responding to cyber incidents.

Top Secret clearance with SCI required to start
skills:
• Experience performing cybersecurity activities in support of software and system requirements, design, development, testing, and sustainment.
• Experience with, HBSS, ACAS, SCAP Compliance Checker (SCC), DISA STIGs.
• Experience with Secure Configuration/Hardening of DoD Information Systems.
• Knowledge of NIST 800-53.
• Experience with RHEL.
• Ability to provide guidance on DoD Cyber regulations and requirements to engineering and software development staff.

description:
This position is contingent upon Program award

Do you want the chance to re-think conventional wisdom and offer fresh, ground-breaking ideas? LM has new opportunities that provide you with a chance to challenge the status quo and experiment with new digital tools and emerging technologies that transform our mission.
Due to the classified nature of this opportunity we can’t talk about everything you’ll do on this program, but know that you will play a part in building end-to-end solutions and game-changing technology.

title: Chapter Next Returnship - Software Engineer/Littleton, CO
description:
Chapter Next – Let Lockheed Martin be the next step in your Journey Back to the workforce!

Have you taken some extended time away from your career in support of family or personal obligations? At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS), we understand that sometimes we must pause our professional life to support our family and loved ones. After stepping away from the workplace to care for children, aging parents or other family obligations, the road to return to work can be challenging, and at times intimidating. This is where Chapter Next can be part of your solution!

Chapter Next is a 12-16 week paid returnship hosted by RMS. Candidates who have taken a professional career hiatus for at least 2+ years will be eligible to apply to this program.

During this returnship participants will become part of a community of similarly experienced professionals with challenging work scopes that contribute to the great innovation produced by Lockheed Martin. Selected candidates will be exposed to comprehensive training, professional development opportunities, networking opportunities, and individual based mentoring

Our goal is to provide the fundamental tools needed to be successful in your career field, and to potentially prepare you for an opportunity to join Lockheed Martin full-time. Fields of focus will be diverse across the program and include functional and technical opportunities.

This returnship position is for a Software Engineer in the Multi-Domain Weapon Systems group in Littleton CO.

The Air Force Distributed Common Ground Station (AF DCGS) family of programs is seeking a software engineer to work modernization through sustainment activities.

The selected candidate will be supporting the program in all phases of the software development process. This individual will be executing Agile software development and programming in C++ and/or Java in a team environment potentially supporting multiple projects for the various products developed by this program such as the core products CETS (signal processing system), MSCS (theater situational awareness), and SEAM (sensor asset management). The selected candidate will also collaborate closely with project management, systems integration and test engineers, as well as fellow software engineers.

Applicants must have good communication, writing, and presentation skills.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
qualifications:
- Experience developing software in C++ and/or Java
- Object oriented design and programming experience
- Experience with the full software development cycle
- Experience with Linux/Unix based systems
- Ability to collaborate with a team of developers
- Excellent organizational and communication skills, both written and oral
- Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education. Entry level.
- Ability to obtain a secret clearance (U.S. Citizenship required)
skills:
- Experience in agile-based software development methodologies
- Experience with Software Integration and Test
- Strong computer science and math skills.
- Provides solutions to a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity
- Have a working understanding of LM software development plans and processes
- Experience with Enterprise architecture and distributed computing
- Experience with Relational Databases and SQL
- Experience with J2EE and web services
- Experience with Virtual Machines, packaging, jumpstart/kickstarts
- Experience with Docker, Puppet, RPMs
- System integration experience considered a plus
- Security Plus certification or equivalent considered a plus
- TS/SCI considered a plus
- Domain experience with SIGINT processing systems

title: Model-Based Engineering Staff Engineer
description:
As we enter a new era of Space Systems, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you have a passion for working on emerging technologies and results-oriented projects with the ability to drive significant long-term solutions? The Fleet Ballistic Missile (FBM) program is looking for an experienced and dedicated engineer to support the development and implementation of model-based electrical and mechanical engineering design (Physical World) and digital transformation technologies across the program. This critical initiative, executed through the Chief Engineer's office, provides you with the opportunity to work with multiple program organizations, engage with the LM Space Business Transformation Office (BTO), and collaborate with our Navy partners on their parallel Digital Engineering effort.

As a Model Based Engineering (MBE) Staff Engineer, you will work in the Chief Engineer's office collaborating with the Sr. Manager for MBE Implementation and be the MBE core team lead for the Physical World implementation. Responsibilities for this position include:

- Supporting the execution of the MBE strategic roadmap by leading efforts to further define the vision, strategy, and implementation plan for electrical and mechanical engineering design activities across the program

- Incorporation of MBSE into the design function and transition of design to manufacturing and production functions

- Ensuring the logical and practical transition of existing FBM programs to model-based design tools and methodologies

- Engagement with configuration management, check, manufacturing, quality, and PMP organizations to support implementation of the digital engineering workflow process

- Supporting the integration of the complete digital thread throughout engineering and support organizations

- Working with the LM Space BTO to ensure alignment of Enterprise transformation objectives with FBM objectives

- Supporting the customer’s Systems Engineering Transformation (SET) team and the alignment of the Navy’s Digital Engineering objectives with FBM objectives

- Leading collaborative teams that include customer and industry partners


Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition
qualifications:
Working knowledge of and experience using mechanical and electrical CAD tools and environments (e.g. CREO Parametric, Zuken, Windchill)

Broad knowledge and application of processes across systems engineering functions (e.g. system architecture and design, system requirements, CONOPS, systems analysis, system test, system validation and verification)

Experience in executing model-based engineering in at least one discipline

Knowledge of Model Based Engineering/Digital Transformation concepts, definitions and approaches

Proficiency in MS Office Products

Ability to obtain a DoD Secret clearance
skills:
Fleet Ballistic Missile (FBM) program experience

Advanced experience using mechanical and electrical CAD tools and environments

Familiarity with model-based systems engineering (MBSE) tools and modeling complex systems in MBSE tools and environments (e.g. DOORS, Cameo, MagicDraw, Teamwork Cloud)

Familiarity with engineering simulations and analyses (e.g. structural, environmental, finite element, stress, dynamics)

Experience developing, deriving, and implementing a model-based and/or digitally transformed architecture in a medium to large sized program

Experience and ability to lead and work with a geographically diverse, cross-functional team

Understanding of EPDM/Windchill and SAP/ERP systems

Proven ability to effectively lead and collaborate in a team environment

Strong written, communication, and presentation skills, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels with peers, leaders, and customers

Current DoD Secret clearance

title: Mass Properties Systems Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. At Lockheed Martin, we develop and build systems that really move. Some in space, while others move through the atmosphere, over land or over water. Our customers need and expect high performance from these systems and mass properties affects that performance.

Our Mass Properties Engineers help ensure our spacecraft get payloads to the right orbit around our planet or around other objects in our solar system, help our missile systems intercept a threat and protect our troops, help deliver a payload with pinpoint accuracy, or help us develop smaller, lightweight directed energy weapons, so they can be deployed on a variety of platforms.

As a Mass Properties Engineer, the job responsibilities will include:
• Ensure mass properties functions are carried out through junior or other senior Engineers
• Maintain control and handle personnel issues of the support team
• Provide technical direction to program management and customer to ensure programmatic performance
• Perform intricate analysis and actual measurements
• Lead the weight control and efforts on programs
• Coach, mentor and train engineers in complex analysis and verification
• Act as a technical consultant to programs and customers within the company
• Develop new and inventive mass properties tools and techniques in analysis, verification, and control

To promote the sharing of ideas, we at Lockheed Martin champion an inclusive work environment that supports differences and big-picture thinking.

You have opportunities to play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.

Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

You can learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package by visiting this link.
qualifications:
• Technical expertise in sophisticated mass properties analysis, including identification and quantification of error sources in accuracy and uncertainty analysis, and performing coordinate transformations
• Demonstrated experience and innovation in developing systems for high accuracy mass, center of gravity, and inertial measurements
• Experience with development and implementation of effective, low cost methods of program mass management and control
• Leadership experience within the mass properties field and as a part of a larger multi-disciplinary technical team
• US Citizenship with the ability to acquire and maintain a Secret security clearance
skills:
• Demonstrated experience leading the effort on multiple large programs, performing an intricate estimation for preliminary design concepts, and solving mass properties issues
• Develop new industry-wide mass properties engineering standards and control processes
• Experience with the responsibility of supporting and being the primary point of contact for a program
• Experience as a key contributor or as a lead for weight control and reduction efforts
• Ability to identify and resolve technical concerns with respect to weight reduction application and write Mass Properties procedures, practices and/or specifications
• Strong written (preparing monthly or quarterly weight status reports) and verbal communication (presenting mass properties summaries to management and customers)
• Experience with configuration assessment and prediction of mass properties based on preliminary design models as well as the evolving released design
• Familiarity with manufacturing and assembly techniques & processes, developing test procedures, and performing data reduction
• Self-starter, able to multitask, strive for a positive customer experience
• Missile or space segment design and test experience with one or more subsystems or areas outside of Systems Engineering
• Ability to lead multi-functional teams and lead multiple teams to communicate and coordinate work as one team with common goals
• Active Secret security clearance

title: Industrial Facilities Maintenance Manager
description:
What will the space industry look like in 50 years? Follow us to find out. We’re shaping the space technologies of tomorrow, today. As we further enhance and develop our competitive enterprise for capturing new opportunities and disrupting our competitors, Lockheed Martin Space works to provide the path forward in a dynamic environment and to stay ahead of environmental changes.
Virtually every Lockheed Martin Space mission success starts with a strong foundation of facility infrastructure design, which is built and operated risk free in support of business needs without interruption. As a Facilities Manager at Lockheed Martin Space, you’ll have the opportunity to use your education and experience to take on formidable challenges and become an integral part of our team as we build new, and maintain current, state of the art engineering facilities. At Lockheed Martin Space, you’ll use innovative approaches that help ensure reliability of electrical & machine infrastructure that produces cutting edge space systems and analyzes trends while managing operational efficiencies.

In this Facilities Manager role, you will be responsible for the following tasks:

• Leading teams consisting of Heating Ventilation & Air Conditioning (HVAC), Refrigeration, Plumbing & Pipe-fitting, Millwrights, Stationary Boiler House Operations, 2nd / 3rd Shift Operations team & Weekend Duty Lead, while implementing innovative processes that increase plant reliability, reduce business interruption risk and operating costs
• Oversee operation and maintenance care processes for infrastructure systems used within the approximately 3.7 Million square feet of Operational space in the Waterton campus in Littleton, CO.
• Actively participate in new facility project design reviews providing constructive comment to Facility Engineering
• Support project commissioning, functional check-outs to ensure designs are maintainable, while employing commonality with lifecycle costs minimized
• Managing a team budget, controlling cost, and managing organization work performance to established metrics.

• Support Predictive Maintenance technology & Digital Transformation initiatives
• Participate in the Facility Project Acceptance program, so assets are incorporated into Preventive Maintenance program with the right level of care that provides best value while maintaining assets in a reliable ready state in accordance with Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) principles
• Support other Plant Operations managers with equipment assessments, field trouble shooting, energy management, and operational planning
• Ensure spares are maintained through Crib Operations to maximize uptime while minimizing costs
• Determine organizational training requirements that enable staff to support organizational needs
• Support and keep current the Facility Condition Assessments survey data
• Support and or lead facility incident investigations through the Facility Correction Action Board
• Support Capital Refurbishment Long Range Plan process
• Support Plant Outage Planning for the Facilities organization with communication, documentation, and execution
• Oversee Plant Operations and Services contract management for service agreements and non-labor cost management within department
qualifications:
• Experience leading a technical team and interfacing with trade personnel as well as facility staff
• Must have proficiency with Microsoft Windows products including: Power Point, Excel, and Microsoft Word
• Ability to write clear, concise, detailed descriptive reports
• Previous experience using Maximo, IWMS or equivalent Computer Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS)
• Experienced with and demonstrated ability to follow established standards, policy and procedures, including mechanical, controls, construction, safety, risk planning, security, and for meeting program requirements
• Must be a United States citizen
• Must be able to obtain & maintain a Top Secret security clearance
skills:
• Knowledge of building and construction codes. Ability to read & interpreted construction MEP drawings
• Operational knowledge of Chilled Water Plants, Centralized Boiler House Operations, Steam systems, Colling Towers, Heat Exchangers, Plumbing systems, HVAC components & systems
• Application of predictive maintenance tools including vibration, ultrasonic and infrared analysis
• Ability to read/write Construction/Design standards as related to reliability/maintainability requirements
• Previous experience with Building Automation System implementation and incorporation of the IIoT
• Experience with application of Reliability Centered Maintenance principles
• Experience creating and managing vendor support service contracts
• LM21 or Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certified
• DOD and TS/SCI clearance desired

title: Spacecraft Systems Engineer
description:
Have you always wanted to know about Space Protection Programs (SPP)?

When you join SPP you will be part of one of the most inventive and fastest moving organizations in Space. Come help build end-to-end Space Security Systems for the DoD and other customers. Our cutting edge capabilities assure the security and health of our nation’s space assets. We push the boundary of what gets done in space. One day people may hear the full story of your achievements. When the history books are written, they may discover the critical role you’ve played to defeat the enemies of freedom. Come be one of the people working quietly to keep the light of liberty shining.

As a Spacecraft Systems Engineer, you will:
• Assist the program development and provide technical expertise in evaluating technical quality of design products
• Apply Lockheed Martin's technical processes, tools and validated methodologies to ensure Design Reviews for the program are executed optimally
• Support development of the Requirements, Interfaces, and Verification Baselines
• Support development of, ground and flight test planning, and design reviews
• Participate in value driven Systems Engineering team and drive design evolution in a systematic and thoughtful way
• Work closely with the customer counterparts to develop, test and field a strategic system

To promote the sharing of ideas, we at Lockheed Martin champion an inclusive work environment that supports differences and big-picture thinking.

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Make a collaborative impact as a Systems Administrator with our team in Colorado Springs, Colorado! Support the design, implementation, and maintenance of two sophisticated C2 systems labs implemented as multi-tenant private cloud environments. Do you have what it takes to fill this role?

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
Design inputs for the implementation of the C2 labs including VMware VCF, Red Hat Cloud Suite, VDI and private cloud infrastructure. Maintenance of physical and virtual network infrastructure and of Multi-Tenant Cloud environments and of VCF and Cloud Suite infrastructures.

Provide technical support to cloud tenant server and workstation environments, multi-factor account upkeep services and implementation of STIGS and monitoring of DCSA baseline configurations.

Preservation of the lab Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) system and the Change Management Database (CMD) and sustainment of DEVSECOPS pipelines.

Provide inputs and develop maintenance processes and perform hardware preventative inspections. Physically install rack mounted servers, network hardware, and support equipment.

HERE ARE SOME OF LOCKHEED MARTIN'S EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:
- Medical (some LM locations have on-site medical)

- 401k (with generous matching)

- Work/life balance, family-friendly environment
- Generous Tuition Reimbursement
