title: Data Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Model Based Engineering effort. If you have an interest in all things space and an interest in working for a company that will put astronauts on Mars, create 3D printed satellites, launch payloads that learn in orbit, or that develop national defense systems, come and be a part of our LM Space Team.

The Model Based Engineering Acceleration project, you will participate in the joint E&T/BITEE team, including activity to develop, test and deploy solutions to accelerate Model-Based Engineering (MBE) for program insertion. You will work collaboratively in product teams to successfully deliver Engineering products to the implementation teams.

In this role the candidate will have responsibility in the following areas:

• Understanding of Model Based Engineering principles to design and implement solutions that span the data lifecycle: collect, ingest, process, store, persist, access, and deliver data at scale and at speed
• Searching for and collecting information on various data topics
• Performing data analysis and metrics
• Working with local, distributed and cloud-based technologies
• Develop data virtualization and smart caching solutions
• Design and implement the data security required to protect and access the data
• Building data pipelines that clean, transform and aggregate unorganized data into databases or data sources
• Creating conceptual, logical and physical data model architecture, data extract/transform/load processes, reporting and analytics
The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated interest in data with an engaging, problems solving mindset
qualifications:
• Proficiency with languages/tools such as SQL, Python, Scala, and graph query language
• The ability to develop or script tools that efficiently preprocess, modify, aggregate, load, index, and archive large data collections
• Database experience with SQL (e.g., PostgreSQL, AWS RDS), NoSQL (Cassandra, MongoDB)
• Experience with agile development practices
• Proficiency with visualization tools such as Tableau
• Experience with relational/structured database development/design or experience with non-relational/unstructured, graph or big data database development/design
• Experience with graph database technologies (e.g., Janusgraph, Tinkerpop, Gremlin, neo4j)
skills:
• Experience with graph analytics on structured and unstructured data
• Experience with knowledge representation, pattern recognition, anomaly detection, and entity alignment
• Experience with statistics and statistical modeling
• Experience with relational/structured database development/design
• Experience with non-relational/unstructured, graph or big data database development/design
• Experience with data virtualization
• Data Security, data access methods and authentication/authorization protocols
• Familiarity with data cybersecurity practices and requirements
• Intellectual curiosity; creativity and innovation to go beyond current tools to deliver the best solution to complex problems
• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

title: Systems Integration Engineer
jobclass: Systems Engineering: System of Systems Integration
description:
If you’re looking for the challenge of a lifetime and a team of the brightest minds in the world, Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you. Join us today and let’s make a difference together.

Lockheed Martin is seeking a motivated system integrator to support the C2BMC Missile Defense National Team (MDNT) by integrating C2BMC software into the C2BMC test suites at the MDIOC, primarily Virtual servers; develop site and event specific configurations to support test, war games, and exercise events.

Operate and troubleshoot C2BMC systems during test events. Work with program-external personnel to resolve test lab issues; work with C2BMC Operations and Sustainment personnel to resolve installation and processing issues; create and modify scripts to extract specific information from log files; perform data analysis of input, internal, and output message data; troubleshoot both test and operational issues; document test results and prepare test status documentation; author Spiral and build-level test plan documents and procedures; create Test Discrepancy Reports to document issues; assist software development personnel with the investigation and resolution of issues; develop troubleshooting procedures and work-around documents; develop and execute detailed test plans and procedures to test C2BMC in an integrated environment or to test specific capabilities; plan and lead integration C2BMC tests with external elements and sensors; review and provide feedback of system specifications, development, test, network documents as necessary; attend meetings with other C2BMC FAs, customers, etc. and represent the Integration team.

Position is based in Colorado Springs at the MDIOC but sometimes multi-week travel to customer sites (e.g. EUCOM, CENTCOM) and contractor sites (e.g. Huntsville, HWY83) may be required. Ability to travel is a requirement.

Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

-Knowledgeable, supportive, and engaged leadership
-Mentorship opportunities
-Rewards & recognition
-Generous Tuition Reimbursement

- Working knowledge in test plan/procedure preparation and test execution

- High proficiency with VMware, virtual servers, UNIX, including shell scripting

- Proficient in Microsoft Office applications

- Ability to travel required

title: Data Engineer
description:
The Lockheed Martin Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy team member with a strong working knowledge in Data Engineering and Infrastructure Design to support the Data Ops portfolio for the business. In this role you will be part of the AI Factory team consisting of colleagues possessing varying skill sets including; front-end and back-end developers, data scientists, machine learning / AI specialists, product managers, and other data engineers. The selected candidate will focus on Data Ops but will be included as part of a broader range of projects across the LAIC portfolio. The team is focused on exploiting small, innovative and agile teams to rapidly iterate and mature solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the Lockheed Martin enterprise.

The selected candidate will focus on…
•Ingesting Data from Batch and Streaming processes to load it into our Data Lake
•Managing and creating ETL processes to prepare data for consumption
•Creating monitoring capabilities to ensure data streams are effective and active
•Developing CI/CD pipelines to manage effective changes to multiple infrastructure foot prints
• Develop and implement automated regression test plans

title: Logistics Project Manager
description:
The candidate will assume the Logistics Program Integration responsibilities leading a team consisting of supply chain, repair depot, training, technical document, field technical services, and logistics analysis professionals. Candidate will be responsible for the execution of all logistics efforts supporting multiple radar and other sensor programs. The position will work closely with Program Managers to determine staffing levels, required skillsets, and day to day management, measurement, and reporting of contract scope. The Program Integrator devises and implements plans, budgets, and schedules in response to program requirements. He/she will monitor work progress of logistics personnel assigned to tasks to ensure milestones are met. Devises solutions in response to problems that negatively affect successful accomplishment of tasks assigned throughout the team. Advises, coordinates, and assists in training assigned logistics personnel.
The Logistics Project Manager will be a member program Configuration Control Boards and review design changes for logistics impacts. The candidate will be responsible for design for sustainment activities and participate in reliability, availability and maintainability engineering activities.
qualifications:

• Working knowledge of modern logistics disciplines
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to gain a Department of Defense TOP SECRET security clearance
• Experience using Microsoft Office Suite applications
• Familiarity with data analysis, metrics collection, and reporting
• Determined work ethic and positive attitude

PLEASE NOTE:
- Applicants selected must be able to successfully pass a background investigation and drug test.
Additionally, any roles requiring Department of Defense Security Clearances will require US Citizenship.

• Experience managing highly effective teams in a professional technical environment.

title: Technician: Advanced Career
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.  Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Do you want to join a team where employees envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We are creating a better today and tomorrow by seamlessly aligning diversity and inclusion efforts with Lockheed Martin’s values and business strategy. We offer business resource groups such as African American Council for Excellence (AACE), The Women’s Impact Network (WIN), Hispanic Organization for Leadership & Awareness (HOLA), Military/Veterans Network, PRIDE LGBT Professional Network, and more. We are also committed to enabling transitioning veterans to connect with their communities and find new purpose as they reintegrate into civilian life. By clicking on the links, you can find out more on how we proudly support Global Diversity and Hiring Our Heroes.

We have an excellent opportunity in Littleton, CO for a Technician Senior Specialist to work within the Special Programs organization. Special Programs has an excellent track record of stable programs with highly evolving technical requirements that drives subcontract changes on a regular basis. Special Programs has developed a significant number of future leaders with a wide variety of engagement programs and challenging work to develop individual potential.

The Electrical Aerospace Ground Equipment (EAGE) Operation and Maintenance Department (O&M) Team is looking for a person with a desire to engage in a team-based high performance work group. Performs a variety of duties in the electronic, mechanical, electromechanical, and/or optical areas.

Summary of Key Duties for this position:
• Constructs, troubleshoots, calibrates, adjusts, tests, diagnoses, and maintains equipment, components, devices, or systems.
• Works from schematics, engineering drawings and written or verbal instructions.
• Operates related equipment; conducts tests and reports data in prescribed format.
• Performs calibration and alignment checks; makes adjustments, modifications, and replacements as directed; prepares prescribed compounds and solutions.
• On call to support 24/7 Test Program.
• Active TS/SCI is preferred but not required prior to employment Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Typical Experience:
• Typically requires specialized technical training equivalent to a technical Associate degree and 5 Years of experience.

Lockheed Martin Space offers a total compensation package from competitive wages, on-site medical care and healthy living incentives!

title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you looking for an exciting career as a Software Engineer at one of the top Aerospace and Defense Companies? A fulfilling position that challenges your mind, grows your skills, and contributes to our Nation’s most critical missions is right in front of you! At Lockheed Martin Space, we advance the frontiers of science, help the military protect what matters most, and solve problems that others think are impossible. We have challenging missions that will inspire and innovate!

Our Next Gen Geo Mission Processing team is looking for a motivated Software Engineer to augment our Agile Team in support of our Overhead Persistent Infrared (OPIR) Mission Processing Product. We are seeking a dynamic Software Engineer to help support these critical efforts, which include development of solutions in support of OPIR sensor data stream processing to be used for missile warning.

As a member of a high-performing team you must be passionate about your trade, focused on mission system quality, and supportive of timely delivery of features and capabilities. This position involves design, development and maintenance, and testing of mainly C++ code. Challenges will include adapting and testing framework for new interfaces, developing APIs, and developing mission processing applications.

This position is in beautiful Boulder, Colorado location which has numerous amenities such as a fitness center, daily rotating food trucks, and a collaborative and modern agile workspace.



To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin cultivates an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

title: Senior Manager, Signal and Image Processing
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as an Optical Payload Image Signal Processing Sr. Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are seeking a leader with a track record of delivering to technical, schedule, and financial commitments, and driving the best customer and enterprise value as a result. We want someone who demonstrates a breadth of technical knowledge across multiple functions and a variety of program experience. Our Senior Manager, Signal and Image Processing is someone with outstanding interpersonal skills, and a validated ability to represent the organization to customers, employees, and partners.

More specifically, you will:
• Partner with Lines of Business (LOB), OPCoE Program Development, and OPCoE Payload Systems Engineering teams to develop image processing capability in a consistent manner to enable reuse across multiple programs
• Develop transition plans for low Technology Readiness Level (TRL) products from the science and technology community
• Lead or support intellectual property evaluations and development of patent applications
• Propose and execute IRAD projects with a goal of standardization and maturation, in coordination with OPCoE Program Development
• Enhance relationships with strategic suppliers and other LM Business Areas (BAs) to compliment the in-house OPCoE team
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers. Fold emerging mission trends into product roadmap to ensure a discriminating edge
• Implement and lead technical knowledge management to develop and maintain strengths, key technical skills, knowledge continuity and facilitate career advancement opportunities to employees
• Handle staffing requirements, sustain engineering capabilities and preserve critical skills

Working location can be in Littleton, Colorado OR Sunnyvale, California:

Keyword\\Phrases Include:
Signal Processing, Image Processing, Digital Signal Processing, DSP. Electro-Optical, Optical Engineering, Payload Engineering, Space Communications, Sensors, Remote Sensing, Electro Magnetic effects, EMC, EMI, Engineering Management, Technical Leadership, Algorithm Development, IRAD, Internal Research and Development and Classified Programs.

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical
• Dental
• 401k

qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline (i.e., electrical, computer science, or other engineering/science discipline); or equivalent combination of education and experience
• Demonstrated experience with computer algorithms and image/signal processing
• Demonstrated experience in the design, development, and/or verification of signal and image collection systems
• Established experience in developing technical talent and building pipelines to sustain technical expertise within the organization
• US Citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance
skills:
• Experience working across space and ground applications. Our systems include ground-to-ground, space to ground (and vice versa), and space to space
• Experience in the development of processing and dissemination computer algorithms. Candidate will lead all aspects of a team that design, develop and analyze systems and algorithms for the extraction of information from signal and image sensors
• Experience in remote sensing; detection and estimation theories; morphological processing; neural networks; and utilization of signal processing within advanced computer architectures (i.e., GPUs)
• Demonstrated ability to drive closure and resolve complex technical issues/challenges
• Variety of customer experience and exposure across Space Lines-Of-Businesses
• 8 years of demonstrated technical expertise
• 3 years demonstrated hands-on expertise in space OR complex hardware/software systems
• Prior Full Spectrum Leadership roles with proven experience leading employees to perform productively and foster relationships in a multi-functional team environment
• Work with the OPCoE Chief Engineer, architects and Fellows to develop processing capabilities in accordance with Lines of Business (LOB) roadmaps and need dates
• Domain specialist for remote sensing, detection and estimation theories, morphological processing, speech processing, neural networks, electromagnetic and acoustic effects on signals, and utilization of signal processing with advanced computer architecture
• Provide significant impact to the enterprise through establishment of a dedicated team working to drive high TRL signal and image processing technology across programs

title: Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Engineer Staff
description:
The Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) Artificial Intelligence (AI) team is seeking motivated engineers with a strong background in software engineering, DevOps, artificial intelligence and machine learning to support the RMS AI team and product portfolio.

The RMS AI Engineering & Technology team is passionate about a broad range of projects from research & development to prototype development, culminating in deployment of our products to customers. We are on the cutting edge, inserting AI into defense systems, delivered through our AI Software Factory. This role will get an outstanding mix with research, prototype development, and software to hardware toolchain development all within the domain of AI / ML programs.

The RMS AI team has an immediate opportunity for a multifaceted, hardworking, motivated engineer who wants to join our team. If you have an interest and passion for making AI / ML, this role is for you! At Lockheed Martin, we are driven by innovation and integrity, and we are excited to bring cutting edge technology to our customers & their missions.

This role is responsible for the development of technologies and products that leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning to provide discriminating capability to our customers. This requires engagement in every phase of the system development lifecycle including: requirements generation, system and software design, implementation, integration & test, and verification & validation. Activities will range from low TRL research, development of prototypes, building demos, and transitioning to production.

This role is expected to utilize current AI paradigms, algorithms, and models (e.g. deep learning, reinforcement learning, computer vision); applying these techniques in relevant domains to tackle sophisticated problems and create innovative solutions. This also requires a candidate to maintain awareness of emerging analytics, AI / ML, and domain-specific technologies. This role will be expected to assume technical lead responsibilities & lead teams, ensure standard methodologies, take ownership of critical tasks, and mentor junior engineers. This role may be based at any RMS site, or remotely via telecommuting depending on program needs.

This job is aligned with our 21st Century Warfare (21CWFAIA) initiative to help the U.S. and its allies leverage emerging technologies to deter threats to economic prosperity and national security.

In addition to the responsibilities highlighted above we offer extensive benefits to include competitive 401k and insurance. We remain an equal opportunity company.
qualifications:
Experience with AI/ML domain programming languages (e.g. Python, C++, Java, GO, MatLab)
Experience developing and deploying AI/ML models, and a knowledge of machine learning frameworks and deep learning toolsets (e.g. SciKit-learn, TensorFlow PyTorch, Caffe, Keras)
DevOps experience including CI/CD pipelines to build, test, deploy
Experience developing applications on Linux
Experience with network/messaging (UDP, ZeroMQ, RESTful API, etc.)
Experience interfacing with databases (SQL, MongoDB, etc.)
Familiarity with high-performance computing
Experience with one or more of the AI disciplines (e.g. Natural Language Processing, Anomaly Detection, Markov Chain and Monte Carlo (MCMC) Methods, Machine Learning, Predictive Modeling, Statistical Analysis and Hypothesis Testing)
Strong problem solving mindset: ability to develop create solutions to difficult problems often requiring integration of conflicting and, at times, ambiguous or incomplete data on a fast-paced schedule
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex design information, technical decision and issues to both highly technical and non-technical peers
Ability to build and maintain relationships, collaborate with others, engage in constructive conflict, and manage interpersonal dynamics
Comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic multi-disciplinary environment
Experience with software planning and execution throughout the requirements, development, design, build, test, and integration phases of a program & familiarity with transitioning prototype software to production, including rapid software prototyping experience to create minimal viable products for evaluation of options
skills:
Technical lead or leadership experience in software development
Familiarity with signal processing & domain expertise

The Solutions Architect will contribute to long-term plans, technology roadmaps, evolution strategies, and support new business captures and LM R&D planning. The Communications Solutions Architect will be an author for RFI and RFP responses.

title: Signal and Image Processing Manager
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as an Optical Payload Image Signal Processing Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are seeking a leader with a track record of delivering to technical, schedule, and financial commitments, and driving the best customer and enterprise value as a result. We want someone who demonstrates a breadth of technical knowledge across multiple functions and a variety of program experience. Our Signal and Image Processing Senior Manager is someone with outstanding interpersonal skills, and a validated ability to represent the organization to customers, employees, and partners.

More specifically, you will:
• Partner with Lines of Business (LOB), OPCoE Program Development, and OPCoE Payload Systems Engineering teams to develop image processing capability in a consistent manner to enable reuse across multiple programs
• Develop transition plans for low TRL products from the science and technology community
• Lead or support intellectual property evaluations and development of patent applications
• In coordination with OPCoE Program Development, propose and execute IRAD projects with a goal of standardization and maturation
• Enhance relationships with strategic suppliers and other LM Business Areas (BAs) to compliment the in-house OPCoE team
• Perform as part of the Integrated Product Team (IPT) in cases where an OPCOE make is selected. Your team will support through all program phases and be responsible for development, qualification and flight as determined by the program
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers. Fold emerging mission trends into product roadmap to ensure a discriminating edge
• Implement and lead technical knowledge management to develop and maintain strengths, key technical skills, knowledge continuity and facilitate career advancement opportunities to employees
• Handle staffing requirements, sustain engineering capabilities and preserve critical skills

qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in technical discipline (i.e., electrical, computer science, or other engineering/science discipline) or equivalent combination of education and experience
• Demonstrated experience with computer algorithms and signal/image signal processing
• Demonstrated experience in the design, development, and verification of signal and image collection systems
• Established experience in developing technical talent and building pipelines to sustain technical expertise within the organization
• US citizenship with an active Top Secret clearance
skills:
• Current TS/SCI preferred
• Experience working across space and ground applications. Our systems include ground-to-ground, space to ground (and vice versa), and space to space
• Experience in the development of processing and dissemination computer algorithms. Candidate will lead all aspects of a team that design, develop and analyze systems and algorithms for the extraction of information from signal and image sensors
• Experience in remote sensing; detection and estimation theories; morphological processing; neural networks; and utilization of signal processing within advanced computer architectures (i.e., GPUs)
• Demonstrated ability to drive closure and resolve complex technical issues/challenges
• Variety of customer experience and exposure across Space Lines-Of-Businesses
• 8 years of demonstrated technical expertise
• 3 years demonstrated hands-on expertise in space OR complex hardware/software systems
• Prior Full Spectrum Leadership roles with proven experience leading employees to perform productively and foster relationships in a multi-functional team environment
• Work with the OPCoE Chief Engineer, architects and Fellows to develop processing capabilities in accordance with Lines of Business (LOB) roadmaps and need dates
• Domain specialist for remote sensing, detection and estimation theories, morphological processing, speech processing, neural networks, electromagnetic and acoustic effects on signals, and utilization of signal processing with advanced computer architecture
• Provide significant impact to the enterprise through establishment of a dedicated team working to drive high TRL signal and image processing technology across programs

title: Senior Opto-Mechanical Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) as an Opto-Mechanical Engineer!

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate experts across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Join us as an Senior Opto-Mechanical Engineer, where you will support the full life cycle of optical payload development from initial concept design through flight hardware delivery. The position is for an individual contributor, with growth potential to team lead, and the potential to become a Certified Principal Engineer (CPE) who owns and is accountable for all critical aspects of an assigned product throughout its lifecycle.

In this role, you will:
• Get into the heart of trade studies, analyses, design maturation, and drawing delivery for optical benches, optical element layouts, telescopes, optical mounts and fixtures, and active optical elements
• Perform structural (both static and vibrational), thermal and optical performance analyses, working with a cross-functional team of engineers to optimize payload performance
• Be a key member of our team that designs and develops electro-optical instruments and payloads for civilian and military aerospace applications
• Succeed with a passion for and mounting experience with optical systems, and a goal of continuously growing your capabilities through study, analysis, collaboration, and practice.

We will look for proficiency with MS PowerPoint and Excel, and the ability to clearly communicate orally and in writing.

You would typically have a Bachelors and 5-10 years of professional experience, a Masters and 3-8 years, or a PhD and 0-5 years.

• US citizenship and the ability to obtain a TS/SCI/Poly security clearance

• Proposal writing experience

title: Lockheed Martin Research Scientist - University of Arizona
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Advanced Technology Center (ATC).

The ATC is the research lab for LM Space. Through our own skills and those of our partners—including universities and research labs around the world—we’re able to put vision in motion. While we are a part of LM's space division, our technologies are far-reaching across domains. Napkin sketches of lasers that can shoot down UAVs—we made it real. Changing molecules so metals behave differently? We invented that. ATC’s story is written in the success of missions here on Earth and far, far into space. Our innovation extends beyond incremental change. We strive for first-of-a-kind capability with enduring impact. Whatever the application, our charter is to create game-changing technologies. At the ATC, we’re inspiring change in our endless pursuit of what’s next.

Our employees perform scientific experiments, investigations, observations and related research studies into the nature and operation of natural phenomena in a variety of fields, using the scientific methods. They develop theories for understanding, characterizing and organizing natural phenomena into a systematic and meaningful pattern for the benefit of project advancement and emerging technologies.

Our facilities are located in Sunnyvale & Palo Alto, CA and Littleton, CO.

ATC primarily hires Research Engineers and Research Scientists, often with backgrounds in optical sciences, systems engineering, materials science, data science, autonomous systems, artificial intelligence, hypersonics, and many other related fields.

Our employees design, analyze, and test optical and electro-optical systems and components. They Conduct research and development into phases of physical optics and geometric optics, lasers, laser characteristics, laser maintenance, and broadband optical sources. OPCoE primarily hires Optical Engineers, Electro-Optical Engineers, Opto-Mechanical Engineers, and Signal/Image Processing Engineers. We are looking for people with experience or expertise in optical payloads, lasers, remote sensing, high energy lasers, and other related systems.

title: Business Development Analysis Sr Mgr
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Lockheed Martin has been on the leading edge of Space and Defense Innovation for over 100 years. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unrivaled skills and experiences to create, design & build solutions to some of the nation’s biggest challenges. Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with perfection & build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

We are seeking a Business Development Senior Manager within our Space Military Space, Space Security mission area. This position requires an active TS/SCI clearance & previous affiliations and/or relevant experience with Space DoD & Intelligence Communities.

In this role, you will focus on Enterprise Strategy, capture opportunities within our Defense & Space Security mission that meet Long Range Plan (LRP) requirements and management of business development and capture management professionals. You will assist in the development of the LRP related to this mission area with the Space Security Strategy & Business Development Director. You will use your expertise to address critical customer needs while growing the business and building on the history and success of Lockheed Martin while building on your career achievements.

Summary of Key Duties for this position:

• Develop an overall customer-focused strategic plan focused on both short & long-term growth opportunities.
• Identify & establish key industry partnerships to maximize new business growth for our key customers.
• Support development of a robust LRP with a balance of "A" & "B" orders.
• Actively support capture team on key opportunities.
• Lead efforts with executives to develop & execute strategic growth plans focused on Space Security.
• Collaborate with Space Security and Engineering Leadership to create technology roadmaps & related Internal Research & Development (IR&D) projects to create discriminators necessary to develop new business.
• Lead the integration & partnership with other Space lines of business related to our customers.
• Maintain accountability to shape & win new business through a balanced focus on customer value, the competitive environment, & the corporation's best interests.
• Develop & maintain effective customer, teammate, & internal relationships.

How to define your success in this position:

• Ability to build strong internal & external networks and teams.
• Success with identifying, shaping, & winning new business.
• Development & growth of new business pipelines.
• Effective use/management of New Business Acquisition Expense (NBAE).
• Effectiveness with Capture Management (leading competitive captures).
• Success with new market penetration.
• Meeting Long Range Plan commitments.

title: Asc Mgr, Financial Management
description:
At Lockheed Martin, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our capacity – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team lead will coordinate all forecasting, reporting and analysis of financial metrics (Orders, Sales, Profit, Cash, and Capital) for IWSS line of business (LOB) to internal leadership as well as POC to RMS/CHQ FP&A personnel. Provide guidance and mentoring to senior and staff financial analysts as well as FLDPs assigned to markets segments on IWSS FP&A team. Collaborate with and provide guidance to the four IWSS Market Segments for related FP&A rhythms and deliverables. Coordinate scheduling and execution of critical forecasting and reporting exercises plus responding to ad hoc requests from LOB staff, RMS and CHQ.

Benefits: In addition to the responsibilities highlighted above we offer extensive benefits to include competitive 401k, insurance, and a new 4/10 schedule. We remain an equal opportunity company.

Broad financial background including Program Finance, Pricing and FP&A (Financial Planning and Analysis) experience.

SAP, Hyperion, Microsoft Excel and Power Point experience.

Excellent communications skills to provide clear, concise and confident presentations to brief executive leadership.

Leadership skills to act as FP&A team lead when Sr. Manager is unavailable.

SAP and Hyperion tool expert

title: Opto-Mechanical Senior Staff Engineer - Payload Structural Analyst
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our outstanding skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, encouragement and focus and if you have the passion, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

The Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) at Lockheed Martin Space is seeking an experienced Opto-mechanical/Precision Mechanism Engineer and Structural Analyst to play a leading role in our design and development work on a variety of passive, active, and directed energy optical payloads. We are looking for engineers with strong mechanical skills, highly relevant and related experience, and a keen interest in optical payloads. OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members coordinate specialists across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

With a focus on structural analysis and design, integrated into full payload design and performance assessments, you will be engaged in the design, specification, and procurement support for optical bench assemblies, optical mounts and fixtures, mechanical ground support equipment, alignment fixtures, and a range of related assets to be used in the development, test and manufacture of optical payloads. This position calls for a consistent, responsible, deadline-meeting professional who will:

- Work under broad guidance from senior engineering and program leadership;

- Collaborate and contribute across the design team;

- Guide the work of junior and emerging engineers;

- Engage with prospective and selected suppliers;

- Deliver robust documents and briefings, and;

- Support customer reviews

We are seeking a team member with strong written and oral communication skills. You should also demonstrate strong quantitative skills and the ability to apply them to the formidable mechanical challenges of precision optical payload subsystems.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 14-20 years of professional experience, a Masters and 12 -18 years, or a PhD and 9-15 years.

**Please note that this role can be located in Sunnyvale, CA or Louisville, CO. If located in Sunnyvale the role has current funding. If located in Louisville, the role is contingent upon funding expected in the 4th quarter of 2021.

description:

Digital transformation is Lockheed Martin’s path to the future with its interconnected environment where data becomes information and information drives decisions that create value across the entire lifecycle. To help us along this journey Space is seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Space Workstream Transformation Business Process Engineer. We’re looking for someone with passion and enthusiasm to enable and deliver on the Space Business Transformation!

Business Process Engineer contributing to Business Transformation at Lockheed Martin Space. As a member of the Workstream Transformation team, the successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing business and technical processes to formulate and develop new and modified business processes based on evolving and advanced digital capabilities of business systems. Evaluating, reinventing, and streamlining to optimize processes to leverage new digital capabilities. Represent business process needs with technology teams to define requirements and business cases for the technology developments. Coordinates with business and technology teams, ascertaining system requirements, such as program functions, output requirements, input data acquisition, and system techniques and controls. Work directly with Space Business Transformation systems engineering and architecture team to ensure integration across transformation architectures. Work with Space Business Transformation Implementation Team and Functional Leadership teams to identify opportunities to drive implementation of new processes and prepare for change management required to execute new processes.

title: Guidance, Navigation & Control Sr Stf Engr
description:
Do you want the chance to re-think conventional wisdom and offer fresh, ground-breaking ideas? LM has new opportunities that provide you with a chance to challenge the status quo and experiment with new digital tools and emerging technologies that transform our mission.
Due to the classified nature of this opportunity we can’t talk about everything you’ll do on this program, but know that you will play a part in building end-to-end solutions and game-changing technology.


The Military Space Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GN&C) team is made up of enthusiastic and talented individuals that design and produce the hardware, algorithms, and software required to solve the challenging problems of controlling these systems in a harsh, zero-g environment. Are you willing to join this team and help solve these challenges in a team environment using your GN&C academic background and spacecraft industry experience? Do you have experience in leading a team of GN&C engineers? If so, consider this GN&C technical leadership position on an exciting space program. You will be the GN&C Responsible Subsystem Engineer (RSE) for this new exciting smallsat program.

This position in contingent upon program award expected around Q3 2021 .


You will typically have 14 years of professional experience and a bachelor's degree in this position.

This position requires that you will be willing and able to obtain a Top Secret DoD clearance w/SCI .

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
This is a position for the Space Software Product Line (SSPL) organization as a DevSecOps Software Engineer. SSPL is revolutionizing how LM designs, develops, and delivers spacecraft software, whether for NASA deep space missions, Global Positioning System (GPS) satellites, the U.S. Intelligence Community, and many other customers. This includes leveraging the latest DevSecOps tools and methodologies to deliver value to our customers quickly, efficiently, and repeatably. The selected candidate will join the SSPL team and will support multiple efforts related to DevSecOps development, implementation, and maintenance. The successful candidate will be a Systems Thinker who will help mature SSPL’s DevSecOps strategy across all software product lines. Additionally, the candidate will help mature SSPL’s DevSecOps implementation and have a strong desire to automate processes rather than doing them twice.

The successful candidate will:
• Possess strong understanding in DevSecOps

• Enjoy using Agile best practices, including the many feedback mechanisms for improvement

• Understand the benefits of Test-Driven-Development

• Have experience in a wide range of DevSecOps and CI/CD tools

• Be highly motivated to deliver results in a dynamic work environment

• Be comfortable with automated build processes, including automated testing and continuous deployment

• Be an emerging technical leader with a strong desire to grow SSPL’s DevSecOps strategy

• Want to be part of an awesome SSPL work environment and contribute to its creative, fun, and engaging work culture

This position is essential as each of the four software product lines has experienced and are expecting to continue to experience significant growth in the near future. A key objective of this position will be to develop CI/CD solutions which effectively package multiple products from our product lines in order to execute in a more cost and schedule efficient manner for our customers.


To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking. title: AI/ML Training and Summit Coordinator
description:
When it comes to using cutting-edge to tackle complex problems, is driven by a singular mission focus and desire to continuously innovate. Today’s challenges to global security aren’t just changing – they’re accelerating faster than ever before. Through our dedication to our mission, our -enabled systems are changing the way militaries operate and protect their forces, the way first responders fight fires, and how researchers explore the far reaches of space and the ocean’s depths.

The Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy individual with a strong working knowledge in engineering, and to support the Applied team and product portfolio, focusing on a broad range of projects across the LAIC. The team is focused on exploiting small, innovative and teams to rapidly iterate and mature solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the enterprise and in the field for our customers.

The selected candidate will focus on the of technologies and products that leverage to provide discriminating capability to our customers. This will require engagement in every phase of the system lifecycle including requirements generation, system and design, implementation, integration, and flight test. Activities will range from low TRL research, proof of concepts, of prototypes, building demonstrators, and transition to production. The selected candidate can expect to utilize current paradigms including computer vision, , and reinforcement , applying these techniques to solve complex problems and field innovative solutions.

Must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time and interpersonal skills.


The Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy individual with a strong working knowledge of and to organize and manage and (/ML) training initiatives across the enterprise. You will be part of a team of front-end and back-end developers, engineers, /ML specialists, product managers, and other scientists. The AiMLabs team is focused on building a strong and vibrant AI/ML community at including tools, training, events, and knowledge sharing.

The selected candidate will coordinate AI/ML training initiatives across the enterprise. Responsibilities include
• Shaping content needs through discussions with AI/ML subject matter experts, internal and external training providers, project managers, and more
• Managing continuous improvement of training content by engaging with stakeholders and providers
• Administering live training events like courses, hackathons, bootcamps, and summits across the enterprise
• Staying abreast of emerging technologies, tools, and processes in the AI/ML field and anticipating future training gaps
• Must be a US citizen

We are looking for you to perform EGSE designs and improvements, support and test execution, develop and review test documentation, and oversee the execution of subsystem and system-level EGSE testing.

KEY DUTIES FOR THIS POSITION INCLUDE:
• Documents test results and test discrepancies.

• Leads troubleshooting efforts.

• Coordinates subsystem and/or system testing activities with support organizations.

• May perform impromptu briefs of test status or discrepancies to customer representatives or program management.

Please note that this position will require on call support to a 24/7 test operations schedule.

description:

As the Spacecraft Lead Engineer, you will work closely with design and analysis teams to develop and deliver a product that meets mission needs. You will be heavily involved with the spacecraft bus supplier with a goal of understanding all technical aspects of the spacecraft design and the corresponding requirements. You will oversee and support the efforts of the spacecraft subsystems including electronics, software, thermal, structures, propulsion, GN&C, power, stress, dynamics, and specialty engineering in support of your product.

Specific responsibilities include:

• Drive resolution of spacecraft issues, developing solutions to technical problems of varying complexity while assuring sound technical content and timely closure
• Development and maintenance of schedules and budgets in support of program milestones and hardware deliveries
• Measurement and maintenance of progress across spacecraft subsystems to meet critical program dates
• Support to spacecraft assembly, integration and test efforts and support to launch vehicle integration and general launch operations efforts, as necessary

title: Composite Technician
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can contribute to a very important mission? Come and be part of our team in the dynamic world of Lockheed Martin Space. We are seeking a Composite Technician to work at our Littleton, CO site.

The role will involve working from engineering drawings, written work instructions and process specifications. This role will assemble structural and precision mechanical components in a shop environment. Tasks will include but are not limited to:
-Installation and torqueing of fasteners, drilling, installation of rivets, adhesive bonding, measurement and shimming interfaces to close tolerances.
-Aerospace paint, aerospace primer and other aerospace coating application using spray, brush, swab techniques.
-Surface prep, using grit blast, hand abrade and power abrasion techniques.
-Prepreg and wet layup fabrication techniques, including vacuum bag processing, bonding, and oven/autoclave curing.
-Tooling fabrication from various materials such as aluminum, composites, and wood.
-Working with small shop power tools (saws, routers, sanders, and grinders).
-Machine shop equipment operation (mill, lathe, table saw, band saw, etc.).
-Assembly of composite structures including setup, bonding, and fastener applications.
-Operation of measuring devices such as calipers, height gages, micrometers, and torque wrenches.
qualifications:

title: Program Manager for Research Programs
description:
Lockheed Martin Corporate Engineering and Technology Office (CETO) is looking for high energy, enthusiastic and out of the box thinkers for career progression opportunities to work across the enterprise in managing Commercial partnership programs to develop generation-after-next technologies critical to the future success of the corporation. You will play a vital role in defining our future by driving innovative solutions for our customers. The Technology Collaboration charter is to work collaboratively across the enterprise to support developing discriminating and longer-term, far-reaching capabilities needed to enable Lockheed Martin’s 21st Century Warfare technology strategy. Technology Collaboration is assigned responsibility, authority, and accountability for process documentation and guidance, execution of technology collaborations in the case of CTO assigned collaborations, and support in the case of other Corporate, Engineering, Technology and Operations (CETO) teams. The role focuses on enabling CEO commercial collaboration initiatives. The area is also responsible for Technology Scouting, including supporting other Research &Technology areas in commercial collaboration analysis for partnerships and technology landscaping.

The successful candidate will assist in generation and reporting on the following:

• Execute the CTO requested collaborations, including agreements and IP management
• Document and maintain Technology Collaboration process which is approved by CTO
• Deliver Tech Scouting reports of value to SVP and his leadership team
• Contribute actively to Technology Landscape and Partnership analysis work by other Research &Technology Teams
• Consider ideas and possibilities that others do not see & inspire them to follow the Vision
• Maintain a high level of expertise in multiple fields through continuous learning
• Partner with company architects of infrastructure and integrated systems to appraise impact of delivered services
qualifications:
Experience in 2 or more of the 21st Century technology domains: Spectrum Dominance, Autonomy and MUM-T, Joint All Domain Operations, Resilient and Responsive Space, Cyber/Electronic Warfare, Advanced Comms/5G, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning, Edge Computing, Hypersonics/Advanced Weapons, Directed Energy, Quantum Information Sciences or Synthetic Biology

• Minimum of 3 years program management experience on a large IRAD or program
• Minimum of 3 years of leading diverse technical teams
• Experience in coordination across multiple lines of business and multi-functional organizations for internally funded research and development (IRAD) investments
• Experience planning technical efforts, include schedules, metrics and budgets; solid understanding of earned value management
• Experience with projects that include development, implementation, integration and testing
• Customer knowledge and proven technology transition experience
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Demonstrated ability to thrive in a virtual, matrixed organization
• Ability to obtain US Govt Security Clearance

description:

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Every day, our 110,000 employees come to work with one focus – our customers’ missions. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.


What does this role look like?


Supply Chain’s vision is to enable customer and mission success through supply chain strategies and execution that deliver superior operational program performance and create competitive advantage through continuous improvement. It is our mission to deliver affordable supply chain solutions that meet all program requirements and manage supply chain risks to ensure positive supplier performance through all phases of the program life-cycle from capture to sustainment.

This role will offer you the following daily challenges:

• Administering subcontract effort of suppliers across the Mission Solutions portfolio.
• Working with the members of the LM Subcontractor Management Team (SPM, CPE, QA & various SMEs), administering the subcontract through all phases of the procurement process, from contract award to contract closeout
• Ensuring that the program performance, quality, and mission success requirements are flowed to the supplier and that the supplier is managed to ensure commitments and requirements are met
• Ensuring compliance with all appropriate prime contract flow downs and will be responsible for new business requirements, to include RFP's to assigned supplier, technical evaluations, and Basis of Estimate requirements thru negotiations and definitization of the subcontractor
• Oversees the negotiation and coordination of additions, deletions, or modifications to subcontracts

This position may be based in either Denver, CO Or in King of Prussia, PA
qualifications:
To be successful, you will need to possess these basic qualifications:

• Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 6 years of professional experience; or 4 years of professional experience with a related Masters's degree.
• Experience working with SAP, P2P, or equivalent.
• Experience working in a collaborative/teaming environment.
• Demonstrated ability to bring matters/issues to successful closure.
• Understanding and working knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulations.
• Experience in administering multiple contract types (Cost recovery, T&M/LH, FFP, IDIQ).
• Proven exceptional strategic communication skills, both written, verbal, and presentation, to effectively communicate business cases to all levels of peers, suppliers, as well as program and executive management, with an ability to persuade and motivate action.
skills:

• Familiarity with Mission Solutions programs is considered a plus.
• Ability to coach and mentor less experienced team members.
• Working knowledge of the Lockheed Martin Global Supply Chain organization.
• Business acumen, attention to contractual detail, and ability to make business-based decisions.
• Ability to organize and prioritize assignments.
• Ability to analyze a problem and recommend solutions
• Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment and work well under pressure.
• Demonstrated experience with the Lockheed Martin Acquisition procedures.
• Experience in negotiating favorable outcomes in supplier negotiations.

• By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities, within Lockheed Martin, where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match.

• Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

• Work/life balance, family-friendly environment … we have a 9x80 schedule which means: 25 three-day weekends
• Career development, career growth, and lots of learning opportunities for aspiring minds
• Fun, talented, and witty teammates
• Knowledgeable, supportive, and engaged leadership
• Diverse, inclusive and community-minded organization
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition
• Generous Tuition Reimbursement

 Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package here. https://candidate.lmbenefitscompass.com

At Space, we value your skills, training, and education.  We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin Space employee. Come, join us and experience your future!

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers pursue the hardest missions. Those that demand exceptional amounts of courage, resilience, and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

…just to name a few reasons to join Lockheed Martin Space!

title: Contracts Manager
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Contracts Manager responsibilities include:

- All aspects of contract administration including proposal support and negotiation, post- award contract administration, scope management, and contract closeout
- Providing guidance, advice and counsel to programmatic and technical staff regarding contract interpretation issues, contract scope issues, and other contract- related matters
- Review and evaluate customer requests for proposal and provides risk assessments and coordinates proposals
- Developing and executing negotiation strategies
- Develops and applies solutions to complex problems which require the regular use a high degree of ingenuity, creativity, and innovation
- Building and maintaining effective working relationships with internal and external customers
- Managing, mentoring, training and providing contractual guidance to junior employees

This position is located at a facility that requires special access. U.S. Citizenship is required.

The ideal candidate will be located in one of the geographic regions listed. Telecommuting is an option.
qualifications:
• Must be an experienced leader.
• Experience providing strategic and sound business advice to senior leadership.
• Experience with multiple type contracts - for example CPFF, CPIF, CPAF, T&M or FFP.
• U.S. Government (FAR) and commercial (non FAR-based) contracting experience.
• Experience identifying contractual risk and understanding the financial implications.
skills:
• 3-5 years of supervisory experience.
• 3+ years of direct commercial sale and international contracts experience.
• Experience with NASA and NFS.
• NCMA and/or IACCM certification highly desired
• Must have the ability to exercise initiative, participate in strategy development, and work in an independent manner.
• Excellent communication skills
• Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.

title: ISSO - Classified Cybersecurity Staff
description:
A final Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility is required for the position with the ability to obtain a Polygraph.

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.

Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

The Cybersecurity Staff will partner with the security team, program, and government customers to perform as an Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) for Special Access Programs located at the LM Waterton facility in Littleton, CO.

Responsibilities include:

- Oversee day-to-day information system security operations including assisting the ISSM on all technical security matters.
- Carry out technical administration of IS in accordance with internal LM and customer security requirements, primarily Risk Management Framework (RMF).
- Participating in auditing and continuous monitoring of the IS.
- Review and oversee RMF Package authorizations.
- Upkeep, monitor, analyze, and respond to security events.
- Document compliance actions within the approved automated compliance tracking system or develop a plan of actions and milestones (POA&M).
- Ensure systems are operated, maintained, and disposed of in accordance with internal security policies and practices.
- Ensure configuration management (CM) for security-relevant IS software, hardware, firmware, and system documentation.
- Ensure all information systems lifecycle management documentation are maintained.
- Evaluate proposed changes or additions to the information system, and advise the ISSM of their security relevance.
- Assist and conduct security IS education and training.
- Participate in internal/external security audits/inspections; performs risk assessments.
- Assist in conducting investigations of computer security violations and incidents.
- Ensure proper protection and corrective measures are taken when an incident or vulnerability has been discovered.
- Implement and enforce Information Security Policies and Procedures together with ISSM and CPSO.

This is a mid-career position. Candidate will typically have a Bachelor's Degree and 9+ years of experience.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Lockheed Martin. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
qualifications:
• TS/SCI clearance with the ability to obtain a CI Polygraph
• DoD 8570 IAM Level II certification or higher
• Demonstrated auditing and investigation experience
• Knowledgeable of operating system security requirements to include Linux, MS Windows/Server, IOS
• Experience evaluating and implementing STIGs
• Hands-on experience with industry standard Information Assurance tools
• Significant experience with RMF in support of achieving ATOs
• Knowledge of Xacta, eMASS, ServiceNow or equivalent
skills:
• Hands-on experience with ICD 503
• Hands-on experience with DoD SAP environments preferably JSIG
• Experience implementing, maintaining and using Splunk, NESSUS, SCAP, STIG Viewer
• Experience with analyzing security logs utilizing SIEM tools
• Experienced technical writing skills for processes, procedures, and policy documentation

title: Senior Agile Software Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

Space Protection Programs is seeking a skilled Software Engineer and Agile Leader who can guide a team through a complex mission application software development lifecycle. Candidate must have the ability to take ownership of software development activities and drive the application of agile methods that require a multifaceted execution approach, depending on the time-phased needs of the program. Responsible for frequent use and application of software engineering standards and techniques, including Object Oriented Design and Agile development techniques in addition to the training, coaching, and mentoring of agile teams and leaders. Will work in a highly collaborative environment with frequent and direct interaction with peers and occasional customer interactions.

Experience with C/C++, Python, WindRiver and Linux OS, and Object-Oriented design is preferred. Strong ability to perform on a small highly skilled team in a dynamic environment. The preferred candidate must work under general supervision, multi-task, adapt to change, and possess strong organizational and communication skills. Experience with algorithm/object-oriented development is also desirable. Occasional odd and/or extended hours may be required to meet program milestones.

In this exciting role you will:
• Be a leading member of an Agile development team. Conduct Agile Release Planning, Sprint Planning, and guide agile development execution. Provide leadership in the guidance and mentorship of agile methods to a multi-disciplined team of software and systems engineers.
• Participate in embedded software development and/or software test activities.
• Act as a role model for the team. Lead by doing.
• Exercise considerable latitude in determining approaches to assignments.
• Evaluate sprint results and provide feedback to team members and project stakeholders.
• Learn new tools independently.
• Identify opportunities for improvement in current processes and implement new processes.
• Create schedules for software and test completion.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking. • Medical
• Dental

• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
qualifications:
• Active TS/SCI clearance with Poly required.
• Minimum BS degree and 5 years of experience in software engineering or a related technical discipline.
• Previous C, C++, or Python experience supporting the development of flight vehicle GNC/FSW architectures.
• Knowledge of embedded systems architectures and test experience using embedded systems.
• Demonstrated experience using the Agile methodology in the development, integration and test of complex software systems and environments.
• Demonstrated experience with the management and control of schedule/scope/cost on a challenging program.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong social skills, and ability to build consensus among peers while building solid relationships across Agile Development Teams.
skills:
• Experience executing projects with agile processes and tools
• Programming background in C/C++ and Python.
• Control account manager (CAM) experience.
• Experience with leading process improvement initiatives.
• Experience with program lifecycle execution from concept phase through end-of-life phase.
• Comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic multi-disciplinary environment.
• Ability to recommend metrics that help agile teams and organizations measure and improve their effectiveness and increase their value delivery.

title: ISSO - Classified Cybersecurity Sr
description:
A TS/SCI clearance with the ability to obtain a CI Polygraph is required for this position.

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

LMS Cybersecurity is looking for an assertive and self-confident Cybersecurity professional to partner with the security team, program and government customers to perform as an Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) for Information Systems (IS) located at the LM Waterton Campus in Littleton, CO.

The ISSO will oversee day-to-day information system security operations including hardware and software implementations. Under general direction, the ISSO carries out technical administration of IS in accordance with internal LM and customer security requirements under the Risk Management Framework (RMF). Must be able to work independently as well as with teammates and be adaptable to diverse office situations, procedures and requirements. As an ISSO you will ensure compliance with contract security specifications, customer governing requirements, Assessment and Authorization Process, and LM Space security policies.

Job duties include:
- Auditing of the IS
- Constant upkeep, monitoring, analysis, and response to network and security events
- Documents compliance actions within the approved automated compliance tracking system or develops a plan of actions and milestones (POA&M) with the Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM) to address non-compliance in the allotted timeframe
- Ensures systems are operated, maintained, and disposed of in accordance with internal security policies and practices outlined in the security plan
- Ensures configuration management (CM) for security-relevant IS software, hardware, and firmware is maintained and documented in accordance with baseline
- Evaluates proposed changes or additions to the information system, and advises the ISSM of their security relevance
- Ensures all information system security-related documentation is current and accessible to properly authorized individuals and maintained in accordance with requirements
- Assist and conduct security IS education
- Participates in internal/external security audits/inspections; performs risk assessments
- Assists in conducting investigations of computer security violations and incidents, reporting as necessary to the Facility Security Officer, ISSM and Senior Program Managers
- Ensures proper protection and / or corrective measures have been taken when an incident or vulnerability has been discovered
- Communicates, implements and manages a formal Information Security / Information Systems Security Program together with ISSM and contract program security representative (PSR)

Venture into the world of security that most people know only from headlines and sci-fi movies!

Candidate will typically have a Bachelor's Degree and 5+ years of experience.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Lockheed Martin. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
qualifications:

• Hands on auditing and investigation experience
• Knowledgeable of operating system security requirements
• Hands on experience with industry standard Information Assurance tools
• Experience with A&A process

skills:

• Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 5 years of professional experience; or 3 years of professional experience with a related Masters degree
• DoD 8570 IAM Level III certification
• Experience with Xacta/Service Now or eMASS
• Experience configuring/managing network equipment (switches, routers, IDS, firewalls)

title: Program Manager
description:
The PM for this position will have experience with Managing full lifecycle of Software Development programs including Agile Development methodologies.
Responsible for managing the Trusted Security Solutions program. This program supports the sustainment and development of two Cyber Security Cross Domain Solution product lines (the Trusted Manager and Radiant Mercury). This includes the field support of 1300 systems deployed worldwide.
The PM will be responsible for collaborating with E&T, and Business Development to shape the future of the product line and contract growth in the Portfolio area.
Directs all phases of the program from inception through completion. Responsible for all aspects of program cost, schedule and technical performance and execution.
qualifications:
10+ years of Experience with Program Management leading engineering teams in matrix environment across multiple sites. Experience working across Market Segments and Business Areas to leverage synergies and drive growth.
The Candidate should also have Capture Management Experience. Leadership experience and skills, strong interpersonal skills, excellent communication skills, oral and written. Experience with managing the sustainment of multiple product baselines and multiple customers.
skills: Experience with the following customers: NSA, Naval Information Warfare Center (NIWC) Pacific, PMW 130, AF DCGS-Warner Robins, LM Internal Customers (ex. LM Aero), and Various FMS CDS Customers. Basic working knowledge of: Cyber Security, computer networking and the Linux operating system.  Experience with multiple contract types to include: IDIQ (task order and delivery orders), CPFF and FFP.

title: Software Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. The successful candidate will serve as a software developer for a team tasked with setting up an open architecture infrastructure and developing web services and modern user interfaces to meet mission needs.

You will be designing state-of-the-art concepts while delivering innovative and affordable capabilities in a new and emerging area of protecting USG space assets. You will be working on a mission that you can be proud of, knowing that you are making a lasting difference in the world and in space. Candidate must be able to lead systems thinking, coordinate cross-team development, drive quality, and shoulder accountability for major aspects of mission and program success. Candidate must have the ability to adapt to agile methods that will require a dynamic execution approach, depending on the time-phased needs of the program.
