title: C2BMC SW Architect
description:
Are you ready to join Lockheed Martin's C2BMC team in Colorado Springs? Then come join us as a Software Architect where your responsibilities will include defining and leading all aspects of the implementation of the overall software architecture for a Java-based missile defense command and control system. You will also ensure the architecture is consistent with the architecture design tenets on the C2BMC program.

This includes providing direct technical support to the chief architect and coordinating across engineering fields (e.g. Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Integration & test, sustainment).

EXAMPLES OF TASKING TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE:
- Perform trade studies and analysis for current and future C2BMC development activities

- Maintain the software architecture artifacts for the program, overseeing the development of all software design documentation

- Determine ramifications and impacts of proposed architectural changes to the software baselines

- Analyze system performance to include quantifying performance, identifying bottlenecks, and measuring throughput

- Support briefings, presentations and demonstrations to customer

- Support analysis, design, and implementation of cyber requirements in the software
qualifications:
*Must currently have an active DoD Secret Security Clearance to be considered for this position*

Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 9 years of professional experience; or 7 years of professional experience with a related Master's degree

Software engineering and architecture experience on large software systems to include:

- Recent experience in software architecture and distributed systems design and implementation

- Experience performing trade studies and analysis across software engineering subject areas

- Familiarity with the system engineering discipline

- Hands-on application development experience in the use of the Java (or similar structured programming languages)

- Previous experience with missile defense, command and control and software architecture

HERE ARE SOME OF THE BENEFITS YOU CAN ENJOY:
- Medical (some LM locations have on-site medical)
- Dental
- 401k (with generous matching)
- Paid time off including, (we have a 4/10 Flex schedule which means every Friday off!)
- Work/life balance, family-friendly environment
- Generous Tuition Reimbursement

LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR COMPETITIVE AND COMPREHENSIVE BENEFITS PACKAGE:
https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits

The Testbed & Simulation group is looking for a talented software engineer to join a high-performing team. We are seeking someone with a team-oriented attitude and work style that will collaborate effectively and drive improvements into the Tb&S Digital Twin Simulation group. title: Research Engineering Senior Manager
description: The Senior Manager for Research and Technology leads expert research project/program managers and Lockheed Martin’s most critical enterprise portfolios in the Research and Technology organization under the office of the Vice President and Chief Technology Officer in Corporate. The Research and Technology team works in a “Team of Teams” manner with leaders across the enterprise, customers, and partners/suppliers. The Research and Technology senior manager partners with colleagues in the business areas to manage Research and Development portfolios which identify and develop generation-after next technologies critical to the future success of the corporation. You will play a vital role in defining our future by driving innovative solutions for our customers. The charter is to work collaboratively across the enterprise to enable the next generation of Lockheed Martin operations and manufacturing technologies.  You will lead development of advanced manufacturing technologies within the Emerging Technologies team and lead research project managers who collaborate with the Lockheed Martin advanced manufacturing community.  The senior manager leads expert, high level research experts responsible for facilitating project/program definition, guidance, and management (cost, schedule, technical execution, transition planning and facilitation).Position may be located at any major Lockheed Martin site.

title: Sr. Electrical Harness Design Engineer
description:
Are you ready to take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO?

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

We are a community of engineers looking for a dependable early career engineer to join our tight-knit group. This role will support many of the Programs that LM Space supports, where partnership, integrity, and reliability are prioritized.

The Harness and Cable Design group is an organization that is responsible for mechanical and electrical design tasks relating to wire harness, cable design, and interconnecting of electronic equipment. This position is for an Electrical Engineer that collaborates well in a team environment, has excellent communication skills, and proactively takes initiative.

This role will be responsible for interpretation and accurate implementation of detailed component performance specifications and Interface Control Drawings (ICD). Support will include helping our team meet safety, schedule, and cost as it relates to Spacecraft Harness Design.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY WILL INCLUDE:
• Technical development and coordination of harness and cable wire connection lists
• Engineering change support
• Schematic capture of wiring diagrams.

Additionally, your contributions will aid in investigating design factors such as part availability, manufacturability, ease of assembly, weight, and cost.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES MAY INCLUDE:
• Documentation release
• Testing requirement definition
• Interface Control Drawing (ICD) interpretation
• Detailed Component Performance Specification interpretation
• Conceptual designs
• Trade studies.

Strong collaboration skills will be key to success as you work alongside early career and experienced engineers in partnership with other disciplines, such as Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, and Quality Engineering.

As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a flexible and dynamic team environment while gaining direct product knowledge from experienced engineers. Additionally, there will be numerous opportunities to help represent the Harness and Cable team, with many opportunities for career development along the way.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
• 5 - 9 years of professional experience for this role.
• Willingness to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI w/Poly clearance, thus US Citizenship is required for this position.

BENEFITS OF EMPLOYMENT:

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Lockheed Martin. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

• Coursework/experience in electrical design.

• Fluency in ECAD applications (Zuken E3, etc.) tools.

• Willing and able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI w/Poly Clearance.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Have you always wanted to know about Space Protection Programs (SPP) ?

When you join SPP you will be part of one of the most innovative and fastest moving organizations in Space. Come help build end-to-end Space Security Systems for the DoD and other customers. Our cutting edge capabilities assure the security and health of our nation’s space assets. We push the boundary of what gets done in space. One day people may hear the full story of your achievements. When the history books are written, they may discover the critical role you’ve played to defeat the enemies of freedom. Come be one of the women and men working quietly to keep the light of liberty shining. As a Space Element testbed and simulation engineer for Space Protection Programs, you will directly help establish the technical solution for one of our country's most vital and complex Space Systems.

You will work closely with a team of top technical talent from across the program to provide the best, integrated solution that meets overall performance, cost and schedule needs. This smallsat SPP program is built around a fast-paced, build-test-learn culture, with one of the most audacious set of mission objectives within LM-Space.

In this exciting role you will:
• Develop and integrate Simulations and Models to accurately predict the behavior of the system
• Integrate lower level (e.g. subsystem) models into the system model to enable a comprehensive and integrated perspective of system performance
• Use your excellent communication skills to work across the Lockheed Martin organization and customer/user community to ensure consensus and understanding of system performance and trades
• Lead the development of testbeds, automated test scripts, procedures, telemetry displays, limit files, Test Information Sheets, and other documentation used to conduct Space Vehicle (SV) and Subsystem level testing
• Be responsible for integrating a complex set of processor in the loop (PIL), hardware in the loop (HWIL) and FlatSat environments spanning a diverse set of hardware (avionics, sensor engineering development units, payloads) and software domains (GNC, mission-specific algorithms, hardware peripherals)
• Building demonstrations that shows evolving hardware and software maturity for the customer
• Develop and manage a system-level continuous integration (CI) release stream that’s compatible with the various development and verification environments

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin cultivates an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

title: Cyber Security Analyst
description:
Lockheed Martin invites you to step up to one of today’s most daunting challenges: the use of advanced electronics to undermine our way of life. As a cybersecurity professional at Lockheed Martin, you’ll protect the networks that our citizens and the world depend upon each minute: Financial assets. Healthcare information. Critical infrastructure. Hazardous materials. The uninterrupted flow of energy that keeps modern life moving. Here, you’ll work with cybersecurity experts on the forefront of threat protection and proactive prevention. In this fast-paced, real-world environment, you’ll draw on all of your education and experience as well as the resources of Lockheed Martin to keep the threats at bay.

The candidate will be a member of the Network Assurance Team supporting a US Government customer as part of our Ogden, UT. The candidate will perform cyber threat intelligence analysis, correlate actionable security events, perform network traffic analysis using raw packet data, net flow, IDS, IPS and custom sensor output as it pertains to the cyber security of communications networks, and participate in the coordination of resources during incident response efforts.

Enter into the cyber terrain that most people know only from headlines and sci-fi. Become part of the Cybersecurity Team at Lockheed Martin. You are meant to make a difference.
qualifications:
-Hold DoD-8570 baseline certification (Security+, CEH, CYSA+, CISSP, or equivalent).
-Possess an active Secret security clearance.
-Practical experience with cyber specific analysis tools
-General understanding of intrusion detection and incident response
-Working knowledge of TCP/IP, common networking ports and protocols, network traffic flow, countermeasure techniques, OSI model, defense-in-depth, Cyber Kill Chain or similar attack model.
-Willing to perform shift work.
skills:
-Computer Network Defense experience (Protect, Detect, Respond, and Sustain) within a Computer Incident Response organization.
-Demonstrated understanding of the life cycle of network threats, attacks, attack vectors, and methods of exploitation with an understanding of intrusion set Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures.
-Demonstrated hands-on experience analyzing high volumes of logs, network data (e.g. Netflow, Full Packet Capture), and other artifacts in support of incident investigations.
-In-depth knowledge of architecture, engineering, and operations of at least one enterprise SIEM platform (e.g. Nitro/McAfee Enterprise Security Manager, ArcSight, QRadar, LogLogic, Splunk).
-Experience and proficiency with any of the following: Anti-Virus, HIPS, IDS/IPS, Wireshark, Full Packet Capture, Host-Based Analysis, intel threat analysis.
-Familiar with encryption methods and encoding of data
-Experience with malware analysis concepts and methods.
-UNIX/LINUX command line experience.
-Scripting and programming experience.
-Motivated self-starter with strong written and verbal communications skills, and the ability to create complex technical reports on analytic findings.

title: Program Planner/Scheduler (early to mid-career level)
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Space is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing team is on a mission to make a difference in the world. Every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to craft, design, and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and build incredible products. We provide the resources, support, and focus. You bring the passion and courage to envision limitless possibilities and we’ll build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters! Lockheed Martin Space builds satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for our government and commercial customers. Connecting people, advancing discovery, and protecting what matters most. Our satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide. As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. As that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you? Come, join our Program Management team in the dynamic world Space. Here, we are driven by innovation and integrity. By applying the highest standards of business ethics and a forward-thinking mindset, we believe everything is within our reach – and yours -- as a Lockheed Martin employee.

Our facility in Littleton, CO has an immediate opportunity for an early to mid-career level Program Planner/Scheduler to join our mission supporting the Commercial Civil Space (CCS) line of business in Littleton, CO. This is an exciting opportunity in which you will have the ability to support various programs in Deep Space, Advanced Programs, Weather and Earth Science, and Communications Satellite Solutions. As a Program Planner on our planning team, you will conduct and manage a variety of activities for programs and proposals.

Summary of Key Duties: In this role you will….

• Interface with programs, proposal teams and product teams on schedule related topics

• Identify and drive planning process improvements for the line of business

• Develop and maintain Integrated Master Schedules in MS Project Server

• Combine multi-functional inputs to encompass the end-to-end program lifecycle

• Conduct critical path & risk analyses and output into actionable data for the program

• Communicate schedule impacts and develop corrective action proposals

• Provide guidance to Control Account Managers in the application of Earned Value

• Develop schedules that incorporate contractual scope, workflow, and resources

Our employees working in this level of position typically have 5- 10 years of experience.


Join us. Let’s do Space!

title: Manager, Optical Payload Requirements & Verification
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for space applications as an Optical Payload System Engineering Manager! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

We are looking for a strong leader to drive the Optical Payload Requirements and Verification group for optical instruments. This department provides the Optical Payload systems engineering function within payload IPTs (Integrated Product Teams) to deliver optical subsystems to the LOBs (Lines of Businesses).

As Manager, you will:
• Champion the development of specifications for active / passive optical payloads.
• Advocate the use of consistent templates optical payload programs.
• Work closely with Payload IPTs leads and LOB leadership to understand mission drivers and key performance parameters. Fold emerging mission trends into current practices to ensure a discriminating edge.
• Enable common usage of products across multiple applications in Space, thereby strengthening designs.

We are seeking a colleague with strong verbal and written communication skills in order to build effective relationships across organizations, disciplines (electrical, mechanical, thermal, software) and with customers.

title: Executive Communications Specialist
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.

As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?

Every day, our 110,000 employees come to work with one focus – our customers’ missions. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience, and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

What does this role look like?

We Do Space at Lockheed Martin. Eleven Mars-bound orbiters and landers. The next human-rated spacecraft destined for the Moon and beyond. The first-ever comet sample return. The first 3D-printed parts in deep space. More interplanetary spacecraft than any other U.S. company. And we’re just getting started. Now we need your help in telling our story to the world

This role will offer you the following daily challenges:

We’re looking for a motivated communications professional to support executive communications as a member of the Lockheed Martin Space Communications team. Reporting to the Manager of Executive Communications, the person in this role will orchestrate key executive leaders across the Space business to deliver a compelling narrative using reputation-building channels, as well as secure internal and external opportunities for thought leadership. This position will have the unique opportunity to interact with leaders at the highest levels of the company and learn the fundamentals of being a trusted communications advisor for executive leadership. The successful candidate will be a highly organized, driven self-starter who can successfully manage multiple projects and deadlines.

• Build and execute an annual engagement strategy that helps key executives share a clear enterprise-wide vision and connects them more directly with internal and external stakeholders.

• Develop integrated communications plans and execute deliverables to ensure key executives are seen and heard in venues that provide clear opportunities to engage with stakeholders and shape dialogue.

• Work cross-functionally with members of the Space Communications team and key stakeholders across the business to ensure an integrated approach to communications engagements.

This position is in one of the Coolest places to work: Denver, Colorado.
qualifications:
To be successful, you will need to possess these basic qualifications:

• Bachelor's Degree in one of the following disciplines: Communications, Journalism, English or equivalent experience/combined education, with professional experience and specialized training commensurate with assignment.
• 5+ years relevant experience in corporate communications, PR, and/or marketing communications.
• Excellent writing and editing skills, including the use of AP Style.
• Experience creating and implementing communications plans.
• Ability to build both strategic and tactical plans that drive perceptions, deliver key messages and get results.
• Familiarity with a wide variety of communication channels, techniques and emerging technologies, with a natural curiosity that leads to continuous improvement.
• Proven exceptional strategic, written, and verbal communication skills, with an ability to persuade and motivate action.
• You will need to be a US Citizen, as well as successfully pass a drug and background check, in order to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
skills:
To be successful, ideally, you should also have:

• Attention to detail, adaptability, and a sense of urgency.
• Strong work ethic and positive attitude.
• A self-starter who can be depended upon to ensure the accuracy and quality of content with minimal day-to-day supervision.
• Ability to multitask, adapt and work well in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
• Ability to deal with ambiguity and work well under pressure with employees at all levels.
• Proven strong strategic communications mindset with experience delivering business results and success measures.
• Demonstrated interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders, including executive management.
• Comfortable providing coaching, new ideas, sensitive feedback, and real-world lessons learned to leaders at all levels.
• Project management experience.
• Demonstrated executive presence.
• Knowledge of Lockheed Martin's business.

title: Electro-Optical Payload Electronics CPE
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration, and seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for as a Payload Electronics Certified Principal Engineer (CPE)!

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems.

As a Payload Electronics CPE you will be: (a) working with Systems Engineering and subcontractors to develop specifications; (b) assuring optical payload electronic configuration Items, circuitry designs and electrical components with specific characteristics are within specified electrical requirements and perform according to specifications, (c) a part of a team developing designs, analyzes, and tests for electro-optical systems and components to drive common, high TRL payload products across programs.

Responsibilities include:
• Performing as a CPE for the development of optical payload electronics systems
• Leading design reviews, Engineering Material Review Board (EMRB) hardware discrepancy decisions and Failure Review Board (FRB) as required
• Resolving test anomalies and troubleshooting
• Generation, review and presentation of payload electronics Product Certifications
• Support of system level testing
• Providing technical guidance and direction to electronics vendors and LM electrical design teams to ensure compliance of optical payload electronics products with all program requirements
• Leadership of cross-functional development teams, coordinating with partners (e.g. subcontractor, customer, SEIT, and parts organizations)
• Ownership of optical payload electronics documentation (design, analysis, and interface definitions)
• Creation of technology maturation and risk reduction plans for critical electrical payload elements and subsystems
• Supporting proposal development activities for objective payload systems
• Coordinating with partners and stakeholders (e.g., subcontractor, customer, SEIT, and multiple M&P and parts organizations) and handling closure of Action Items and Liens
• Managing risk and identifying mitigation plans to meet productivity, quality, cost, schedule, and mission success objectives

jobcode: E2294:Mult Fnc Info Sys Anlst Stf
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

This position is a Project Lead within the Delivery Management Team. The Delivery Management Team is responsible for the deployment phase within the baseline life cycle. They are the project leads for the promotion of software baselines, COTS, GOTS and Hardware to the local test system and the operational system. They perform audits of baseline content, research and resolve inconsistencies from the audits, maintain the release content documentation, customize the detailed promotion installation checklist, conduct the execution of the promotion checklist during the baseline promotions, brief status to Management and Customers, lead the lessons learned and best practices process, maintains the team’s process and procedure documentation, and maintain promotion metrics. The operational system is a 24X7, large scale, Linux-based system written primarily in C++ using Oracle Relational Databases.

In this position you will:

• Develop and maintain executable plans/schedules to deliver COTS, GOTS, program specific custom software, and hardware to multiple locations;
• Be able to design, develop and analyze baseline releases containing software and hardware to produce schedule that manage timelines and interdependencies using historical data as a starting footprint that is tuned with process improvements;
• Using tools, be able to measure progress and anticipate resource dependencies/bottlenecks with detail reports that show where and slack exists or where schedules do not close;
• Enable team members to manage tasks, collaborate, and/or flag issues and risks to proposed schedules and with concurrence, make the necessary adjustments to the schedule;
• With reports, enable upper management to define business drivers, measure strategic impact of competing ideas, and view project and resource status across the enterprise.

title: Thrust Vector Control Design and Integration Lead
description:
As we enter a new era of Weapon Systems, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems! Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

Navy Strategic Programs (NSP) is experiencing significant growth, and we need your expertise to deliver amazing new technologies to our customers.We have opportunities that include sophisticated Hypersonic Technology, Glide Body Strike technology, and other key technology insertions. The early design and engineering phase provides you with tremendous career growth potential along with important assignments to stretch and hone your expertise. This is a rare opportunity to work closely alongside our Navy Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) partners to field a number of future strategic systems that the nation urgently needs. Lockheed Martin (LM) is looking for a dedicated Mechanical Systems Design and Integration Engineer to become a member of the Mechanical Controls Team.

The Thrust Vector Control Design and Integration Leadwill be responsible for leading the team in charge of the design, development, assembly, qualification, and integration of an electromechanical thrust vector control subsystem.

In this role, responsibilities will include:

• Provide technical expertise and leadership to ensure the Thrust Vector Control Subsystem design satisfies all requirements and is successful integrated into the next higher assembly
• Provide technical program management to subcontractors
• Lead the multidiscipline engineering team toward a common goal of on-time hardware delivery, integration, and successful flight test
• Support integration activities leading to ground test and flight test events
• Support Vehicle level integration and test activities in factory and at Launch Site
• Lead anomaly investigations related to your hardware and drive them to closure
• Travel on an as needed basis

Typically has 14 - 20 years of professional experience.

description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for space applications as a Staff Electro-Optical Engineer!

The Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Some of your specific responsibilities will include being the Certified Principal Engineer (CPE), and:
• Work with systems engineering and subcontractors to develop specifications
• Assure electronic circuitry designs and optical components with specific characteristics fit within specified mechanical & power limits and perform according to specifications
• Manage a team developing designs, analyzes, and tests for optical and electro-optical systems and components

We are looking for a strong background in electro-optical engineering. This would include both practical and theoretical knowledge of laboratory hardware for electro-optical sensor and component characterization. You should demonstrate effective verbal communication, develop concise and professional technical presentations, and deliver briefings to peers, leadership, and US Government customers. We are seeking a new colleague who is willing and able to work in a classified environment.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 7-10 years of professional experience, a Masters and 5-8 years, or a PhD and 2-5 years.

description:

As a Reliability Engineer, you will support the Systems Engineering (SE) Special Disciplines Organization in one or more of the following areas: Reliability and/or Anomaly Detection & Resolution (ADR) / Fault Management. In this role your responsibilities will include:
• Applying, maintaining and executing the Reliability & Maintainability (R&M) program plan per the customer requirements
• Working along with Domain Experts in various fields, performing analyses at all levels of the total system product over its life cycle to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal
• Working with Statements of Work (SOWs) and System Specifications to ensure the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total system solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints
• Performing or assisting in technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems

title: Systems Integration / Test Engineer, Senior Staff
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.  Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. By clicking on the links, you can find out more on how we proudly support Global Diversity and Hiring Our Heroes.

We are seeking a Systems Integration/Test Engineer to represent ATLO (Assembly, Test, and Launch Operations) on the Hawkeye Program within the Optical Center of Excellence (OPCoE) organization. You will work shoulder-to-shoulder and partner with Hawkeye OPCoE Leadership and Subject Matter Experts to successfully Assemble, Integrate, and Test Hawkeye products.

Summary of Key Duties for this position:
• Development and execution of the overall Assembly, Integration, and Test Plan
• Planning and execution of detailed schedules
• Reviewing Engineering Specs/Drawings and championing Design for Integration and Test (DFx) requirements that positively influence the system design for ATLO
• Identifying, designing, and fabricating Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE) and Mechanical Ground Support Equipment (MGSE)
• Preparing Facilities for Assembly, Integration, and Test (AI&T) activities
• Developing and releasing Integration & Test Procedures, Test Scripts, and Manufacturing Work Instructions
• Communicating ATLO status to peers, leadership, and customers
• Presenting at Program Management Reviews (PMR), Design Reviews (PDR/CDR), and Test Readiness Reviews (TRR)

title: Program Quality Eng Staff
description:
At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education.

Do you want to be part of a culture that encourages employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Come and experience your future!

The Program Quality Engineer will have responsibility for alignment of process & product quality on the C2BMC program. This position requires a strong understanding of Software Quality Assurance, Hardware Quality processes, Supplier Quality practices, and the ability to adapt to program needs. You will help to guide technical decisions that craft the software system design and drive design evolution. Having a Program Quality Assurance approach, you will use independent & objective judgement of process performance against Software, Network, and Cyber product quality. You will work side by side with engineering and program management, evaluating product and processes to drive detailed improvements, and facilitate those activities, to improve product quality and process cycle times. Using Supplier Quality practices, you will help ensure accurate flow-down & trace of standard and quality requirements to suppliers and subcontractors. There will be occasions for subcontractor Evaluations both programmatic and at the subcontractor site. Through an understanding of the Hardware Quality processes, you will review engineering drawings and Work Orders, inspect assembled product, and inspect installations at various CONUS and OCONUS locations. Additionally, you will recommend and analyze program and quality process performance and product quality metrics and drive their implementation with the ability to identify adverse trends, understand/identify risks, and drive effective corrective action. The candidate will collaborate with the Quality Program Manager and work closely with both the Quality team and the Multi-functional Product Teams apply, change, and maintain the quality management system that drives the delivery of objectives and features that the Missile Defense Agency customer has defined in their Statement of Work and C2BMC Element Specification, for operational deployment.

Additional Program Quality Engineer’s responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

•For issues discovered, facilitate Root Cause Analysis events that identify complete root causes and associated corrective actions.

•Evaluate process/product performance and participate/collaborate with the engineering counterparts on program activities to assure processes and products are compliant to contractual requirements.

•Supervise the product development including requirements allocation, architecture, design, development, integration & test, and acceptance of products and solutions.

•Ability to evaluate data to identify systemic issues and trends; provide reports to senior management.

•Provide inputs to the Quality Program Manager to ensure sound labor estimates on ECPs and ongoing proposal efforts.

•Perform HW Configuration audits and Software Configuration audits.

•Witness testing activities and formal quality testing, as required.
qualifications:
- Previous experience in Software Development Lifecycles (e.g., Agile, Iterative, Waterfall, Spiral). Previous experience in Systems Engineering Methodologies (Model Based and DoDAF).

- Experienced in performing Configuration Audits of both developed and COTS systems. Experienced in validating Software requirements sell-off and associated tool usage (such as DOORS, RTM, JIRA). Code and peer review experience.

- Experienced reviewer of technical documentation. Experienced root cause analysis practitioner. Experienced in writing and managing performance of corrective and preventative actions. Process auditing experience.

- Secret security clearance required to start.
skills:
- Software, Computer, and/or Electrical Engineering degree/background. 5+ years of quality engineering experience.

- Basic understanding of Software Languages (such as C#, C++ and Java).

- DoD contract experience.

- Knowledge of LM RMS process and procedures.

- Lean/Six Sigma black (or green) belt certification.

- Formal Process Auditing training and experience.

- Experienced with peer reviews of software systems or documents.

- Experience in Process and performance measurement: developing, collecting and analyzing metrics.

- Self-starter who is detail oriented, well organized and able to self-prioritize and complete tasks within in a dynamic and demanding environment. Strong interpersonal and conflict management skills working within a diverse environment and across many disciplines. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to build and provide briefings and status reports.

- Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Math, Computer Science or related professional experience.

title: Senior Focal Plane Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for space applications as an Electro-Optical Engineer!

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members integrate authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

Defending against modern day missile threats requires constant collaboration and innovation. That’s why we’re able to integrate systems from end to end so you can detect, control and engage the full spectrum of missile threats across every domain. We’re investing in disruptive technology like directed energy, space-based capabilities, and solid state-radar to create layers of defense that help keep us all safe.

Shooting a missile down with a missile was once a concept only dreamed up in science fiction novels. We’ve made it scientific fact!

So what does it take to spot an enemy missile launch, identify its intended target, calculate its exact trajectory, launch an interceptor and guide it to destroy the threat in mid-air all in a matter of seconds? It’s not easy – but at Lockheed Martin, we help customers solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our culture supports employees to dream big, perform with perfection and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

As an OPCoE Senior Focal Plane Engineer, your responsibilities will include:
• Work under broad guidance from senior engineering and program leadership
• Collaborate and contribute across the design team
• Guide the work of junior and emerging engineers
• Engage with prospective and selected suppliers
• Deliver robust documents and briefings
• Support customer reviews

You must have a strong understanding of physics and mathematics associated with design, development, and use of photo-detectors, readout integrated circuits (ROICs), and interface/control electronics and software for use in remote sensing and communications applications.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree with 5 years of professional experience, a Masters degree with 3 years, or a PhD.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:

• Medical
• Dental

• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
qualifications:
• Background in electro-optic sensors and/or electronics
• Experience with imaging focal planes and relevant performance parameters
• Practical and theoretical knowledge of laboratory hardware for electro-optical sensor and component characterization
• Experience with integration, test and verification of electronics and sensor systems
• Experience with electronics processor requirements and usage
• Experience deriving requirements and writing specifications based on customer requirements
• Experience in the development of verification plans and approaches to support development
• The ability to obtain and maintain a DOD security clearance; US citizenship is required
skills:
• Knowledge of a wide range of detector technologies for use in the full optical spectrum from ultraviolet (UV) through long-wave infrared (LWIR) wavelengths
• Experience with both direct-detection and coherent-detection techniques
• Ability to develop novel sensor concepts and architectures, including: strawman sensor concept design, architecture trade studies, feasibility analysis, modeling and simulation, optical design
• Expertise in optical theory and design, including radiometry, geometrical optics, physical optics, Fourier optics, adaptive optics, and/or fiber optics

• Knowledge and/or experience in related technologies, including:
• Real-time processing systems, FPGAs, micro-controllers, measurement and acquisition hardware
• Photonic-Integrated Circuit (PIC) physics, design, technologies and applications.
• RF electronics, analog electronics, digital electronics
• Control systems, including theory, design, and operation
• Signal and data processing, including processing hardware and software/algorithms

• Active TS/SCI

title: Laser Communications Engineer
description:
Come join the Lockheed Martin Space RF & Radar Payload Center of Excellence and shape the future! You can work on challenging programs in support of Space Vehicles, Hypersonics, Missile Defense and more.
The coolest jobs on this planet…or any other… are with Lockheed Martin (LM) Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus, and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.
Do you have a passion for working on emerging technologies?
As a Laser Communication Engineer with LM Space you will contribute toward the development and delivery of Laser Communication subsystem solutions for space platforms. Laser Communication subsystems are an emerging need for our platforms and serve missions ranging from human space flight, commercial broadband services, national intelligence, protected communications, Pointing/Navigation/Timing, and more. Our product portfolio addresses the critical needs of our commercial, civil, and government customers to field 5G communication solutions.
The Laser Communication Engineer will contribute to the design, development, test and integration of space-based optical communication systems. You will develop specifications, perform product trade analyses, execute detailed implementation, conduct laboratory and field testing, validate performance through analysis and testing, certify a deliverable product, and/or integrate the product onto a space vehicle.
The Laser Communication Engineer emphasizes ‘systems thinking’ throughout the product lifecycle. To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin nurtures an inclusive work environment that inspires diverse perspectives and big-picture thinking.

title: Model Based Systems Engineer
description:
Your invitation to a forward-thinking future!

As we enter a new era of Weapon Systems, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our outstanding people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, craft and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Do you have a passion for working on emerging technologies? Navy Strategic Programs (NSP) is experiencing significant growth and we need your expertise to deliver amazing new technologies to our customers. We have opportunities that include sophisticated Hypersonic Technology, Glide Body Strike technology, and other key technology insertions. The early design and engineering phase provides you with tremendous career growth potential along with important assignments to stretch and hone your expertise. This is a rare opportunity to work closely alongside our Navy Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) partners to field a number of future strategic systems that the nation urgently needs.

As a Systems Engineer for Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE), you will:
• Maintain MBSE environments, providing assistance and training to the engineering team as a subject matter expert on the relevant tools and processes
• Establish system architecture and CONOPS, perform system trades and analysis, flow down the architecture and CONOPS into requirements and interfaces, and support verification planning
• Perform technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and efficiency analyses for total systems—analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal
• Ensure the logical and detailed conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints
• Perform functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications

To promote the sharing of ideas, we at Lockheed Martin champion an inclusive work environment that supports differences and big-picture thinking.

Mission Solutions develops, delivers, and operates affordable engineering and sustainment solutions for commercial, military and intelligence users across the globe.

These mission critical efforts include development of innovative enterprise, cloud and application-based solutions for mission management, command and control, collection orchestration and tasking, processing, data analysis and analytics along with premier operations and sustainment capabilities of space- based programs in support of national security.

Establishes functional and technical specifications and standards, solves hardware/software interface problems, defines input/output parameters, and ensures integration of the entire system or subsystem.

Reviews, evaluates and derives requirements for testability, develops and directs preparation and execution of comprehensive test plans, procedures and schedules for complete systems and/or subsystems.

Coordinates subsystem and/or system testing activities with programs and other organizations.

Performs analysis of test results and prepares comprehensive subsystem and/or system level evaluation reports which verify and validate system performance at the CI level.

Writes discrepancy reports and performs integration regression testing to verify/validate incorporated fixes to software, components, subsystems and systems.

We're seeking candidates who are passionate about their craft, adamant about product quality and focused on our customer’s mission. We constantly measure our employee’s success and reward our top performers through salary increases, bonuses and awards.
You will be designing state-of-the-art concepts while delivering innovative and affordable capabilities in a new and emerging area of protecting USG space assets. You will be working on a mission that you can be proud of, knowing that you are making a lasting difference in the world and in the Space domain.

You will serve as a DevSecOps and IT Engineer for a team tasked with setting up an open architecture infrastructure and developing web services and modern user interfaces to meet mission needs. You must leverage data gathered from integration and system tests, i.e. system metrics and service telemetry, to classify and solve critical issues. You will adapt to ever changing environments and provide support when and where needed. You will write and maintain cutting edge infrastructure as code (IAC) to support micro-service based products.
You will be working side by side with extraordinarily talented and experienced engineers, while having the opportunity to lead and mentor less experienced individuals on the team.
Candidate must be able to lead systems thinking, coordinate cross-team development, drive quality, and shoulder accountability for major aspects of mission and program success. Candidate must have the ability to adapt to agile methods that will require a dynamic execution approach, depending on the time-phased needs of the program.

title: Optical Payload Designer, Senior Staff
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should consider joining the Lockheed Martin Space Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) as a Staff Optical Payload Designer! OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our members bring together authorities across the nation, within Lockheed Martin, our industry partners and leading research universities, into one fast-acting, collaborative group.

As an Optical Payload Designer, your responsibilities will include being the lead optics designer on one or more of OPCoE's critical programs.

You would typically have a Bachelors degree and 14-20 years of professional experience, a Masters and 12-18 years, or a PhD and 9-15 years.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.

title: Proposal Analyst Stf
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

Do you have a passion and dream to be a difference maker? Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can contribute to a very important mission? Come and be part of our team in the dynamic world of Lockheed Martin Space. We are seeking strategic thinkers to develop proposals and secure pursuits to further connect Lockheed Martin Space to the advancement of discovery, and protection of what matters most, while benefiting the future of our country.

This position offers an exciting opportunity to join the LM Space estimating organization and will be a key member in the LM Space Central Estimating organization which is responsible for the LM Space Estimating System. The successful candidate will:

• Provide strategic guidance to LM Space proposal teams and management throughout proposal development, negotiation and certification activities to ensure proposals are delivered in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and Lockheed Martin requirements.
• Driving quality and compliant proposals through leading a new Central Estimating review program supporting all Lines of Businesses (LOBs)
• Support all LOBs and Major Functional Organizations (MFOs) at LM Space which requires the ability to communicate with impact and build effective relationships.
• Identify and respond to changes in government acquisition regulation, policy and practice
• Analyze Estimating System health and performance through implementation of performance metrics, surveillance programs, and mitigating/corrective actions.
• Maintain LM Space Estimating Command Media and guidance documents
• Enable efficient estimating through administration of tools and processes that result in high quality cost proposals
• Develop and deliver training for the LM Space Estimating community focused on standards and tools to achieve high quality and fully compliant products for our customers


This position requires the ability to obtain a TS DoD clearance and a TS/SCI clearance (U.S. Citizenship Required).

title: Multi Functional Finance Analyst Senior
description:
Our world is a dynamic place, more so today than ever before. Come join us on Special Programs as we navigate the ever-changing global landscape. If you love all things space and get excited about the prospect of building premier spacecraft for our customers, then Special Programs is the place for you to make a difference. Do what matters.

The Military Support Program (MSP) within the Special Programs Line of Business is seeking an energetic and proactive person to join the Finance and Business Operations (F&BO) team. MSP offers a broad portfolio of contracts that fall into all stages of the product lifecycle (initial baseline, program execution and closeout), which creates an exciting and dynamic environment where the candidate should be comfortable with balancing competing priorities. Strong communication skills are required as this role interfaces with many functions (Planning, Program Management, Engineering, Subcontract Management, etc.).

The successful candidate will perform cost management and Earned Value Management (EVM) activities on multiple contracts within MSP including: support to Control Account Managers (CAMs), Integrated Product Teams (IPTs), and analysis of financial data in order provide information to the management team to enable sound business decisions.
Duties include:
• Establishing and maintaining control account budget baseline and estimates at complete.
• Analyzing EV performance data and advising CAMs on financial matters.
• Input and maintenance in cost tool (COBRA)
• Support Rolling Wave Planning, Integrated Baseline and Internal Surveillance Reviews.
• Interfacing with Planning to ensure cost and schedule integration meets expectations.

title: Mid-level Controls & Mechanisms Engineer (Opto-Mechanical)
description:
Are you passionate about state-of-the-art technology in space exploration? Do you like seeing your work applied to real life applications that travel to space? Then you should join Lockheed Martin Space’s Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE) for space applications as an OPCoE Opto-Mechanical Engineer.

OPCoE enables new frontiers in visible-light and infrared systems, missile defense, space exploration and much more. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. We are searching for a Mid-level Controls & Mechanisms Engineer with an Opto-Mechanical focus to support our GNC team. In this role you will support optical and directed energy programs by performing research, analysis, design to work effectively and thrive in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment. You will have strong communication skills, an excellent analytic skill set enjoy working in a dynamic and multi-disciplinary environment.

Some areas of responsibility include:
• Advanced control and stabilization concepts
• Jitter/beamwalk control
• Wavefront control
• Target detection, tracking, and filtering

We are seeking someone who demonstrates genuine interest in these subjects and who is eager to be mentored by a respected expert in the field. You should demonstrate the ability to to work effectively and thrive in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment. You will have strong communication skills, an excellent analytic skill set enjoy working in a dynamic and multi-disciplinary environment.

You would typically have a related PhD with 0-3 years of professional experience, a Masters with 3-5 years, or a Bachelors with 5-8 years.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.

Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
• Medical
• Dental
• 401k
• Paid time off
• Work/life balance
• Career development
• Mentorship opportunities
• Rewards & recognition

Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.

title: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Engineer Stf
description:
When it comes to using cutting-edge machine learning to tackle complex problems, Lockheed Martin is driven by a singular mission focus and desire to continuously innovate. Today’s challenges to global security aren’t just changing – they’re accelerating faster than ever before. Through our dedication to our mission, our AI-enabled systems are changing the way militaries operate and protect their forces, the way first responders fight fires, and how researchers explore the far reaches of space and the ocean’s depths.

The Lockheed Martin Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy professional with a strong background in software engineering, artificial intelligence and machine learning to support the Applied AI team and product portfolio, focusing on a broad range of projects across the LAIC. The team is focused on exploiting small, innovative and agile teams to rapidly iterate and mature solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the Lockheed Martin enterprise and in the field for our customers.

The selected candidate will focus on the development of technologies and products that leverage Artificial Intelligence to provide discriminating capability to our customers. This will require engagement in every phase of the system development lifecycle including requirements generation, system and software design, implementation, integration, and flight test. Activities will range from low TRL research, proof of concepts, development of prototypes, building demonstrators, and transition to production. The selected candidate can expect to utilize current AI paradigms including computer vision, deep learning, and reinforcement learning, applying these techniques to solve complex problems and field innovative solutions. The selected candidate will also be expected to assume technical lead responsibilities, take ownership of critical tasks and mentor junior engineers.

Must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time management and interpersonal skills.

There is a preference for the selected candidate to be based in Shelton, Connecticut with the core team. However, the selected candidate can work at any major Lockheed Martin facility or remotely.

Must be a US Citizen.
qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience, with 9 years of professional experience; or 7 years of professional experience with a related Master’s degree.
• Experience using machine learning frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow, MxNet, Caffe, etc.)
• Experience with Python and multiple libraries (NumPy, OpenCV, Scikit, Pandas, etc.)
• Experience with C++, Java, GO, and other compiled languages
• Experience with DevOps tools: Docker, Git [GitLab, GitHub], Continuous Integration [CI], Continuous Deployment [CD]
• Experience with modern Computer Vision
• Experience developing applications on Linux
• Experience with high-performance computing
• Experience with network/messaging (UDP, ZeroMQ, RESTful API, etc.)
• Experience interfacing with databases (SQL, MongoDB, etc.)
• Must be a US Citizen

• Experience with transitioning prototype software to production
• Experience leading large technical teams
• Familiarity with RF signal processing

title: Systems Engineer
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space. At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you. Are you a systems engineer looking for something different? Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can make a difference to a very important mission?

This is an exciting systems engineering position supporting the growing Space Security division within the Mission Solutions Line of Business. Lockheed Martin is seeking a creative and high energy Systems Engineer to support a ground breaking new mission area. Selected candidate will perform systems engineering tasks supporting a program through operations, using agile methodologies, and supporting customers interested in developing new system capabilities. Program efforts will include requirements analysis, mission engineering analysis, test and integration support, CONOPSs development, and customer interactions. We are looking for talented engineers who can deal with uncertainty and thrive in a fast-paced environment and on a high performing team.

Performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, mission analysis, orbital dynamics analysis, test, installation, operations, maintenance, and disposal. Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications.

title: Responsible Electronics Engineer, Power Subsystem Lead, TS/SCI
description:
Take your career to a new level and work at an extraordinary company in Littleton CO!

The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space!

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills, talents and experiences to design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Do you want join a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus—if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you!

As a Electrical Power Subsystem Responsible Electronics Engineer for LM 400, you will directly help establish the technical solution and overall system design for one of our country's most vital and sophisticated Space Systems!

RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:
• Lead the design and development of system and sub system power design for complex missions touching space and ground segments
• Perform modeling and analysis (such as Battery, Power Budget and Solar Array Power Performance) on power architectures to evaluate against mission and performance needs
• Ensuring the logical and detailed conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions
• Establishing system architecture and CONOPS, perform system trades and analysis, flow down the architecture and CONOPS into requirements and interfaces, and support verification planning

*Position is contingent upon program award expected September 2021.

== YOU WILL TYPICALLY HAVE: ===
• 9 - 15 years of professional experience.
• Must have an active TS/SCI clearance to be considered for this position.

title: Spacecraft Systems Engineer
description:
Have you always wanted to know about Space Protection Programs (SPP)?

When you join SPP you will be part of one of the most inventive and fastest moving organizations in Space. Come help build end-to-end Space Security Systems for the DoD and other customers. Our cutting edge capabilities assure the security and health of our nation’s space assets. We push the boundary of what gets done in space. One day people may hear the full story of your achievements. When the history books are written, they may discover the critical role you’ve played to defeat the enemies of freedom. Come be one of the people working quietly to keep the light of liberty shining.

As a Spacecraft Systems Engineer, you will:
• Define the Requirements and Verification Baseline
• Develop Specification and Interface Control Documents
• Support development of SPP program baselines, ground and flight test planning, and design reviews
• Participate in value driven Systems Engineering team and drive design evolution in a systematic and thoughtful way
• Work closely with customer counterparts to develop, test and field a strategic system

Are you a software engineer looking for something different? Are you looking for a growth opportunity where you can make a difference to a very important mission? The selected candidate will join the Arches program's Agile (scrum) Software Development Team. We're looking for a highly motivated and experienced software engineer to join our fast-paced development effort and contribute to the success of a very challenging and rewarding mission.

title: AI/Machine Learning Engineer
description:
When it comes to using cutting-edge machine learning to tackle complex problems, Lockheed Martin is driven by a singular mission focus and desire to continuously innovate. Today’s challenges to global security aren’t just changing – they’re accelerating faster than ever before. Through our dedication to our mission, our AI-enabled systems are changing the way militaries operate and protect their forces, the way first responders fight fires, and how researchers explore the far reaches of space and the ocean’s depths.

The AimLabs Consulting Team is looking for a high energy individual with a strong background in machine learning and data science to help grow its business and streamline AI processes. The selected candidate will apply machine learning techniques in support of missions through Lockheed Martin programs and business functions. This role will have a particular focus on supporting the development of machine learning products by working with stakeholders to understand their business needs, translate them into data problems, and then set the direction of projects to solve those data problems. This individual must drive the work from prototype through to completion and delivery of a minimum viable product or final product so that the business users capture value from the work of the team.
The AimLabs Consulting Team’s mission includes serving as a center of excellence for AI at Lockheed Martin. The candidate will work to disseminate best practices of the AimLabs Consulting Team to other AI and data science teams in the corporation. The candidate will be required to create knowledge materials to publish these best practices, as well as meet with other data science leaders in Lockheed Martin to teach and discuss these practices.
The responsibilities of this position include collaboration with business stakeholders to identify business opportunities and requirements to develop associated analytical models that deliver useful, actionable recommendations, or which augment human capabilities in various work settings. The candidate is responsible for modeling complex business and engineering problems, discovering insights and deploying AI capabilities using machine learning and associated feature engineering techniques. Responsibilities also include tracking projects and driving work on them through to completion, as well as implementing best technical practices from the fields of machine learning and software engineering.
The candidate will need a combination of business focus, creative thinking, strong analytical and problem solving skills, and programming knowledge to be able to quickly cycle hypotheses through the discovery phase of the project. Excellent communications skills to understand the needs of the business, and to communicate the value of the models built back to the business.
Domestic travel will be required when travel resumes.

MUST BE A US CITIZEN.
qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience, with 5 years of professional experience; or 3 years of experience required with a related Master’s degree.
• Previous experience building machine learning models by way of work, projects, courses, etc.
• Previous experience in applying any of the following machine learning areas to business problems:
natural language processing, deep learning, anomaly detection, reinforcement learning.
• Previous experience evaluating model performance, including performance metric selection.
• Previous experience with feature engineering and data cleaning/pre-processing.
• Experience with developing software and software engineering best practices.
• Demonstrated creativity and innovation in identifying valuable ways of incorporating machine learning into business workflows and processes.
• Superlative communication and interpersonal skills.
• The ability to stay updated on new technologies in the rapidly evolving field of AI.
• Must have strong problem-solving skills, business acumen, and demonstrated excellent oral and written communication skills.
• Experience in running data product projects from start to finish and interacting with end user customers.
• Experience with stakeholder communication and defining requirements
• Preferred languages: Python or R.
• Must be a US citizen

title: Electro-Optical Design Integration Lead
description:
The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the world’s hardest engineering problems. Do you want to be part of a culture that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? We provide the resources, inspiration and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

We are looking for an experienced systems engineer to act as a System Electrical Integration Lead working for the Optical Payload Center of Excellence (OPCoE), supporting various projects and programs. We will look for you to lead an electrical integration team at the element and subsystem level in support of a new hardware development effort. Responsibilities include:
• Leading hardware-software and hardware-hardware interface definition
• Providing technical guidance over subcontracted and in-house developed components
• Developing and maintaining a system level IFICL (InterFace InterConnection List) and related products
• Performing requirements flowdown, decomposition and verification planning
• Providing technical direction supporting development of an instrumentation database
• Conducting audits of end item hardware interface design, etc.

You must have excellent team, organization, communication, and leadership skills, and be skilled in resolving problems across multidisciplinary groups. You will be involved in extensive programmatic interaction with the customer and program personnel, spanning a wide range of leadership and management.

You would typically have a Bachelors and 14-20 years of professional experience, a Masters and 12-18 years, or a PhD and 9-15 years.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.
